praepositivus: <entryFree id="n37849" type="main" key="praepo^si^ti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praepŏsĭtīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>. In gram., <sense id="n37849.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that is set before</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prepositive</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vocales,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 561</bibl></cit> P.: <cit><quote lang="la">conjunctio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 409</bibl></cit> P.: <cit><quote lang="la">praepositiones,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 986</bibl></cit> P.</sense></entryFree>
praepositura: <entryFree id="n37850" type="main" key="praepo^si^tu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praepŏsĭtūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n37850.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the office of a chief</hi> or <hi rend="ital">overseer</hi>, etc. (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">militares,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Elag. 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">horreorum et pagorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 10, 70, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praepositus: <entryFree id="n37851" type="main" key="praepo^si^tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praepŏsĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from praepono.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n37852" type="main" key="praepo^si^tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praepŏsĭtus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, v. <itype>praepono</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> A.</entryFree>
praepossum: <entryFree id="n37853" type="main" key="praepossum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-possum</orth>, <itype>pŏtui, posse</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n37853.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to be very powerful</hi> or <hi rend="ital">more powerful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to have the superiority</hi>, <hi rend="ital">get the upperhand</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">postquam Macedones praepotuere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 5, 8</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">praepŏtens</orth>, <itype>tis</itype> (<hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> praepotentum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 3:14:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 3, 14, 2</bibl>), <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">very able</hi> or <hi rend="ital">powerful</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n37853.1" n="A" level="2"> Of persons: <cit><quote lang="la">clari ac praepotentes viri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:16:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Post. 16, 44</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:18:57" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 18, 57</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:30:109" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 30, 109</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">praepotentes fuimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:4:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 4, 15</bibl></cit> dub.—With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">praepotentes opibus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>very rich</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 5, 4, § 42</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rerum omnium praepotens Juppiter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:18:42" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 18, 42</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">praepŏtentes</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the powerful</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">opes praepotentium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:15:54" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 15, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">more praepotentium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iniquitas praepotentium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 19, 42, § 93</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37853.2" n="B" level="2"> Of things: <cit><quote lang="la">praepotens terrā marique Carthago,</quote> <trans><tr>powerful on land and sea</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:15:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 15, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">natura deorum praepotens neque excellens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:30:77" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 30, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praepotens et gloriosa philosophia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:43:193" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 43, 193</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praepotens gratae mentis impetus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:5:2:8" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 5, 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:7:2:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 2, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praeposteratio: <entryFree id="n37854" type="main" key="praeposte^ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praepostĕrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>praepostero</etym>, <sense id="n37854.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the reverse order</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>August.</author> Mus. 3, 9, 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praepostere: <entryFree id="n37855" type="main" key="praeposte^re_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praepostĕrē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. praeposterus <sense id="n37855.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
praeposteritas: <entryFree id="n37856" type="main" key="praeposte^ri^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praepostĕrĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>praeposterus</etym>, <sense id="n37856.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a reversed order</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inversion</hi> (post class.): si Juno est aër, Graeei nominis praeposte ritate repetita, i. e. <hi rend="ital">by transposing the letters<cb n="PRAE" />  of the words</hi> <foreign lang="greek">a)h\r</foreign> and <foreign lang="greek">*(/hra</foreign>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 3, 118</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">PARENS AFFLICTVS PRAEPOSTERITATE NATVRAE HVNC FILIVM VNICVM HIC CONDIDI,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4774</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praepostero: <entryFree id="n37857" type="main" key="praeposte^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praepostĕro</orth>, <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>praeposterus</etym>, <sense id="n37857.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to reverse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">invert</hi> (post-class.): ordinem, Auct. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Decl. 9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> Decl. 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">versus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>August.</author> Mus. 3, 9, 20</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praeposterus: <entryFree id="n37858" type="main" key="praeposte^rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-postĕrus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n37858.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">reversed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inverted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perverted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">distorted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">absurd</hi>, <hi rend="ital">preposterous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unseasonable</hi>, etc. (class.; syn.: intempestivus, perversus). </sense><sense id="n37858.1" n="I" level="1"> Of persons, <hi rend="ital">absurd</hi>, <hi rend="ital">preposterous</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut erat semper praeposterus atque perversus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:26:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 26, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:38:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 38, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 85:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 85, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37858.2" n="II" level="1"> Of things concr. and abstract: <cit><quote lang="la">praeposteri ficus,</quote> <trans><tr>figs out of season</tr>, <tr>too late</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 27, 51, § 117</bibl></cit>: natalis, <hi rend="ital">an inverted birth</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">with the feet foremost</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 8, 6, § 46</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeposteri aut praeproperi rigores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:208" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 18, 25, 57, § 208</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:216" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 17, 24, 37, § 216</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frigus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 23:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 23, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid tam perversum praeposterumve dici, aut excogitari potest?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:13:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Post. 13, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ne quid perturbatum ac discrepans, aut praeposterum sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:11:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 11, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempora,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 13, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gratulatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:32:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 32, 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consilia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:22:85" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 22, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ordo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:621" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 621</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praepostera et intempestiva oratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 5, 3</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">praepostĕrē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">in a reversed order</hi>, <hi rend="ital">irregularly</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">litteras reddere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:16:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 16, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agere cum aliquo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 20, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laevus calceus praepostere inductus,</quote> <trans><tr>the left inslead of the right</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 7, 5, § 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicere aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:9:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 9, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">syllogismo uti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:8:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 8, 1</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and praepostero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 3:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 3, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praepostus: <entryFree id="n37859" type="main" key="praepostus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praepostus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. praepono <sense id="n37859.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
praepotens: <entryFree id="n37860" type="main" key="praepo^tens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praepŏtens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, from praepossum.</entryFree>
praepotentia: <entryFree id="n37861" type="main" key="praepo^tenti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praepŏtentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>praepotens</etym>, <sense id="n37861.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">superior power</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">praepotentia Dei,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">horum (regum),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mund. 26</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praepoto: <entryFree id="n37862" type="main" key="praepo_to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-pōto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n37862.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> </sense><sense id="n37862.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to drink before</hi> (post-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 3:17:159" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 3, 17, 159</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n37862.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to give to drink</hi> or <hi rend="ital">make drink of before</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">praepotat absinthio aegrotantes vino sincero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 3:17:160" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 3, 17, 160</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 5:10:120" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tard. 5, 10, 120</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praeproperanter: <entryFree id="n37863" type="main" key="praepro^pe^ranter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praeprŏpĕranter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. praepropero <sense id="n37863.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
praepropere: <entryFree id="n37864" type="main" key="praepro^pe^re_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praeprŏpĕrē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. praeproperus <sense id="n37864.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
praepropero: <entryFree id="n37865" type="gloss" key="praepro^pe^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-prŏpĕro</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n37865.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to hasten greatly</hi>: praeproperat, <foreign lang="greek">propeteu/etai</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.—Hence, * <orth extent="full" lang="la">praeprŏpĕranter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">very hastily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very rapidly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">certare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:779" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 779</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praeproperus: <entryFree id="n37866" type="main" key="praepro^pe^rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-prŏpĕrus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n37866.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">too quick</hi> or <hi rend="ital">hasty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">over-hasty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sudden</hi>, <hi rend="ital">precipitate</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">praepropera festinatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 8, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prensatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">celeritas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenium,</quote> <trans><tr>rash</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nisus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:15:757" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 15, 757</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:6:3:6" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 6, 3, 6</bibl></cit>.— <itype>Hence</itype>, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">praeprŏpĕrē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">very quickly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very hastily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with over-haste</hi> (rare; <cit><quote lang="la">not in Cic. or Cæs.): peri praepropere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 4, 10</bibl></cit> (v. Ritschl ad h. l.): <cit><quote lang="la">festinans praepropere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:23:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 23, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">raptim omnia praepropere agendo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:19:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 19, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:6:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 6, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:8" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Oth. 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praepulcher: <entryFree id="n37867" type="main" key="praepulcher"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-pulcher</orth>, <itype>chra, chrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n37867.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very beautiful</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>), <bibl default="NO"><author>Juvenc.</author> 1, 432</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praepurgo: <entryFree id="n37868" type="main" key="praepurgo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-purgo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n37868.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to purge</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cleanse beforehand</hi> (post-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 1:4:128" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 1, 4, 128</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praeputiatio: <entryFree id="n37869" type="main" key="praepu_ti^a_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praepūtĭātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>praeputio</etym>, <sense id="n37869.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a retaining of the foreskin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the state of being uncircumcised</hi>, <hi rend="ital">uncircumcision</hi> (eccl. Lat.; <cit><quote lang="la">opp. circumcisio),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 5, 4</bibl></cit>; Hilar. Trin. 1, 13.</sense></entryFree>
praeputiatus: <entryFree id="n37870" type="main" key="praepu_ti^a_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praepūtĭātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, from praeputio.</entryFree>
praeputio: <entryFree id="n37871" type="main" key="praepu_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praepūtĭo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>praeputium</etym>, <sense id="n37871.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to draw out the foreskin</hi>, Schol. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:206" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 206</bibl>. —Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">praepūtĭātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">having the foreskin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">uncircumcised</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 5, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praeputium: <entryFree id="n37872" type="main" key="praepu_ti^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-pūtĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>vox hibr., prae<foreign lang="greek">po/sqion</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n37872.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the foreskin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prepuce.</hi>—In <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:238" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 238</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:99" default="NO">14, 99</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Apoc. 8:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Apoc. 8, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:17:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 17, 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">14</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n37872.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: circumcidite praeputium cordis vestri, <hi rend="ital">do away with impurity</hi>, Laet. 4, 17, 8; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,049:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Jer. 4, 4</bibl>. </sense><sense id="n37872.2" n="III" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the retaining of the prepuce</hi>, <hi rend="ital">uncircumcision</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,009:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gal. 5, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,010:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eph. 2, 11</bibl>. <cb n="PRAE" /></sense></entryFree>
praequam: <entryFree id="n37873" type="main" key="praequam"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praequam</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. prae.</entryFree>
praequestus: <entryFree id="n37874" type="main" key="praequestus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-questus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [queror], <sense id="n37874.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">complaining beforehand</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">multa praequestus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:251" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 251</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praeradio: <entryFree id="n37875" type="main" key="praera^di^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-rădĭo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n37875.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> </sense><sense id="n37875.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to beam</hi> or <hi rend="ital">glitter forth</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): pilenta praeradiant, Claud. Nupt. Honor. et Mar. 286.— </sense><sense id="n37875.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to outshine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Bacchi conjux Praeradiat stellis signa minora suis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:6:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 6, 116</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praerado: <entryFree id="n37876" type="main" key="praera_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-rādo</orth>, no <sense id="n37876.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>sum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> </sense><sense id="n37876.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To scrape</hi> or <hi rend="ital">shave off in front</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">latus alterum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 41</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Ep. 7</bibl>, sect. 2. —</sense><sense id="n37876.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To shear</hi> or <hi rend="ital">shave off before</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">praerasi capilli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 5:4:74" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 5, 4, 74</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 1:11:79" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Acut. 1, 11, 79</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praerancidus: <entryFree id="n37877" type="hapax" key="praeranci^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-rancĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n37877.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very stale;</hi> trop., <hi rend="ital">obsolete</hi>: finitiones, Probus ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:20:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 20, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praerapidus: <entryFree id="n37878" type="main" key="praera^pi^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-răpĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n37878.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very swift</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very rapid</hi> (post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n37878.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">amnis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Apoc. 7:2, v. 11" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Apoc. 7, 2, v. 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">celeritas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 1:1:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Q. N. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gurges,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:32:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 32, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fluminum celeritas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:4:15" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 4, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fuga,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:16:563" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 16, 563</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37878.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">very eager</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very ardent</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">juvenis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:17:180" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 17, 180</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fuga,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:16:564" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 16, 564</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ira,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 1:12:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 1, 12, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praerasus: <entryFree id="n37879" type="main" key="praera_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praerāsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from praerado.</entryFree>
praereptor: <entryFree id="n37880" type="main" key="praereptor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praereptor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>praeripio</etym>, <sense id="n37880.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who seizes a thing before another</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a forestaller</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">fllius, qui ad benedictionem fratris praereptor adstiterat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 36</bibl></cit>, n. 15.</sense></entryFree>
praereptus: <entryFree id="n37881" type="main" key="praereptus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praereptus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from praeripio.</entryFree>
praerigesco: <entryFree id="n37882" type="hapax" key="praeri^gesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-rĭgesco</orth>, <itype>gŭi, 3</itype>, <sense id="n37882.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to become exceedingly stiff</hi> (post - Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">ita praeriguisse manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 35</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praerigidus: <entryFree id="n37883" type="main" key="praeri^gi^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-rĭgĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n37883.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very stiff</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very rigid</hi> (late Lat.): mens, Auct. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Decl. 17:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> Decl. 17, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praeripia: <entryFree id="n37884" type="main" key="praeri_pi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-rīpĭa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>ripa</etym>, <sense id="n37884.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">places on the banks of a river</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">praeripia fluminis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 278, 17</bibl></cit> (dub.; al. praerupia, q. v.).</sense></entryFree>
praeripio: <entryFree id="n37885" type="main" key="praeri^pi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-rĭpĭo</orth>, <itype>rĭpui, reptum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>rapio</etym>. <sense id="n37885.0" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to take away</hi> a thing <hi rend="ital">before another</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to snatch</hi> or <hi rend="ital">tear away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to carry off</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">quid huc venisti sponsam praereptum meam?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 1, 14</bibl></cit>: Tun meo patre es prognatus? <hi rend="ital">Men.</hi> Immo equidem, meo. Tuom tibi ego neque occupare neque praeripere postulo, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:9:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 5, 9, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:2:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 1, 2, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maritum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:30:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 30, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arma Minervae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliis laudem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 1, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8</bibl>, prooem. § <cit><quote lang="la">5: cum ea praerepta et extorta defensioni suae cerneret, in quibus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:9:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 9, 16</bibl></cit>; cf. Hirt. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:56" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 56</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui cibos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 9, 11, § 27</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n37885.1" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n37885.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To snatch away before the time</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to carry off prematurely</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">deorum beneficium festinatione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:14:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 14, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">immaturā morte praereptus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Vir. Ill. 5" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Vir. Ill. 5</bibl></cit>: brevibus praereptus in annis, <hi rend="ital">snatched away prematurely</hi>, sc. by death, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:571" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 5, 571</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">IN PRIMO AETATIS FLORE PRAEREPTVS,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 350, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37885.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To take away quickly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oscula,</quote> <trans><tr>to snatch kisses</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:896" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 896</bibl></cit>: codicillos, <hi rend="ital">to take</hi> or <hi rend="ital">seize hastily</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:49" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 49</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n37885.4" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To forestall</hi>, <hi rend="ital">anticipate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non praeripiam,</quote> <trans><tr>I will not anticipate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 10, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostium consilia,</quote> <trans><tr>baffle in advance</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:30:108" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 30, 108</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scelere praerepto doles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Thyest. 1104" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Thyest. 1104</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37885.5" n="D" level="2"> With <hi rend="ital">se</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to take one's self off hastily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to make one's escape</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeripuit se ad amicum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:21:1:17" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 21, 1, 17</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praeroboratus: <entryFree id="n37886" type="main" key="praero_bo^ra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-rōbŏrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [roboro], <sense id="n37886.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">strengthened beforehand</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">praeroboratum corpus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 4:1" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 4, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praerodo: <entryFree id="n37887" type="main" key="praero_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-rōdo</orth>, no <sense id="n37887.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>sum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> </sense><sense id="n37887.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To gnaw in front</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to gnaw at the end</hi> or <hi rend="ital">tip</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">digitos suos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:3:2:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 3, 2, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">teneros pampinos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:Arbor. 15" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> Arbor. 15</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37887.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To gnaw</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bite</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">nibble off</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeroso hamo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:5:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 5, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praerosa dentibus lingua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 23, 23, § 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conger et muraena caudas inter se praerodentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:185" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 62, 88, § 185</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praerogatio: <entryFree id="n37888" type="main" key="praero^ga_ti^o_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praerŏgātĭō</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>praerogo</etym>, <sense id="n37888.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a distributing beforehand</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">annonae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> Myth. 1, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praerogativa: <entryFree id="n37889" type="main" key="praero^gativa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praerŏgativa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. praerogativus.</entryFree>
praerogativatius: <entryFree id="n37890" type="main" key="praero^gativatius"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praerŏgativatius</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>praerogo</etym>, <sense id="n37890.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one that enjoys certain privileges</hi> or <hi rend="ital">prerogatives</hi><pb n="1427" /> <cb n="PRAE" />  (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 11, 27</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 3:67" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 3, 67</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praerogativus: <entryFree id="n37891" type="main" key="praero^ga_ti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praerŏgātīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>praerogo</etym>, <sense id="n37891.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that is asked before others for his opinion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that votes before</hi> or <hi rend="ital">first</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prerogative</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n37891.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">centuria praerogativa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:20:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 20, 49</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=249" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 249</bibl> Müll.; Becker, Antiq. II. 3, p. 3 sq., and the authorities there cited; Mommsen, Die Röm. Tribus, p. 64 sq.—More freq., </sense><sense id="n37891.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">praerŏgā-tīva</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (sc. tribus or centuria). <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the tribe</hi> or <hi rend="ital">century to which it fell</hi>, <hi rend="ital">by lot</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to vote first in the Comitia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:45:103" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 45, 103</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">praerogativa Veturia juniorum (because it was double, juniorum and seniorum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:22:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 22, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum sors praerogativae Aniensi juniorum exisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:22:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 26, 22, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Q. Fabium et praerogativae et primo vocatae omnes centuriae consulem dicebant, i. e. the centuriae equitum who, in that ancient time, voted first,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:22:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 22, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: praerogativae sunt tribus, quae primae suffragium ferunt ante jure vocatas. Mos enim fuerat, quo facilius in comitiis concordia populi firmaretur, bina omnia de iisdem candidatis comitia fieri: quorum tribus primae praerogativae dicebantur, quod primae rogarentur, quos vellent consules fieri, secundae jure vocatae, quod in his, sequente populo, ut saepe contigit, praerogativarum voluntatem, jure omnia complerentur, Ascon. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:9:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 9, 26</bibl>.—Collect. of the same; praerogativa, with <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">praerogativa tribunum militum non petentem creant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:18:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 18, 1</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">praerogativae of two comitia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:9:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 9, 26</bibl></cit>: omen praerogativae, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the choice of the century that voted first</hi>, which was regarded as an omen, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:18:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 18, 38</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">praerogativam etiam majores omen justorum comitiorum esse voluerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:45:103" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 45, 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praerogativam referre, said of the herald who informed the magistrate holding the comitia of the choice of the century that voted first,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 35, 74</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">also praerogativam renuntiare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:33:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 33, 82</bibl></cit>.—Because the other tribes or centuries readily followed the praerogativa; hence, transf. </sense><sense id="n37891.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A previous choice</hi> or <hi rend="ital">election</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">militaris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">comitiorum militarium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:51:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 51, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n37891.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A sure sign</hi>, <hi rend="ital">token</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pregnostie</hi>, <hi rend="ital">omen</hi>: quod si triumphi praerogativam putas supplicationem, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 15, 5, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">voluntatis suae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:9:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 9, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fecunditatis in feminis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 16, 14, § 67</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37891.5" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Preference</hi>, <hi rend="ital">privilege</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prerogative</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">decoris in gemmis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 9, 46, § 129</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magni enim faciunt provinciales, servari sibi consuetudinem istam, et hujusmodi praerogativas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:16:4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 16, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:26:7:11" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 26, 7, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vetus illa imperatoriae domūs praerogativa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Eum.</author> Pan. ad Constant. 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> in Psa. 43, 13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">118</bibl>, Serm. 2, 14 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
praerogatus: <entryFree id="n37892" type="main" key="praero^ga_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-rŏgātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, v. praerogo <sense id="n37892.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
praerogo: <entryFree id="n37893" type="main" key="praero^go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-rŏgo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n37893.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To ask before</hi> another, <hi rend="ital">to ask first</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sententias, non more atque ordine, sed prout libuisset, praerogabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:35" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 35</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37893.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To pay beforehand</hi> or <hi rend="ital">in advance</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pensionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:19:2:19" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 19, 2, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">expensas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 10, 31, 20</bibl></cit>.— Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">praerŏgātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">asked before</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">cujus in honore non unius tribus pars, sed comitia tota comitiis fuerint praerogata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:20:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 20, 49</bibl></cit> (al. praerogativa): lex, <hi rend="ital">proposed previously</hi>, Cod. 16, 11, 1.</sense></entryFree>
praerosus: <entryFree id="n37894" type="main" key="praero_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praerōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from praerodo.</entryFree>
praerumpo: <entryFree id="n37895" type="main" key="praerumpo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-rumpo</orth>, <itype>rūpi, ruptum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n37895.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to break</hi> or <hi rend="ital">tear off before</hi> or <hi rend="ital">in front</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">retinacula classis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:547" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 547</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">funes praerumpebantur,</quote> <trans><tr>were broken off</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uncus praerumpitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:18:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 18, 2</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n37895.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to wrench</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tear to pieces</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">purgativa medicamina praerumpunt corpora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:21:128" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 2, 21, 128</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-ruptus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">broken</hi> or <hi rend="ital">torn off;</hi> hence, of places, <hi rend="ital">steep</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abrupt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rugged</hi> (syn.: abscisus, abruptus). </sense><sense id="n37895.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">saxa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:56:section=145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 56, § 145</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loca,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeruptum atque asperum jugum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 2, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeruptum undique oppidum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:40" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeruptus et difficilis descensus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:ib" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:6:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 6, 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mons,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 105</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rupes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:40" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fossae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 41</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">praerupta</orth>,<cb n="PRAE" />  <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">steep</hi> or <hi rend="ital">rugged places</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">praerupta collium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:41:1:11" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 41, 1, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">petere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:156" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 42, 64, § 156</bibl></cit>.—In <number>sing.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad praeruptum petrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,016:25:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Par. 25, 12</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeruptior collis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:13" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 13</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes oppidi partes praeruptissimis saxis munitae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:33" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 33</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37895.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">hasty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rash</hi>, <hi rend="ital">precipitate</hi> (post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n37895.4" n="1" level="3"> Of persons: <cit><quote lang="la">juvenis animo praeruptus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:16:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 16, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37895.5" n="2" level="3"> Of things: <cit><quote lang="la">praerupta audacia, tanta temeritas ut non procul abhorreat ab insaniā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:24:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 24, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dominatio,</quote> <trans><tr>hard</tr>, <tr>stern</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeruptum atque anceps periculum,</quote> <trans><tr>critical</tr>, <tr>extreme</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:2:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">seditio,</quote> <trans><tr>dangerous</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:28:3:6" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 28, 3, 6</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">praerūpium</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>prae - rupes</etym>, <hi rend="ital">the rocky wall</hi>, <hi rend="ital">line</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">wall of rocks</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">fluminis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. 8, p. 278 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit> (dub.; al. praeripia, q. v.); <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 6, 704</bibl>; <number>sing.</number>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 38</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praerupta: <entryFree id="n37896" type="main" key="praerupta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praerupta</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">praeruptus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. praerumpo.</entryFree>
praerupte: <entryFree id="n37897" type="spur" key="praerupte"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praerupte</orth>, a false read. for praealtus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 15, 43, § 149</bibl>; v. Sillig ad h. l.</entryFree>
praerutilus: <entryFree id="n37898" type="main" key="praeru^ti^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-rŭtĭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n37898.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very red</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>), Auct. Carm. de Judicio Dom. 202.</sense></entryFree>
praes: <entryFree id="n37899" type="main" key="praes1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praes</orth>, <itype>praedis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>prae and vas, vadis</etym>, <sense id="n37899.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a surety</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bondsman</hi> (in money matters; whereas vas denotes a surety in general; class.; cf.: sponsor, vindex). </sense><sense id="n37899.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">praedia dicta, item ut praedes, a praestando: quod ea pignore data publice mancupis fidem praestent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=40" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 40</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">praes, qui a magistratu interrogatus, in publicum ut praes siet, a quo et cum respondet, dicit praes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6</bibl></cit>, § 74; cf. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=223" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 223</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">manceps dicitur qui quid a populo emit conducitve: qui idem praes dicitur, quia tam debet, praestare populo quod promisit, quam is, qui pro eo praes factus, Fest. s. v. manceps, p. 151 Müll.: praedes dicuntur satisdatores locupletes pro re, de quā apud judicem lis est, ne interea, qui tenet, diffidens causae, possessionem deteriorem faciat, tecta dissipet, excidat arbores et culta deserat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0803,001:Cic. Verr. 2:1:45:section=115" default="NO"><author>Ascon.</author> Cic. Verr. 2, 1, 45, § 115</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praedes pecuniae publicae accipere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0803,001:Fam. 2:17:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fam. 2, 17, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praedem esse pro aliquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0803,001:Att. 12:52:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Att. 12, 52, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praedes dare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0803,001:Rab. Post. 4:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rab. Post. 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praedem fieri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0803,001:Att. 13:3:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Att. 13, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per praedem agere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0803,001:ib. 9:9:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 9, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praedes tenentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0803,001:Fam. 5:20:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 20, 3</bibl></cit>: cavere populo praedibus ae praediis, an old formula, signifying <hi rend="ital">to procure security to the people by bondsmen and their property</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0803,001:Verr. 2:1:54:section=142" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 54, § 142</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis subit in poenam capitali judicio? vas. Quid, si lis fuerit nummaria? quis dabitur? praes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praedesque eo nomine praetori dabuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 4:13" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 4, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jubebat praedes adversario dare litis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:ib. 4:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 16</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37899.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the property of sureties</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">praedes vendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:31:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 31, 78</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37899.3" n="III" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum sex libris, tamquam praedibus, me ipsum obstrinxerim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 1, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n37900" type="main" key="praes2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praes</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>prae</etym>, <sense id="n37900.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">at hand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">now</hi> (ante-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ibi tibi parata praes est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:4:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 2, 4, 17</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praesaepe: <entryFree id="n37901" type="main" key="praesaepe"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praesaepe</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">praesēpe</orth>), <itype>is</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">praesaepes</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">praesaepis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>; also, <orth extent="full" lang="la">praesaepĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">praesae-pĭum</orth> (each of these forms less correctly written <orth extent="full" lang="la">praesēp-</orth>), <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>praesaepio</etym>, prop. <sense id="n37901.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an enclosure</hi> of any kind; hence, <hi rend="ital">a stable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stall</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pen</hi> (syn. stabulum). </sense><sense id="n37901.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">praesaepis bubus hibernas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si villa habebat praesaepias laxas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:13:6" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 13, 6</bibl></cit> (al. praesaepes, al. praesaepis): <cit><quote lang="la">stabant ter centum (equi) nivei in praesaepibus altis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:275" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 275</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in praesaepibus ursi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nocturna claudere praesaepia,</quote> <trans><tr>folds</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0830,001:1:38" default="NO"><author>Calp.</author> Ecl. 1, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui bona donavit praesaepibus,</quote> <trans><tr>has expended his estate on his stables</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:59" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 59</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">A crib</hi>, <hi rend="ital">manger</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">bonas praesaepis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in praesaepiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">accedit ad praesaepe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:2:8:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 2, 8, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non altius edita esse praesaepia convenit, quam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praesaepium meum hordeo passim repleri jubet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 7, p. 194, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37901.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n37901.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A hut</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hovel; a dwelling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tavern</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quin reciperet se ad praesaepem suam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 2, 1, 13</bibl></cit>.—Mostly <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">scit, si id impetret, futurum, quod amat, intra praesaepis suas,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>in his own house</tr>, <tr>in his power</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:prol. 56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. prol. 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vocat me hic intra praesaepis meas,</quote> <trans><tr>into my house</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:3:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 4, 3, 99</bibl></cit>: fucos a praesaepibus arcent,<cb n="PRAE" />  i. e. <hi rend="ital">from the hives</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:168" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 168</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:435" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 1, 435</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">audis in praesaepibus,</quote> <trans><tr>in drinking-shops</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:18:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 18, 42</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37901.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A crib</hi>, com. for <hi rend="ital">a table</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">scurra vagus, non qui certum praesaepe teneret,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 15, 28</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37901.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The space between the two stars called Aselli in the sign of the Crab</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:353" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 35, 80, § 353</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praesaepia: <entryFree id="n37902" type="main" key="praesaepi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praesaepĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. praesaepe.</entryFree>
praesaepio: <entryFree id="n37903" type="main" key="praesaepi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-saepĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-sēpĭo</orth>), <itype>psi, ptum, 4</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n37903.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to fence in front</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to block up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">barricade</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">aditus atque itinera trabibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loca montuosa sublicis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omni aditu praesaepto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 7, 77</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praesagatus: <entryFree id="n37904" type="main" key="praesa_ga_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-sāgātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [sago], <sense id="n37904.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perceived beforehand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">presaged</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">scala,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 3</bibl></cit>, n. 4.</sense></entryFree>
praesagio: <entryFree id="n37905" type="main" key="praesa_gi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-sāgĭo</orth>, <itype>īvi, 4</itype> (in the deponent form: <sense id="n37905.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">animus plus praesagitur mali,</quote> <trans><tr>presages</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:4:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 4, 28</bibl></cit>), <pos>v. a.</pos> </sense><sense id="n37905.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to feel</hi> or <hi rend="ital">perceive beforehand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to have a presentiment of</hi> a thing (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">sagire, sentire acute est. Is igitur, qui ante sagit quam oblata res est, dicitur praesagire, id est futura ante sentire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:31:65" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 31, 65</bibl></cit>; cf.: praesagire est praedivinare, praesipere: sagax enim est acutus et sollers, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=223" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 223</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">praesagibat mihi animus, frustra me ire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc ipsum praesagiens animo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:11" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 11</bibl> (4, 10), 5: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid in futurum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equi praesagiunt pugnam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:157" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 42, 64, § 157</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37905.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to forebode</hi>, <hi rend="ital">foreshow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">predict</hi>, <hi rend="ital">presage</hi> (syn.: vaticinor, divino): exiguitas copiarum recessum praesagiebat, <hi rend="ital">foretold to me</hi>, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 10, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">galli canendo Boeotiis praesagivere victoriam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 21, 24, § 49</bibl></cit>: luna tempestatem praesagiet, Varr. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:348" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 35, 79, § 348</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praesagitio: <entryFree id="n37906" type="main" key="praesa_gi_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praesāgītĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>praesagio</etym>, <sense id="n37906.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a presentiment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">foreboding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the faculty of divining</hi> or <hi rend="ital">presaging</hi> (class.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">praedictio, divinatio, praesagium, praesensio): inest in animis praesagitio extrinsecus injecta, atque inclusa divinitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:31:66" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 31, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">divina,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 54, 123</bibl></cit>: praesagitio dicta, quod praesagire est acute sentire. Unde sagae dictae anus, quae multa sciunt, et sagaces canes, qui ferarum cubilia praesentiunt, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=255" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 255</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
praesagium: <entryFree id="n37907" type="main" key="praesa_gi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praesāgĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n37907.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a presentiment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">foreboding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prognostic</hi>, <hi rend="ital">presage</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">praesagitio): vatum praesagia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:879" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 879</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:6:510" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 510</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puella praesagio malorum jam vitae exempta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempestatis futurae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praesagium atque indicia futuri periculi,</quote> <trans><tr>indications</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:57:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 57, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praesago: <entryFree id="n37908" type="main" key="praesa_go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praesāgo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>praesagus</etym>, <sense id="n37908.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to forebode</hi>, <hi rend="ital">presage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">have a presentiment of</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">cogitatio praesagantis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prodigiosa ostenta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 235, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">futura rerum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Mag. 43, p. 301 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 3, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praesagus: <entryFree id="n37909" type="main" key="praesa_gus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-sāgus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n37909.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">foreboding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">foretelling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">divining</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prophetic</hi>, <hi rend="ital">presaging</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post - Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">praesaga mali mens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:843" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 843</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fulminis ignes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 177</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">luctus suspiria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 124</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:3:514" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 514</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ars,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:434" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 5, 434</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">astra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:8:145" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 8, 145</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">responsa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nares, Firm. Math. 8, 9: somnium praesagum futurorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:41:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 41, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praesaltor: <entryFree id="n37910" type="gloss" key="praesaltor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praesaltor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>prae- 2. salio</etym>, <sense id="n37910.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">he who led the dances of the Salii</hi>: praesaltor, <foreign lang="greek">o( e)n toi=s i(eroi=s proorxou/menos</foreign>, Vet. Gloss.</sense></entryFree>
praesanesco: <entryFree id="n37911" type="main" key="praesa_nesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-sānesco</orth>, <itype>sānui, 3</itype>, <sense id="n37911.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. incept.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to begin to heal prematurely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to close up too soon</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cicatrices, quae praesanuere, aperit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 10, 43, § 73</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praesano: <entryFree id="n37912" type="main" key="praesa_no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-sāno</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n37912.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to heal up prematurely</hi> (Plinian): <cit><quote lang="la">ulcera praesanata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 41, 87, § 147</bibl></cit> (in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 10, 43, § 73</bibl>, the true reading is praesanuere, v. praesanesco).</sense></entryFree>
praesauciatus: <entryFree id="n37913" type="main" key="praesauci^a_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-saucĭātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [saucio], <sense id="n37913.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">severely wounded</hi> (post-class.): vires <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 1:3" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 1, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praescatens: <entryFree id="n37914" type="main" key="praesca^tens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-scătens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [scateo], <sense id="n37914.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">overflowing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abounding</hi>, (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">liber doctrinis omnigenis praescatens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:14:6:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 14, 6, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praescienter: <entryFree id="n37915" type="main" key="praesci^enter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praescĭenter</orth>, v. praescio <sense id="n37915.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
praescientia: <entryFree id="n37916" type="main" key="praesci^enti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praescĭentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>praescio</etym>, <sense id="n37916.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">foreknowledge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prescience</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">Dei bonitas et praescientia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <pb n="1428" /> <cb n="PRAE" /> Dei, Aug. Civ. Dei, 5, 9; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 2, § 159</bibl>; <number>plur.</number>, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, § 32</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praescindo: <entryFree id="n37917" type="main" key="praescindo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-scindo</orth>, <itype>scĭdi, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n37917.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to cut off in front</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inferiores sedes praescindantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,012:10:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Reg. 10, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,024:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2 Macc. 7, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praescio: <entryFree id="n37918" type="main" key="praesci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-scĭo</orth>, <itype>īvi, ītum, 4</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n37918.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to know beforehand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to foreknow</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in postAug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">nonne oportuit praescisse me ante?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 5, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eum haec praescisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:67" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 67</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37918.1" n="II" level="1"> Esp. (in eccl. Lat.), <hi rend="ital">of God's foreknowledge</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">praescivit et praedestinavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,006:8:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Rom. 8, 29</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">11, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> in Luc. 7, 167</bibl>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">praescĭ-enter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">with foreknowledge</hi>, Anon. (Hilar.) in Job, 1, p. 77.</sense></entryFree>
praescisco: <entryFree id="n37919" type="main" key="praescisco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-scisco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n37919.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. a.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to find out</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">learn beforehand</hi> (not in Cic. or Cæs.): <cit><quote lang="la">animos volgi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exploratam fugam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:9:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 9, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adversos subitosque motus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 20, 6, 9</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">rel.-clause</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:35:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 35, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praescitio: <entryFree id="n37920" type="main" key="praesci_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praescītĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>praescio</etym>, <sense id="n37920.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a foreknowing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prognostic</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">numine praescitionum auctore,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 29, 1, 31</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praescitum: <entryFree id="n37921" type="main" key="praesci_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praescītum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n37921.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a prognostic</hi>, <hi rend="ital">presage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">presentiment</hi> (Plinian): <cit><quote lang="la">oraculorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 7, 5, § 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animi quiescentis,</quote> <trans><tr>presentiments</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:211" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 75, 98, § 211</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">picorum,</quote> <trans><tr>omens</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 18, 20, § 41</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praescitus: <entryFree id="n37922" type="main" key="praesci_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praescītus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n37922.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a foreknowing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prescience</hi> (post-class.): quae sint fortassis regi praescitui, Val. Rer. Gest. Alex. M. 1, 49.</sense></entryFree>
praescius: <entryFree id="n37923" type="main" key="praesci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-scĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n37923.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">foreknowing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prescient</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">corda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:452" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 452</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lingua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:538" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 538</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">gen. obj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vates Praescia venturi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vox sortis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:529" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 5, 529</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facere aliquem praescium rei alicujus,</quote> <trans><tr>to inform one of something in advance</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">periculorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae duo praescius futurorum Deus fecit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 2, 9, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 26, 40</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sulp.</author> Sev. Dial. 1, 13, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praescribo: <entryFree id="n37924" type="main" key="praescri_bo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-scrībo</orth>, <itype>psi, ptum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n37924.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to write before</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in front</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">previously</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to prefix in writing</hi> (syn.: praefinio, praestituo). </sense><sense id="n37924.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">pagina nomen sibi quae Vari praescripsit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:6:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 6, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">monimentis consulum nomina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 57</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">praescriptum (sc. in signis) Vespasiani nomen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 3, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomen ipsius virtutis libro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:11:16:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 11, 16, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">epistula, cui titulus praescriptus est, pluria non plura dici debere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:21:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 21, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auctoritates praescriptae,</quote> <trans><tr>the recorded names of senators present when a decree was made</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut praescripsimus,</quote> <trans><tr>as we remarked before</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:21:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 21, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37924.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to trace out</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">praescripta lineamenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 10, 36, § 92</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n37924.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n37924.4" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To order</hi>, <hi rend="ital">appoint</hi>, <hi rend="ital">direct</hi>, <hi rend="ital">command</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prescribe</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">finem rebus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 124</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic enim praescripsimus iis, quibus ea negotia mandavimus, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:26:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 26, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ei praescriptum esset, ne, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 16, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iis praescribendus est imperandi modus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:2:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 3, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lege aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:53:147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 53, 147</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si ipse populo Romano non praescriberet, quemadmodum suo jure uteretur, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B.
