G. 1, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid fieri oporteret, ipsi sibi praescribere poterant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut majorum jura moresque praescribunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:16:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Font. 16, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">curationem valetudinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:59:123" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 59, 123</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jura civibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:9:27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 9, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senatui quae sunt agenda,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praescribere et constituere aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:27:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 27, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praescribere aliquid et quasi imperare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praescriptis verbis agendum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:19" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 19</bibl></cit>, tit. 5, 2.—</sense><sense id="n37924.5" n="B" level="2"> In law, <hi rend="ital">to bring an exception against</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to except</hi>, <hi rend="ital">object</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">demur to</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignominioso patri filius praescribit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:5:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 5, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47:15:3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 47, 15, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n37924.6" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To dictate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">carmina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:4:1:177" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 4, 1, 177</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37924.7" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To write down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">put down in writing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">testamentum litteris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:29:1:40" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 29, 1, 40</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37924.8" n="E" level="2"> (I. q. praetexere, obtentui sumere.) <hi rend="ital">To use as a pretext</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 52</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">11, 16</bibl>; cf. praescriptio, II. A.—</sense><sense id="n37924.9" n="F" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To describe</hi> or <hi rend="ital">depict beforehand</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum (Nero) formam futuri principatūs praescripsit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 4</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">praescriptum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">something prescribed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a copy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">task</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lesson</hi> to imitate or to get by heart (class.). </sense><sense id="n37924.10" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">puerile praescriptum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 94:9" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 94, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pueri ad praescriptum discunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ib. 94:51" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 94, 51</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37924.11" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n37924.12" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A precept</hi>, <hi rend="ital">order</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rule</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">praescripta candida supremae calcis, i. e. metae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6</bibl></cit>, <cb n="PRAE" /> 92: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia legum imperio et praescripto fieri videbitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:53:147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 53, 147</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">legis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:14" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 1, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">29, 1, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">praescripta servare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:26:92" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 26, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad praescriptum,</quote> <trans><tr>according to order</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 36</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex communi praescripto civitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:45:132" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 45, 132</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ex Augusti praescripto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:10" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc ejus praescripto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 87 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: ultra praescriptum, <hi rend="ital">beyond</hi> or <hi rend="ital">contrary to rule</hi>, <hi rend="ital">irregularly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">illegally</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:28" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 28</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n37924.13" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The prescribed limits</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bounds</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">intra praescriptum equitare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:9:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 9, 23</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praescriptio: <entryFree id="n37925" type="main" key="praescripti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praescriptĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>praescribo</etym>. <sense id="n37925.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A writing before</hi> or <hi rend="ital">in front</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a prefixing in writing;</hi> hence, meton., <hi rend="ital">a title</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inscription</hi>, <hi rend="ital">preface</hi>, <hi rend="ital">introduction</hi>, <hi rend="ital">commencement</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">praescriptio legis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:9:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 9, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tribuniciae potestatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37925.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n37925.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A pretext</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excuse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pretence</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut honestā praescriptione rem turpissimam tegerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 32</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37925.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A precept</hi>, <hi rend="ital">order</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rule</hi>, <hi rend="ital">law</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dummodo illa praescriptio moderatioque teneatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:18:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 18, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hanc normam, hanc regulam, hanc praescriptionem esse naturae, a quā, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 46, 140</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:9:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 4, 9, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in hac praescriptione semi-horae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Perd. 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sine praescriptione generis aut numeri,</quote> <trans><tr>without previous limitation</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 15</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n37925.4" n="C" level="2"> In law, <hi rend="ital">an exception</hi>, <hi rend="ital">objection</hi>, <hi rend="ital">demurrer</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aut intentio, aut praescriptio habet controversiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:5:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praescriptionem alicui opponere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:44" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 44</bibl></cit>, tit. 1, 11.—</sense><sense id="n37925.5" n="2" level="3"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">a limitation of the subject-matter in a suit</hi>, by a form of words: <cit><quote lang="la">praescriptiones autem appellatas ab eo, quod ante formulas praescribuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 4:132" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 4, 132</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:ib. 4:130" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 130</bibl> sqq.—</sense><sense id="n37925.6" n="D" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a philosophical objection</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a subtlety</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sophism</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">exceptiones et praescriptiones philosophorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 48:12" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 48, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37925.7" n="E" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Limitation</hi> as to time, <hi rend="ital">prescription</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:18:1:76" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 18, 1, 76</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praescriptive: <entryFree id="n37926" type="main" key="praescripti_ve_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praescriptīvē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. praescriptivus <sense id="n37926.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
praescriptivus: <entryFree id="n37927" type="main" key="praescripti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praescriptīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>praescribo, II. B.</etym>, <sense id="n37927.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">relating to a legal exception</hi> or <hi rend="ital">demurrer</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">praescriptivae quaestiones, Jul. Vict. Art. Rhet. 3, 10: quaestiunculae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:ib. 4:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praescripti vum praecedens,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sulp.</author> Viet. Inst. Or. p. 282</bibl></cit>. —<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">praescriptīvē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">with an exception</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">occurrere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praescriptum: <entryFree id="n37928" type="main" key="praescriptum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praescriptum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. praescribo <sense id="n37928.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
praescriptus: <entryFree id="n37929" type="main" key="praescriptus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praescriptus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from praescribo.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n37930" type="main" key="praescriptus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praescriptus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>praescribo</etym>, <sense id="n37930.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a precept</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Exhort. ad Cast. 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praeseca: <entryFree id="n37931" type="spur" key="praese^ca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praesĕca</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">praesĭca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, a word assumed for the etym. of brassica, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=104" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 104</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
praeseco: <entryFree id="n37932" type="main" key="praese^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-sĕco</orth>, <itype>cŭi, ctum, or cātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n37932.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to cut off before</hi> or <hi rend="ital">in front</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to cut off</hi> or <hi rend="ital">out</hi> (not in Cic.). </sense><sense id="n37932.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">pars cultello praesecatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:16:34" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 16, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">brassica ut praesica, quod ex ejus scapo minutatim praesecatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=104" default="NO"><author>id.</author> L. L. 5, § 104</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">partem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 112</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">projecturas tignorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lineam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 2, 5, § 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praesecta vitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 17, 15, 25, § 115</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praesecata gula,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, p. 108, 15</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37932.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: praesectum decies non castigavit ad unguem, <hi rend="ital">has not corrected by the pared nail</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to perfect accuracy</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:294" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 294</bibl> Bentl. and Haupt (but the better reading is perfectum).</sense></entryFree>
praesectus: <entryFree id="n37933" type="main" key="praesectus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praesectus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from praeseco.</entryFree>
praesegmen: <entryFree id="n37934" type="main" key="praesegmen"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praesegmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>praeseco</etym>, <sense id="n37934.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a piece cut off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a paring</hi> (ante- and postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">tonsor omnia abstulit praesegmina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:4:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 4, 33</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">praesegmina proprie Plautus in Aululariā ea dici voluit, quae unguibus eminulis praesecantur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 151, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cadaverum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 123, 24</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praeseminatio: <entryFree id="n37935" type="main" key="praese_mi^na_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praesēmĭnātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>praesemino</etym>, <sense id="n37935.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fœtus</hi> (only in Vitr.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 9, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praesemino: <entryFree id="n37936" type="main" key="praese_mi^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-sēmĭno</orth>, no <sense id="n37936.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to sow</hi> or <hi rend="ital">plant beforehand</hi> (post-class.). </sense><sense id="n37936.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">non nati sunt homines tamquam ex draconis dentibus praeseminati,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 6, 10</bibl></cit>: vis naturalis, et quasi praeseminata, Aug Gen. ad <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> 3, 14.—</sense><sense id="n37936.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to lay the foundation for</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to prepare for</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to undertake</hi> a thing: majora sibi praeseminans, <cb n="PRAE" /> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 30, 2, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Ep. 5, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Hist. Eccl. 6, 24</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praesens: <entryFree id="n37937" type="main" key="praesens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praesens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, v. praesum <sense id="n37937.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
praesensio: <entryFree id="n37938" type="main" key="praesensi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praesensĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>praesentio</etym>. <sense id="n37938.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A foreboding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">presentiment</hi> (class.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn. praesagium): praesensio et scientia rerum futurarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:1:1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praedictiones et praesensiones rerum futurarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:3:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 3, 7</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">per exta inventa praesensio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:20:77" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Top. 20, 77</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37938.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A preconception</hi>, = <foreign lang="greek">pro/lhyis</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:17:45" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 17, 45</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praesensus: <entryFree id="n37939" type="main" key="praesensus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praesensus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from praesentio.</entryFree>
praesentalis: <entryFree id="n37940" type="main" key="praesenta_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praesentālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>praesens</etym>, <sense id="n37940.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">present</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">milites,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 12, 36, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domestici,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 17, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praesentanee: <entryFree id="n37941" type="main" key="praesenta_ne^e_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praesentānĕē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. praesentaneus <sense id="n37941.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
praesentaneus: <entryFree id="n37942" type="main" key="praesenta_ne^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praesentānĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>praesens</etym>. <sense id="n37942.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Momentary</hi>, <hi rend="ital">instantaneous</hi> (late Lat.): commotio, Lact. de Ira Dei, 21, 8.— </sense><sense id="n37942.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">That operates quickly</hi> or <hi rend="ital">immediately</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">remedium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:180" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 31, 105, § 180</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venenum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 1, 1, § 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(remedium) quam posset velocissimum ac praesentaneum coquere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:33" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 95:25" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 95, 25</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">praesentānĕum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a remedy that operates quickly</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 30, 9, 23, § 79</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">praesentānĕē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">forthwith</hi>, <hi rend="ital">immediately</hi> (post-class.), Theod. Prisc. ad Tim. Fr. praef. 1.</sense></entryFree>
praesentarius: <entryFree id="n37943" type="main" key="praesenta_rius"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praesentārius</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n37943.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that is at hand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ready</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quick</hi>, <hi rend="ital">present</hi> (ante- and post-class. for praesens): <cit><quote lang="la">id quod mali (haruspices) promittunt, praesentarium est (opp.: pro spisso evenit),</quote> <trans><tr>happens immediately</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:5:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 3, 5, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">argentum,</quote> <trans><tr>ready money</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:2:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 2, 1, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:3:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 4, 3, 74</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">venenum,</quote> <trans><tr>that operates instantly</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 10, p. 240</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7</bibl> (6), 4, 1.</sense></entryFree>
praesentatio: <entryFree id="n37944" type="main" key="praesenta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praesentātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>praesento</etym>, <sense id="n37944.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a placing before</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a showing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">representation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exhibition</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">tironis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 12, 28, 2</bibl></cit> (al. praestatio): <cit><quote lang="la">adhuc in comminatione est (judicium), nondum in praesentatione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:in Psa. 59:6" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> in Psa. 59, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Mir. S. Steph. 2:5:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Mir. S. Steph. 2, 5, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praesentia: <entryFree id="n37945" type="main" key="praesenti^a1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praesentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>praesens</etym>. <sense id="n37945.0" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a being before</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in view</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">at hand; presence</hi> (class.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">conspectus): alicujus aspectum praesentiamque vitare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:7:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 7, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">desiderium praesentiae tuae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:8:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 8, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urget praesentia Turni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 73</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">deorum praesentiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:66:166" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 66, 166</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praesentiam sui facere,</quote> <trans><tr>to present one's self</tr>, <tr>to appear</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:42:1:53" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 42, 1, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praesentia animi,</quote> <trans><tr>presence of mind</tr>, <tr>readiness</tr>, <tr>resolution</tr>, <tr>courage</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:43:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 43, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:chapter=23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 25, 38, § 92</bibl>.—For the phrase in praesentia (sc. tempora), v. praesens, s. v. praesum.—</sense><sense id="n37945.1" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Impression</hi>, <hi rend="ital">efficacy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">effect</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tanta est praesentia veri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:611" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 611</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37945.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">protection</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assistance</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">PRAESENTIAE MATRIS DEVM,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 28, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n37946" type="main" key="praesenti^a2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praesentĭa</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <number>plur.</number>, v. praesens, s. v. praesum <sense id="n37946.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
praesentio: <entryFree id="n37947" type="main" key="praesenti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-sentĭo</orth>, <itype>sensi, sensum, 4</itype> (collat. form praesentisse for praesensisse, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0116,001:Pan. Theod. 3" default="NO"><author>Pac.</author> Pan. Theod. 3</bibl>), <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n37947.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to feel</hi> or <hi rend="ital">perceive beforehand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to have a presentiment of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to presage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">divine</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ni haec praesensisset canes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 135</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verum is nescio quo pacto praesensit prius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:4:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 4, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 5, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">animo praesentire atque videre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1342" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1342</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animo providere et praesentire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">futura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:48:100" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 48, 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animus ita praesentit in posterum, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:10:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Perd. 10, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicujus adventum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:610" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 610</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:10:404" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 404</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:297" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 297</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eventus bellorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:96" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:191" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 79, 81, § 191</bibl></cit>.—With <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quom ibi me adesse neuter tum praesenserat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 5, 1, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum talem esse deum certā notione animi praesentiamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:17:45" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 17, 45</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Impers. pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">praesensum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:49:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 49, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praesentisco: <entryFree id="n37948" type="hapax" key="praesentisco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praesentisco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n37948.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. a.</hi> [praesentio], <hi rend="ital">to begin to have a presentiment of</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:5:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 5, 21</bibl>, acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 824</bibl> P. (al. persentisceres).</sense></entryFree>
praesento: <entryFree id="n37949" type="main" key="praesento"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praesento</orth>, no <sense id="n37949.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi> (praesentisse, Pac. ap. Pan. Theod. 3), <itype>ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>praesens</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to place before</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exhibit to view</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to show</hi>, <hi rend="ital">present</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hold out</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">sarcitis bubulas carnes praesentat,</quote> <trans><tr>looks like</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10</bibl></cit>, <pb n="1429" /> <cb n="PRAE" /> 67, § 181 (al. repraesentat): caput ab Achillā Caesari praesentatum est, <hi rend="ital">handed</hi> or <hi rend="ital">presented to</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Vir. Ill. 77" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Vir. Ill. 77</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">supplicanti, statim sese Juno praesentat,</quote> <trans><tr>shows herself</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 6, p. 175, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10</bibl>, p. 240; 11, p. 243.</sense></entryFree>
praesepe: <entryFree id="n37950" type="main" key="praese_pe"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praesēpe</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">praesēpio</orth>, etc., v. praesaep-.</entryFree>
praesepis: <entryFree id="n37951" type="main" key="praese_pis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praesēpis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">praesēpĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, v. praesepe.</entryFree>
praeseptus: <entryFree id="n37952" type="main" key="praeseptus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praeseptus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from praesepio.</entryFree>
praesepultus: <entryFree id="n37953" type="main" key="praese^pultus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-sĕpultus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [sepelio], <sense id="n37953.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">buried beforehand</hi> (post-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Decl. 9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> Decl. 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 11, 21</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praesero: <entryFree id="n37954" type="main" key="praese^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-sĕro</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n37954.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to sow beforehand</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">semina laetitiae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Carm. 32, 445</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praesertim: <entryFree id="n37955" type="main" key="praesertim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praesertim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>prae-sero; cf. praecipue, from praecipio, qs. connected beforehand</etym>, serves to add an important argument or condition (hence most freq. joined with cum and si), <sense id="n37955.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">especially</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chiefly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">principally</hi>, <hi rend="ital">particularly</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">kai\ tau=ta</foreign> (class.; cf. praecipue). </sense><sense id="n37955.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: praefestinamus, quae sit causa, sciscere, quod sit necessum scire, praesertim in brevi, Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 186</bibl> P. (Com. Rel. p. 214 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">praesertim ut nunc sunt mores, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm, 1, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">retinenda est huius generis verecundia, praesertim naturā ipsā magistrā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:35:129" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 35, 129</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 39, 140</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 8, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">praesertim homines tantulae staturae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 30 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(te) praesertim cautum dignos assumere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:6:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 6, 51</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:383 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 383 al.</bibl>— <cit><quote lang="la">Placed after the word which it qualifies: deforme est de se ipsum praedicare, falsa praesertim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:38:137" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 38, 137</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:4:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 4, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in scripto praesertim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:61:219" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 61, 219</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hac praesertim imbecillitate magistratum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tanta praesertim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:7:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 7, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n37955.2" n="II" level="1"> Praesertim cum or cum praesertim and praesertim si=<hi rend="ital">particularly since</hi> or <hi rend="ital">if</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod scribere, praesertim cum de philosophiā scriberem, non auderem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:14:51" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 14, 51</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">praesertim cum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 2, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:2:8" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 2, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:7:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Deiot. 7, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,033:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Lig. 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Arch. 5, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:21:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 5, 21, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 16 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 33, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,007:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alc. 5, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 1:41:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 1, 41, 1</bibl> and 3, 61, 12 Dietsch; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:103" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 103</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:9:12" default="NO">7, 9, 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 50</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum praesertim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:30:110" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 30, 110</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:30:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 30, 81</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:8:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 8, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:10:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 10, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 2, 6, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 2, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 51:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 51, 19</bibl> Kritz <hi rend="ital">N. Cr.;</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:52:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 52, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:2:11" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 2, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:11:17" default="NO">1, 11, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:12:4 al" default="NO">1, 12, 4 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:2:27" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 2, 27</bibl>. (So for praesertim quod the true read. is praesertim cum in <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 17, 41</bibl>).—Faciam, Laeli, praesertim si utrique vestrum gratum futurum est, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:2:6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 2, 6</bibl>; so with <hi rend="ital">indic.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">praesertim si est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 2, 7, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">14, 2</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">praesertim si incubuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:310" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 310</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">praesertim si esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:17:38" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 17, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praesertim si aedifices,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:39:140" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 39, 140</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praeservio: <entryFree id="n37956" type="main" key="praeservi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-servĭo</orth>, <itype>īre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n37956.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to serve</hi> as a slave (ante- and post-class.). </sense><sense id="n37956.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:prol. 124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. prol. 124</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37956.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">verbum neque numeris, neque generibus praeserviens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:7:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 7, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praeservo: <entryFree id="n37957" type="main" key="praeservo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-servo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n37957.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to observe beforehand</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 3:8" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 3, 8</bibl></cit>: liberum se a dominationibus, Hilar. in Psa. 118, 16, 3.</sense></entryFree>
praeses: <entryFree id="n37958" type="main" key="praese^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praesĕs</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype> (<sense id="n37958.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> praesidium, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:17:16" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 17, 16</bibl>), <pos>adj.</pos> and <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi> [praesideo]. </sense><sense id="n37958.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Sitting before</hi> a thing, <hi rend="ital">to guard</hi>, <hi rend="ital">take care of</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">direct</hi> it; <hi rend="ital">presiding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">protecting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">guarding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">defending</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">locus,</quote> <trans><tr>a place of refuge</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:5:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 5, 1, 11</bibl></cit> dub.: <cit><quote lang="la">dextra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Med. 247" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Med. 247</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">di praesides imperii,</quote> <trans><tr>protecting deities</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 53</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37958.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">praesĕs</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>comm.</gen> </sense><sense id="n37958.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A protector</hi>, <hi rend="ital">guard</hi>, <hi rend="ital">guardian</hi>, <hi rend="ital">defender</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ite nunc jam ex praesidio praesides,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 4, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senatus rei publicae custos, praeses, propugnator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:65:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 65, 137</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patrii Penates, qui huic urbi et rei publicae praesides estis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:57:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Dom. 57, 144</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tribunus plebis, quem majores praesidem libertatis custodemque esse voluerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 6, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 16</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n37958.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">one that presides over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a president</hi>, <hi rend="ital">superintendent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">head</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chief</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ruler</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeses belli,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Minerva</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:483" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 483</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vobis per suffragia uti praesides olim, nunc dominos destinatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 3:61:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 3, 61, 6</bibl></cit> Dietsch: <cit><quote lang="la">provinciarum,</quote> <trans><tr>governors</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:23" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 23</bibl></cit>: quorum (praetorum) in provinciis jurisdictionem praesides earum habent, Gai. Inst. <cb n="PRAE" /> 1, 6; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">praesidis nomen generale est, eo quod et proconsules et legati Caesaris, et omnes provincias regentes (licet senatores sint) praesides appellentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1</bibl></cit>, tit. 18.</sense></entryFree>
praesicco: <entryFree id="n37959" type="main" key="praesicco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-sicco</orth>, <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n37959.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to dry beforehand</hi> (post-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 2:14:217" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 2, 14, 217</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:4:3:53" default="NO">4, 3, 53</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-siccātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">dried beforehand</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">succus sole praesiccatus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 124</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praesiccus: <entryFree id="n37960" type="main" key="praesiccus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-siccus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n37960.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very dry</hi> (post-class.): vulnera, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 5, 141.</sense></entryFree>
praesidalis: <entryFree id="n37961" type="main" key="praesi^da_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praesĭdālis</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">praesĭdĭālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>praeses</etym>, <sense id="n37961.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the governor of a province</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gubernatorial</hi> (postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">jus, Treb. Poll. XXX. Tyr. 24: jussio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 4, 24, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">judicium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 9, 1, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">officium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 28, 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apparitor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 17, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vir,</quote> <trans><tr>who has been a governor</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 4:71" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 4, 71</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praesidarius: <entryFree id="n37962" type="main" key="praesi^da_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praesĭdārĭus</orth>, v. praesidiarius.</entryFree>
praesidatus: <entryFree id="n37963" type="main" key="praesi^da_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praesĭdātus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">praesĭdĭātus</orth>), <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>praeses</etym>, <sense id="n37963.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the office of governor of a province</hi>, <hi rend="ital">governorship</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">Dalmatiae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Carin. 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praesidatu regere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Caes. 29" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Caes. 29</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:27:1:6" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 27, 1, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praesidens: <entryFree id="n37964" type="main" key="praesi^dens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praesĭdens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, v. praesideo <sense id="n37964.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
praesideo: <entryFree id="n37965" type="main" key="praesi^de^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-sĭdĕo</orth>, <itype>sēdi</itype> (praesīdi in best MSS., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 76</bibl>), <itype>ēre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n37965.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [sedeo], <hi rend="ital">to sit before</hi> or <hi rend="ital">in front of.</hi> </sense><sense id="n37965.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (mostly postclass. and rare): <cit><quote lang="la">pro aede Capitolini Jovis praesidere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:26" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 26</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37965.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in time, <hi rend="ital">to sit beforehand</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in cujus (Mutini) sinu nubentes praesident, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 20 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n37965.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n37965.4" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To guard</hi>, <hi rend="ital">watch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">protect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">defend.</hi> </sense><sense id="n37965.5" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego hic tibi praesidebo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:5:1:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 5, 1, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego hic restitrix praesidebo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 4, 2, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 4, 4, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:9:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 13, 9, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:11:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 11, 9</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:32" default="NO" valid="yes">23, 32</bibl> <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>; 24, 40 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>; 36, 5, 5; <cit><quote lang="la">38, 51, 8: Gallia, quae semper praesidet atque praesedit huic imperio libertatique communi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:13:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 5, 13, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">huic urbi, atque huic imperio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:31:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 31, 86</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37965.6" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">socios,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 2:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 2, 28</bibl></cit> Dietsch: <cit><quote lang="la">agros suos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 3:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proximum Galliae litus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">civium manus litora oceani praesidebat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 72</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37965.7" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To preside over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to have the care</hi> or <hi rend="ital">management of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to superintend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">direct</hi>, <hi rend="ital">command</hi> (syn. praesum). </sense><sense id="n37965.8" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut idem ad portas urbanis praesideat rebus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Mars...praesidet armis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:85" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Actiacis ludis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:6" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spectaculis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37965.9" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">P. Atellio, qui Pannoniam praesidebat,</quote> <trans><tr>who commanded in Pannonia</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitum,</quote> <trans><tr>to command</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 39</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37965.10" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">Metellus in agro Piceno praesidebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 57:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 57, 2</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n37965.11" n="(d)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">(in senatu) princeps praesidebat,</quote> <trans><tr>presided</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:11:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 11, 10</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">praesĭdens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <hi rend="ital">P. a.;</hi> as <hi rend="ital">subst.: a president</hi>, <hi rend="ital">director</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ruler</hi> (post-Aug. for praeses): <cit><quote lang="la">superbia praesidentium,</quote> <trans><tr>governors</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 40</bibl></cit>: praesidentium apparitores, Cod. Th. 8, 7, 13.</sense></entryFree>
praesidero: <entryFree id="n37966" type="gloss" key="praesi_de^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praesīdĕro</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>prae-sidus</etym>, <sense id="n37966.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to be in advance of the constellations</hi>: praesiderare dicitur, cum maturius hiberna tempestas movetur, quasi ante sideris tempus, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=223" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 223</bibl> Müll.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:207" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 25, 57, § 207</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praesidialis: <entryFree id="n37967" type="main" key="praesi^di^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praesĭdĭālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, v. praesidalis.</entryFree>
praesidiarius: <entryFree id="n37968" type="main" key="praesi^di^a_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praesĭdĭārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>praesidium</etym>. <sense id="n37968.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n37968.1" n="1" level="3"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">that serves for defence</hi> or <hi rend="ital">protection</hi> (not in Cic. or Cæs.): <cit><quote lang="la">praesidiarii milites,</quote> <trans><tr>garrison soldiers</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 8</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">dicti praesidiarii milites ante alios collocati qui erant, aut in alio loco praepositi, Fest. S. V. SVBSIDIVM, p. 306 Müll.: classis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0803,001:ad Cic. Verr. 2:1:34:section=86" default="NO"><author>Ascon.</author> ad Cic. Verr. 2, 1, 34, § 86</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37968.2" n="2" level="3"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the governor of a province</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gubernatorial</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">togam praesidiariam accepit (al. praesidariam),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Sev. 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37968.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">praesĭdĭārĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a garrison</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Not. Tir.</author> p. 56</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n37968.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">praesidarii malleoli,</quote> <trans><tr>kept as a reserve in case the wine should fail</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:15:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 15, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">palmes, i. q. resex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:21:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 21, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praesidiatus: <entryFree id="n37969" type="main" key="praesi^di^a_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praesĭdĭātus</orth>, v. praesidatus.</entryFree>
praesidiolum: <entryFree id="n37970" type="main" key="praesi^di^o^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praesĭdĭŏlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>praesidium</etym>, <sense id="n37970.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small garrison</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Not. Tir.</author> p. 56</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praesidior: <entryFree id="n37971" type="gloss" key="praesi^di^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praesĭdĭor</orth>, <itype>āri</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n37971.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to watch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">guard</hi>: praesidior, <foreign lang="greek">frourw=</foreign>, Gloss. Lat. Gr.</sense></entryFree>
praesidium: <entryFree id="n37972" type="main" key="praesi^di^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praesĭdĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>praeses</etym>. <sense id="n37972.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a presiding over;</hi> hence, <hi rend="ital">defence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">protection</hi>, <hi rend="ital">help</hi>, <hi rend="ital">aid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assistance;</hi> esp. of soldiers who are to serve as <hi rend="ital">a guard</hi>, <hi rend="ital">garrison</hi>, <hi rend="ital">escort</hi>,<cb n="PRAE" />  or <hi rend="ital">convoy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">proficisci praesidio suis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Ages. 3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Ages. 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praesidio esse alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:ib. 7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 7</bibl></cit>: <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 44</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hanc sibi rem praesidio sperant futuram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:65:section=167" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 65, § 167</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tectus praesidio firmo amicorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:18:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 18, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">absque me foret et meo praesidio, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:5:2:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 5, 2, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut meae stultitiae in justitiā tuā sit aliquid praesidii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:1:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 1, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in tutelā ac praesidio bellicae virtutis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:10:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 10, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Veneris praesidio ferox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:15:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 15, 13</bibl></cit>.—Esp. of soldiers acting as a <hi rend="ital">guard</hi>, <hi rend="ital">convoy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">escort</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">legiones, quae praesidio impedimentis erant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regale,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 30</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37972.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n37972.2" n="A" level="2"> That which aids, defends, or protects, <hi rend="ital">defence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assistance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">protection</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad hoc ipsum judicium cum praesidio venit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 5, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">armatorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:44:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 44, 112</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">O et praesidium,</quote> <trans><tr>protector</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quantum praesidium perdis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 58</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37972.3" n="2" level="3"> In partic., in milit. lang., those who by their presence protect a place, a camp, or a supply of arms or provisions, <hi rend="ital">a guard</hi>, <hi rend="ital">garrison</hi>, <hi rend="ital">convoy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">escort</hi>, <hi rend="ital">troops</hi>, <hi rend="ital">soldiers</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">praesidium est dictum, quia extra castra praesidebant loco aliquo, quo tutior regio esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=90" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 90</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">occupatoque oppido, ibi praesidium collocat,</quote> <trans><tr>garrison</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(turres) praesidiis firmare,</quote> <trans><tr>with a garrison</tr>, <tr>with troops</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 23:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 23, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam (Italiam) praesidiis confirmaretis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:1:5:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 1, 5, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obsidere atque occupare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 28, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex oppido educere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dimittere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:17:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 17, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oppido imponere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praesidium dedit, ut eo tuto perveniret,</quote> <trans><tr>an escort</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,015:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Ep. 4, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praesidium ex arce expellere,</quote> <trans><tr>a garrison</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:ib. 10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praesidium ex regionibus depellere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,004:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Paus. 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praesidia interficere,</quote> <trans><tr>troops</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Milt. 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praesidia custodiasque disponere,</quote> <trans><tr>posts</tr>, <tr>pickets</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Italia tota armis praesidiisque tenetur,</quote> <trans><tr>troops</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praesidia deducere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">galeatum ponit ubique Praesidium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:239" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 239</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37972.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Any place occupied by troops</hi>, as a hill, a camp, etc.; <hi rend="ital">a post</hi>, <hi rend="ital">station</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intrenchment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fortification</hi>, <hi rend="ital">camp</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui propter metum praesidium relinquit,</quote> <trans><tr>leaves his post</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:8:17" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 8, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praesidio decedere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">procul in praesidio esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,020:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Timol. 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praesidium occupare et munire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cohortes ex proximis praesidiis deductae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 7, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">milites in praesidiis disponere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in praesidiis esse,</quote> <trans><tr>in the camp</tr>, <tr>with the army</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,033:9:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Lig. 9, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in adversariorum praesidiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:43:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 43, 126</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">posito castello super vestigia paterni praesidii,</quote> <trans><tr>fort</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obsidium coepit per praesidia,</quote> <trans><tr>redoubts</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 49</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">de praesidio et statione vitae decedere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:26:73" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 26, 73</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37972.5" n="C" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">aid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">help</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assistance</hi> of any kind, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:1:3:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 1, 3, 45</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod satis esset praesidii, dedit,</quote> <trans><tr>every thing needful for his support and safety</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:8:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Them. 8, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaerere sibi praesidia periculis, et adjumenta honoribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:24:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 24, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnum sibi praesidium ad beatam vitam comparare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:1:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnibus vel naturae, vel doctrinae praesidiis ad dicendum parati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:9:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 9, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me biremis praesidio scaphae tutum aura feret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:29:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 29, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad praesidium aquae calidae decurritur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:50" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praesidia afferre navem factura minorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:12:56" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 12, 56</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">defence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">protection</hi>, <hi rend="ital">help</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortissimum praesidium pudoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:28:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 28, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insigne maestis praesidium reis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 1, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si qua aliunde putas rerum exspectanda tuarum, Praesidia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:23" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 23</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37972.6" n="2" level="3"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">a remedy</hi> against diseases: <cit><quote lang="la">aurium morbis praesidium est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 22, 44, § 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contra serpentes praesidio esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 4, 7, § 35</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praesignatio: <entryFree id="n37973" type="main" key="praesigna_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praesignātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>praesigno</etym>, <sense id="n37973.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a presignifying</hi> (eccl. Lat.), Aug. c. Faust. 22, 83.</sense></entryFree>
praesignator: <entryFree id="n37974" type="main" key="praesigna_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praesignātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n37974.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who marks out</hi> or <hi rend="ital">designates beforehand</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Fabr.</author> p. 38</bibl>, n. 184; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Murat.</author> 915, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praesignificatio: <entryFree id="n37975" type="main" key="praesigni^fi^ca_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praesignĭfĭcātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>praesignifico</etym>, <sense id="n37975.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a showing</hi> or <hi rend="ital">signifying beforehand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">presignification</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">praesignificatio et figura majoris rei,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 7, 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praesignifico: <entryFree id="n37976" type="main" key="praesigni^fi^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-signĭfĭco</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n37976.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to show</hi> or <hi rend="ital">signify beforehand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to foreshow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">presignify</hi> (only in the foll. passages): <cit><quote lang="la">hominibus quae sint futura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:38:82" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 38, 82</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 49, 101</bibl>. <pb n="1430" /> <cb n="PRAE" /></sense></entryFree>
praesignis: <entryFree id="n37977" type="main" key="praesignis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-signis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>signum</etym>, <sense id="n37977.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">distinguished before</hi> or <hi rend="ital">above others</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remarkable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">illustrious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excellent</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">praesignia tempora cornu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:611" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 611</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praesignis facie,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:773" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 3, 773</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:628" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 6, 628</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hastā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:4:8:12" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 4, 8, 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praesigno: <entryFree id="n37978" type="main" key="praesigno"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-signo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n37978.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to mark before</hi> (ante-class. and post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">ad summum praesignato (al. pertundito),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 154</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">furunculos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 4, 7, § 36</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praesilio: <entryFree id="n37979" type="spur" key="praesi^li^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-sĭlĭo</orth>, <itype>īre, a false reading</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:3:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 3, 2, 13</bibl>; v. prosilio.</entryFree>
praesipio: <entryFree id="n37980" type="main" key="praesi^pi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-sĭpĭo</orth>, <itype>pĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>sapio</etym>, <sense id="n37980.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to feel beforehand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">have a presentiment of</hi>: praesagire est praedivinare, praesipere, Fest. s. v. praesagire, p. 223 Müll.; cf.: adsipere et praesipere dicebant antiqui a sapiendo, Paul. ex Fest. s. v. adsipere, p. 21 Müll.</sense></entryFree>
praesolidus: <entryFree id="n37981" type="main" key="praeso^li^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-sŏlĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n37981.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very solid</hi> (late Lat.). </sense><sense id="n37981.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, Coripp. Laud. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:291" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 3, 291</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n37981.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">very firm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very constant</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">steadfast</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">praesolidum Simonem dignum cognomine Petri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Juvenc.</author> 1, 436</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praesono: <entryFree id="n37982" type="main" key="praeso^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-sŏno</orth>, <itype>ui, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n37982.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> </sense><sense id="n37982.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To sound before</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">praesonuit solemni tibia cantu (al. personuit),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:13:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 13, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37982.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To sound louder than</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to sound above;</hi> with <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui posset avena Praesonuisse chelyn,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0830,001:4:65" default="NO"><author>Calp.</author> Ecl. 4, 65</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praespargo: <entryFree id="n37983" type="main" key="praespargo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-spargo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-spergo</orth>), <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n37983.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to scatter</hi> or <hi rend="ital">strew before</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:738" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 738</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praespeculor: <entryFree id="n37984" type="main" key="praespe^cu^lor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-spĕcŭlor</orth>, <itype>āri, 1</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos>, <sense id="n37984.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to examine into beforehand</hi> (late Lat.), Rustic. c. Aceph. p. 1233; hence, <hi rend="ital">part.</hi> in <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi> signif.: <cit><quote lang="la">utilitate praespeculata,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 25, 8, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praespergo: <entryFree id="n37985" type="main" key="praespergo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praespergo</orth>, v. praespargo.</entryFree>
praespero: <entryFree id="n37986" type="main" key="praespe_ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-spēro</orth>, <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n37986.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to hope beforehand</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">qui praenunciabatur, ille et praesperabatur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 5, 17</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praespicio: <entryFree id="n37987" type="gloss" key="praespi^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praespĭcĭo</orth>, <itype>cĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>prae-specio</etym>, <sense id="n37987.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to look at before</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to regard beforehand</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Not. Tir.</author> p. 43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 1:4:83" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 1, 4, 83</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praestabilis: <entryFree id="n37988" type="main" key="praesta_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praestābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. praesto</etym>, <sense id="n37988.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">preeminent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">distinguished</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excellent</hi> (class.; <cit><quote lang="la">usually only of things concr. and abstr.): res magnitudine praestabiles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:85:347" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 85, 347</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praestabilis insignisque virtus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,021:19:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Har. Resp. 19, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenium atque lingua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:18:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 18, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">linguā ac facundiā praestabilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:18:3:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 18, 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Deus) praestabilis super malitiā,</quote> <trans><tr>exalted</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Joel, 2, 13</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Calchas praestabilis hariolari, i. e. hariolando,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> de Deo Socrat. p. 52, 4</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dignitas praestabilior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:16:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Prov. Cons. 16, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fuerat praestabilius,</quote> <trans><tr>preferable</tr>, <tr>better</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 3, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil amicitiā praestabilius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:27:104" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 27, 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utrum huic rei publicae melius fuisse et praestabilius me civem nosci an te?</quote> <trans><tr>more advantageous</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Vatin. 4, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque majus aliud, neque praestabilius invenies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 1, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praestana: <entryFree id="n37989" type="main" key="Praesta_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Praestāna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n37989.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the goddess of excellence</hi>, who was worshipped because Romulus had surpassed all others in throwing javelins: <cit><quote lang="la">Praestana est, ut perhibetis, dicta, quod Quirinus in jaculi missione cunctorum praestiterit viribus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 4, 128</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praestans: <entryFree id="n37990" type="main" key="praestans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praestans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from 2. praesto.</entryFree>
praestanter: <entryFree id="n37991" type="main" key="praestanter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praestanter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. 2. praesto, <sense id="n37991.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
