praestantia: <entryFree id="n37992" type="main" key="praestanti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praestantĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>praestans</etym>, <sense id="n37992.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">preeminence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">superiority</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excellence</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">excellentia praestantiaque animantium reliquorum,</quote> <trans><tr>over other creatures</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:28:97" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 28, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtutis, ingenii, fortunae,</quote> <trans><tr>pre-eminence in</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:19:70" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 19, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">di omnium rerum praestantiā excellentes,</quote> <trans><tr>in all things</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:63:129" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 63, 129</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dignitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:52:209" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 52, 209</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">remedii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 3, 7, § 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulneribus sanandis tanta praestantia est, ut, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>of such superior efficacy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 6, 24, § 42</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praestat: <entryFree id="n37993" type="main" key="praestat"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praestat</orth>, v. 2. praesto.</entryFree>
praestatio: <entryFree id="n37994" type="main" key="praesta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praestātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>2. praesto</etym>. <sense id="n37994.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a guaranty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">warranty</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">ut ad praestationem scribant,</quote> <trans><tr>if they pledge themselves for the truth of what they write</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Brev. Vit. 13:9" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Brev. Vit. 13, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:45:1:2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 45, 1, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n37994.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">payment</hi> of any thing due (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">remittere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,023:10:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Macc. 10, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praestatio dotis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:31:1:35" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 31, 1, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vectigalium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:10:3:7" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 10, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">usumfructum locare sub certā annuā praestatione,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 3, 33, 10</bibl></cit>: fiscalium praestationum exactores, Firm. Math. 4, 3; 6, 3. <cb n="PRAE" /></sense></entryFree>
praestator: <entryFree id="n37995" type="main" key="praesta_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praestātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>2. praesto</etym>, <sense id="n37995.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a surety</hi> (post - class.): qui advocantur ut praestatores, Front. Col. praef. p. 128 Goes.</sense></entryFree>
praestergus: <entryFree id="n37996" type="spur" key="praestergus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praestergus</orth>, <itype>a, um, a false reading</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 2, 30</bibl>; v. Ritschl ad h. l.</entryFree>
praesterno: <entryFree id="n37997" type="main" key="praesterno"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-sterno</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n37997.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to strew</hi> or <hi rend="ital">spread beforehand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to prepare</hi> (mostly anteand post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">eo praesternebant folia farferi (al. prosternebant),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:2:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 2, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">altaria,</quote> <trans><tr>to prepare</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:2:114" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 2, 114</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jubet serta et elysios animae praesternere flores,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 2, 257</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi> fig.: <cit><quote lang="la">tuis laudibus tuisque virtutibus materiam campumque praesterni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:31:1" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 31, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illud peto, praesternas, etc. (al. less correctly, praestruas),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:8:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 8, 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praestes: <entryFree id="n37998" type="main" key="praeste^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praestĕs</orth>, <itype>ĭtis</itype>, <gen>comm.</gen> <etym>2. praesto</etym>, in relig. lang., an epithet of deities, <sense id="n37998.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">presiding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">protecting;</hi> as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a protector</hi>, <hi rend="ital">guardian</hi>, <hi rend="ital">president</hi>, etc. (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and post-class.): praestitem in eādem significatione dicebant antiqui, quā nunc dicimus antistitem, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=223" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 223</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">praestitibus Laribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:129" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 129</bibl></cit>: versus Orphici Liberum <foreign lang="greek">eu)boulh=a</foreign> vocantes, boni consilii hunc deum praestitem monstrant, <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 18</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 2, 40</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">PRAESTITI JOVI,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 22, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praestigiae: <entryFree id="n37999" type="main" key="praesti_^gi^ae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praestī^gĭae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype> (rare in the <number>sing.</number>; <sense id="n37999.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">praestigiae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Peristeph. 2, 86</bibl></cit>), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>praestinguo</etym>, <hi rend="ital">deceptions</hi>, <hi rend="ital">illusions</hi>, <hi rend="ital">jugglers' tricks</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sleights</hi>, <hi rend="ital">feats of legerdemain;</hi> lit. and trop. (class.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">captio): patent praestigiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verborum,</quote> <trans><tr>deceptive use of words</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:27:74" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 4, 27, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quasi praestigiis quibusdam et captionibus depelli,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 14, 45</bibl></cit>: omnes meos dolos, fallacias, Praestigias praestrinxit commoditas patris, Caecil. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:29:73" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 29, 73</bibl> (Com. Rel. p. 59 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">non per praestigias, sed palam compilare,</quote> <trans><tr>by stratagem</tr>, <tr>secretly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:24:section=53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 24, § 53</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 15 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Graecae istorum praestigiae philosophari sese dicentium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:23:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 23, 2</bibl></cit>: nubium, <hi rend="ital">the deceptive images formed by the clouds</hi>, App. de Mundo, p. 23, 32.—In <number>sing.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">praestigiae plausum petere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:1:77" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 1, 77</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 3, 24 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
praestigiator: <entryFree id="n38000" type="main" key="praestigi^a_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praestigĭātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>praestigiae</etym>, <sense id="n38000.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a juggler</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cheat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impostor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deceiver</hi> (anteclass. and post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">praestigiator hic quidem Poenus probu' est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 3, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 4, 4, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 45:8" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 45, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pervicaci praestigiator actu,</quote> <trans><tr>the devil</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 6, 141</bibl></cit> (with i long).</sense></entryFree>
praestigiatrix: <entryFree id="n38001" type="main" key="praestigi^a_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praestigĭātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>praestigiator</etym>, <sense id="n38001.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she who plays tricks</hi>, <hi rend="ital">juggles</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">deceives</hi> (Plautin.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 150</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:2:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 1, 2, 31</bibl> Spengel ad loc.</sense></entryFree>
praestigio: <entryFree id="n38002" type="hapax" key="praestigi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praestigĭo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>praestigiae</etym>, <sense id="n38002.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to deceive by juggling tricks</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">illa tibi numinis praestigiat divinatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1672,001:Rer. Gest. Alex. M. 1:63" default="NO"><author>Jul. Val.</author> Rer. Gest. Alex. M. 1, 63</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praestigior: <entryFree id="n38003" type="gloss" key="praestigi^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praestigĭor</orth>, <itype>āri</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n38003.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to practise sleight of hand</hi>: praestigior, <foreign lang="greek">yhfopaiktw=</foreign>, Gloss. Cyrill.</sense></entryFree>
praestigiosus: <entryFree id="n38004" type="main" key="praestigi^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praestigĭōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n38004.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of deceitful tricks</hi>, <hi rend="ital">delusive</hi> (post-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:14:11" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 14, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil praestigiosum, aut subdolum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 1, 32</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praestigium: <entryFree id="n38005" type="main" key="praestigi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praestigĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n38005.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a delusion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">illusion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trick</hi>: <foreign lang="greek">*gohtei/a</foreign>, praestigium, Gloss. ad Prud. Onom. Vet.: <cit><quote lang="la">praestigiis absolvi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 11, 23</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praestinguo: <entryFree id="n38006" type="spur" key="praestinguo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-stinguo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, a false read. for praestringo, q. v.</entryFree>
praestino: <entryFree id="n38007" type="main" key="praesti^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praestĭno</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>1. praes</etym>, <sense id="n38007.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to buy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">purchase</hi> (ante- and post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ego eo in macellum, ut piscium quidquid ibi'st, pretio praestinem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:2:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 2, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">piscis praestinatum abire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:2:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 4, 2, 68</bibl></cit>; cf.: praestinare apud Plautum praeemere est, i.e. emendo tenere, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=223" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 223</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid viginti denariis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, p. 113, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id omne praestinaturus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1</bibl></cit>, p. 104, 21 al.</sense></entryFree>
praestitor: <entryFree id="n38008" type="main" key="praesti^tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praestĭtor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>2. praesto</etym>, <sense id="n38008.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a giver</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">praestitor et tributor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Trism. p. 92</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praestituo: <entryFree id="n38009" type="main" key="praesti^tu^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-stĭtŭo</orth>, <itype>ŭi, ūtum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>statuo</etym>, <sense id="n38009.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to determine</hi> or <hi rend="ital">appoint beforehand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to prescribe</hi> (class.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: praefinio, praescribo): ei rei dies Haec praestituast proxuma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:1:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 1, 59</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 2, 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">diem praestituit operi faciundo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:56:section=148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 56, § 148</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nobis tempus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 9, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dies,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 14, 3, 4</bibl></cit>.—With a <hi rend="ital">rel.-clause</hi>: praetor<cb n="PRAE" />  numquam petitori praestituit, quā actione illum uti velit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 3, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullā praestitutā die,</quote> <trans><tr>without any fixed term</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:39:93" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 39, 93</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Chabr. 3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Chabr. 3, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praestitus: <entryFree id="n38010" type="main" key="praesti^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praestĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from 2. praesto.</entryFree>
praesto: <entryFree id="n38011" type="main" key="praesto_1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praestō</orth> (old collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">praestū</orth>, acc. to Curtius Valerianus in <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> p. 2289</bibl> P.: qui praestu sunt, Inscr. Carina Via Appia, 1, p. 217. In later time as <pos>adj.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-stus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, um: <sense id="n38011.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">bonorum officio praestus fui,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 669, 4</bibl></cit>), <pos>adv.</pos> <etym><case>dat.</case> from praestus, a <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi> form from prae, so that praesto esse alicui = to be or stand in the foremost place for or as respects one</etym>, <hi rend="ital">at hand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ready</hi>, <hi rend="ital">present</hi>, <hi rend="ital">here;</hi> usually with <hi rend="ital">esse</hi> (very freq. and class.). </sense><sense id="n38011.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ni tua propitia pax foret praesto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 1, 18</bibl></cit>: sed ubi est frater? <hi rend="ital">Chaer.</hi> Praesto adest, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:8:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 8, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:1:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 1, 1, 120</bibl>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0400,001:Tr. 498" default="NO"><author>Att.</author> Tr. 498</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod adest praesto in primis placet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1412" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1412</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 3, 7, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacrificiis omnibus praesto adesse,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 16, 10</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">more freq., praesto esse: ibi mihi praesto fuit L. Lucilius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 3, 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">togulae lictoribus ad portam praesto fuerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:23:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 23, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tibi nulla fuit clementia praesto?</quote> <trans><tr>hadst thou no compassion?</tr></trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 137</bibl></cit>: praesto esse, <hi rend="ital">to arrive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">appear</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hirundines aestivo tempore praesto sunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 48, 61</bibl></cit>.—Without <hi rend="ital">esse</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">era, eccum praesto militem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 6, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsum adeo praesto video,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 2, 5, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:643" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 6, 643</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n38011.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic: praesto esse or adire </sense><sense id="n38011.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To be at hand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to attend</hi> or <hi rend="ital">wait upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to serve</hi>, <hi rend="ital">aid</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ero meo ut omnibus locis sine praesto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:6:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 6, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jus civile didicit, praesto multis fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:9:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 9, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praesto esse clientem tuum?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 10, 8, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saluti tuae praesto esse, praesto esse virtutes ut ancillulas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:21:69" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 21, 69</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:14:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 4, 14, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ad omnia, quae tui velint, ita assim praesto, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 8, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 4, 12, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">also with videor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 12, 1</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>—With <hi rend="ital">adire</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pauper erit praesto semper tibi, pauper adibit primus,</quote> <trans><tr>will be at hand</tr>, <tr>at your service</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:5:61" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 5, 61</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38011.4" n="B" level="2"> With <hi rend="ital">esse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to present one's self in a hostile manner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to resist</hi>, <hi rend="ital">oppose</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quis mihi praesto fuerit cum armatis hominibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:30:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 30, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaestores cum fascibus mihi praesto fuerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:4:section=11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 4, § 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n38012" type="main" key="praesto2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-sto</orth>, <itype>ĭti</itype> (post-class. also praestāvi), ātum or <itype>ĭtum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n38012.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> </sense><sense id="n38012.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to stand before</hi> or <hi rend="ital">in front.</hi> </sense><sense id="n38012.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum primae praestant acies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 30</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n38012.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to stand out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be superior</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to distinguish one's self</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be excellent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">distinguished</hi>, <hi rend="ital">admirable;</hi> constr. <hi rend="ital">alicui aliquā re</hi>, <hi rend="ital">alicui rei</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in aliquā re</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">cum virtute omnibus praestarent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quantum praestiterint nostri majores prudentiā ceteris gentibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:44:192" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 44, 192</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quā re homines bestiis praestent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:4:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 4, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc praestat amicitia propinquitati, quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:5:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 5, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Zeuxin muliebri in corpore pingendo plurimum aliis praestare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:1:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ceteris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 1, 4, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suos inter aequales longe praestitit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:64:230" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 64, 230</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes homines, qui sese student praestare ceteris animalibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praestare honestam mortem existimans turpi vitae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Chabr. 4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Chabr. 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quantum ceteris praestet Lucretia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:57:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 57, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cernere, quantum eques Latinus Romano praestet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:7:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 7, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quantum vel vir viro vel gens genti praestat!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:7:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 31, 7, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genere militum praestare tironibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:52:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 42, 52, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantum Romana in bellis gloria ceteris praestat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:14" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 10, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui eloquentiā ceteris praestet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:3:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 3, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:16:17" default="NO">2, 16, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:14:13" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 14, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:18:3:14" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 18, 3, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:28:2:11" default="NO">28, 2, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:44:3:9" default="NO">44, 3, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacro, quod praestat, peracto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:12:86" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 12, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">probro atque petulantiā maxume praestabant,</quote> <trans><tr>were pre-eminent</tr>, <tr>distinguished themselves</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 37:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 37, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">truculentiā caeli praestat Germania,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cur alias aliis praestare videmus Pondere res rebus?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:358" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 358</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38012.4" n="2" level="3"> Praestat, with a <hi rend="ital">subjectclause</hi>, <hi rend="ital">it is preferable</hi> or <hi rend="ital">better</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nimio impendiosum praestat te, quam ingratum dicier,</quote> <trans><tr>it is much better</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 3, 2, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mori milies praestitit, quam haec pati,</quote> <trans><tr>it was better</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 14, 9, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praestare dicunt, Gallorum quam Romanorum imperia perferre,</quote> <trans><tr>it is better</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">motos praestat componere fluctus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 135</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 429</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 39</bibl>.</sense><sense id="n38012.5" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi> </sense><sense id="n38012.6" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To surpass</hi>, <hi rend="ital">outstrip</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exceed</hi>, <pb n="1431" /> <cb n="PRAE" /> <hi rend="ital">excel</hi> (not in Cic. or Cæs.; constr. usually <hi rend="ital">aliquem aliquā re</hi>): qui primus in alterutrā re praestet alios, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 502, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:2:10" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 2, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:3:1:3" default="NO">3, 1, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quantum Galli virtute ceteros mortales praestarent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:36:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 36, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui belli gloriā Gallos omnes Belgasque praestabant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:6" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praestate virtute peditem, ut honore atque ordine praestatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:61:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 61, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut vetustate et gradu honoris nos praestent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:30:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 30, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:34:14" default="NO" valid="yes">34, 34, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:30:2" default="NO" valid="yes">37, 30, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">praestat ingenio alius alium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:1:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 1, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:3:2:21" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 3, 2, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:3:2" default="NO">3, 2</bibl>, ext. 7; <cit><quote lang="la">7, 2, 17: honore ceteros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:18:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 18, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,021:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Reg. 3, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperatores prudentiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hann. 1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hann. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eloquentiā omnes eo tempore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Epam. 6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Epam. 6, 1</bibl></cit>.—Only aliquem, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:838" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 4, 838</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38012.7" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To become surety for</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to answer</hi> or <hi rend="ital">vouch for</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to warrant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be responsible for</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to take upon one's self</hi>, etc. (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ut omnes ministros imperii tui rei publicae praestare videare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem tamen ego praestare non poteram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 6, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quanto magis arduum est alios praestare quam se, tanto laudabilius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:83" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">communem incertumque casum neque vitare quisquam nostrum, nec praestare ullo pacto potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:17:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 17, 3</bibl></cit>: simus eā mente ut nihil in vitā nobis praestandum praeter culpam putemus, <hi rend="ital">that we need only answer for guilt</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">keep ourselves clear of guilt</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 1, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">impetus populi praestare nemo potest,</quote> <trans><tr>no one can be held to answer for the outbreaks of the people</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:28:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 28, 124</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">periculum judicii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">damnum alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">invidiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:28:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 28, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil,</quote> <trans><tr>to be responsible for nothing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 1, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. in <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum id, quod ab homine non potuerit praestari, evenerit,</quote> <trans><tr>what none could vouch for that it would not happen</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:16:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 16, 34</bibl></cit>. —With <hi rend="ital">ab aliquā re</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego tibi a vi praestare nihil possum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 4, 3</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">de</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod de te sperare, de me praestare possum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 15, 2</bibl></cit>.—With an <hi rend="ital">objectclause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis potest praestare, semper sapientem beatum fore, cum, etc.?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:10:29" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 10, 29</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">(praedones) nullos fore, quis praestare poterat?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 12, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">meliorem praesto magistro Discipulum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:212" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 212</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">illius lacrimae praestant ut veniam culpae non abnuat Osiris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:539" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 539</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38012.8" n="C" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to fulfil</hi>, <hi rend="ital">discharge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">maintain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perform</hi>, <hi rend="ital">execute</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbitramur nos ea praestitisse, quae ratio et doctrina praescripserit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:3:7" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ultima exspectato, quae ego tibi et jucunda et honesta praestabo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:17:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 17, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suum munus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:9:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 9, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hospitii et amicitiae jus officiumque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:14:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 14, 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne quem ejus paeniteret, praestiti,</quote> <trans><tr>I took care</tr>, <tr>exerted myself</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:14:19" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 14, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quamcumque ei fidem dederis, ego praestabo,</quote> <trans><tr>I will fulfil</tr>, <tr>keep the promise</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 11, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fidem alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pacem cum iis populus Romanus non ab se tantum, sed ab rege etiam Masinissa praestitit,</quote> <trans><tr>maintained</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 40, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tributa,</quote> <trans><tr>to pay</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:188" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 188</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">annua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:480" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 480</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">triplicem usuram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:9:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 7</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">promissum id benignius est ab rege quam praestitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:43:18:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 43, 18, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mea tibi tamen benevolentia fidesque praestabitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 2, 3</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">quibus (victoribus) senatūs fides praestabitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:14:11:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 14, 11, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtus vetat spectare fortunam dum praestetur fides,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:37:79" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 37, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ni praestaretur fides publica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:28:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 28, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38012.9" n="2" level="3"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n38012.10" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To keep</hi>, <hi rend="ital">preserve</hi>, <hi rend="ital">maintain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">retain</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pueri, quibus videmur praestare rem publicam debuisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 10, 4, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:748" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 748</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes socios salvos praestare poteramus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:18:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 18, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mors omnia praestat Vitalem praeter sensum calidumque vaporem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:214" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 214</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n38012.11" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To show</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exhibit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to prove</hi>, <hi rend="ital">evince</hi>, <hi rend="ital">manifest</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pomptinius praestat tibi memoriam benevolentiamque, quam debet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 3, 10, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque hercule in iis ipsis rebus eam voluntatem, quam exspectaram, praestiterunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 9, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtutem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">benevolentiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:11:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 11, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consilium suum fidemque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:33:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 33, 134</bibl></cit>. —With <hi rend="ital">se</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to show</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prove</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">behave one's self as</hi>: praesta te eum, qui, etc., <hi rend="ital">show thyself such</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 6, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">se incolumem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:220" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 220</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se invictum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:10:104" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 10, 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">teque praesta constanter ad omne Indeclinatae munus amicitiae,</quote> <trans><tr>show thyself constant</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:5:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 5, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Victoria nunc quoque se praestet,</quote> <trans><tr>show itself</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2:169" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 169</bibl></cit>: sed ne ad illam quidem artissimam <cb n="PRAE" /> innocentiae formulam praestare nos possumus, <hi rend="ital">prove ourselves innocent even according to that rule</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 2:28:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 2, 28, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">juris periti consultatoribus se praestabant,</quote> <trans><tr>showed themselves accessible</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:2:2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 2, 2</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">vel magnum praestet Achillem,</quote> <trans><tr>should show</tr>, <tr>prove</tr>, <tr>approve himself a great Achilles</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:438" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 438</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38012.12" n="c" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To show</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exhibit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">manifest</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">honorem debitum patri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:9:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 9, 5, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fratri pietatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:33:126" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 33, 126</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtutem et diligentiam alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:14:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 14, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frequentiam et officium alicui honores petenti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:50" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obsequium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 2:59:8" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 2, 59, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sedulitatem alicui rei,</quote> <trans><tr>to apply</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:18:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 18, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38012.13" n="d" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To give</hi>, <hi rend="ital">offer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">furnish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">present</hi>, <hi rend="ital">expose</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui certam summam pecuniae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:9" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 9</bibl></cit>: cervicem, Sen. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 362</bibl> P.: <cit><quote lang="la">caput fulminibus,</quote> <trans><tr>to expose</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:770" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 5, 770</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hiberus praestat nomen terris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">anser praestat ex se pullos atque plumam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:13" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum senatui sententiam praestaret,</quote> <trans><tr>gave his vote</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:32:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 32, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terga hosti,</quote> <trans><tr>to turn one's back to the enemy</tr>, <tr>to flee</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">voluptatem perpetuam sapienti,</quote> <trans><tr>to assume</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:27:89" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 27, 89</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pueri, quibus id (biduum) praestabatur,</quote> <trans><tr>was devoted</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1</bibl></cit>, prooem. § 7; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus, cui omnia olim tamquam servo praestabantur, nunc tamquam domino parantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 90:19" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 90, 19</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">praestans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">pre-eminent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">superior</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excellent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">distinguished</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extraordinary.</hi> </sense><sense id="n38012.14" n="A" level="2"> In gen. (class.). </sense><sense id="n38012.15" n="1" level="3"> Of persons: <cit><quote lang="la">omnibus praestans et ingenio et diligentiā,</quote> <trans><tr>far surpassing all</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:10:22" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 10, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">usu et sapientiā praestantes,</quote> <trans><tr>noted for their experience and wisdom</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,013:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Timoth. 3, 2</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">virginibus praestantior omnibus Herse,</quote> <trans><tr>superior to all</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:724" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 724</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in illis artibus praestantissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:50:217" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 50, 217</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praestantissimi studio atque doctrinā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 1, 4, 17</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">o praestans animi juvenis,</quote> <trans><tr>distinguished for courage</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">belli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:5:92" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 5, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">armorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:605" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 605</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praestantissimus sapientiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 6</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, with <hi rend="ital">objectclause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo non praestantior alter Aere ciere viros,</quote> <trans><tr>whom no other excelled in rousing the men</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:164" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 164</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38012.16" n="2" level="3"> Of things, <hi rend="ital">pre-eminent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excellent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remarkable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extraordinary</hi>, <hi rend="ital">distinguished</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">praestanti corpore Nymphae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praestanti corpore tauri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:550" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 4, 550</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">formā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:483" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 7, 483</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">naturā excellens atque praestans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:20:56" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 20, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui a te tractatus est praestanti et singulari fide,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 3, 10, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praestans prudentiā in omnibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,007:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alc. 5, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:13:38" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 13, 38</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid praestantius mihi potuit accidere?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Vatin. 3, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38012.17" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n38012.18" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Efficacious</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">medicina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 24, 47, § 130</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">usus praestantior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 18, 13, 34, § 126</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">calamus praestantior odore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 12, 22, 48, § 105</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sucus sapore praestantissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 15, 1, 2, § 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praestantissima auxilia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 13, 120, § 146</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38012.19" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Praestantissimus,</quote> <trans><tr>a title of the later emperors</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Nazar.</author> 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Cor. Mil. 1</bibl>.— <itype>Hence</itype>, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">praestanter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">excellently</hi>, <hi rend="ital">admirably</hi> (post-Aug.); <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">praestantissime,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:186" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 12, 50, § 186</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praestolatio: <entryFree id="n38013" type="main" key="praesto_la_tio"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praestōlātio</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>praestolor</etym>, <sense id="n38013.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the waiting for</hi>, <hi rend="ital">expectation</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">praestolatio impiorum furor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,029:11:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Prov. 11, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praestolatio tua non auferetur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 23, 18</bibl></cit>; id. Job, 17, 15.</sense></entryFree>
praestolor: <entryFree id="n38014" type="main" key="praesto_lor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praestōlor</orth>, <itype>ātus</itype> (<sense id="n38014.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> paragog. praestolarier, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:2:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 33</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">act.</hi> collat. form praestolaras, Liv. And. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 475, 32</bibl>: praestolabo, Turp. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 475, 31</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 5, 20</bibl>), 1, <hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [1. praesto], <hi rend="ital">to stand ready for</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to wait for</hi>, <hi rend="ital">expect</hi> a person or thing (syn.: opperior, exspecto): praestolari dicitur is, qui ante stando, ibi, quo venturum excipere vult, moratur, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=223" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 223</bibl> Müll.; cf.: praestolari est praesto esse et apparere, Don. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 5, 5</bibl>. </sense><sense id="n38014.1" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui tibi ad Forum Aurelium praestolarentur armati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:9:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 9, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut in Formiano tibi praestoler,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:15:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 15, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 20, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38014.2" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego illum ante aedis praestolabor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 5, 1</bibl></cit> 18; so, <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:3:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 2, 3, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem praestolare, Parmeno?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 5, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adventum illius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Judic. 9, 25</bibl></cit>: lucem, id. Job, 30, 26.—</sense><sense id="n38014.3" n="(g)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego illam illic video praestolarier,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:2:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad Clupeam praestolans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 23</bibl></cit>.— <cb n="PRAE" /> * </sense><sense id="n38014.4" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: advenientium cohortium praestolari, Sisenn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 161, 32</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praestrangulo: <entryFree id="n38015" type="main" key="praestrangu^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-strangŭlo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n38015.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to choke</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deprive of breath</hi> (post-class.): ne anxium oratorem praestrangulet, i. e. ne cogat tacere, Auct. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Decl. 3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> Decl. 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praestrictio: <entryFree id="n38016" type="main" key="praestricti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praestrictĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>praestringo</etym>, <sense id="n38016.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a binding fast</hi>, <hi rend="ital">binding up</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">praestrictio sensūs (al. praestructio),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Res. Carn. 49</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praestrictus: <entryFree id="n38017" type="main" key="praestrictus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praestrictus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from praestringo.</entryFree>
praestringo: <entryFree id="n38018" type="main" key="praestringo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-stringo</orth>, <itype>inxi, ictum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n38018.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to bind fast</hi> or <hi rend="ital">hard</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to bind</hi> or <hi rend="ital">tie up; to squeeze tight</hi>, <hi rend="ital">compress</hi>, etc. </sense><sense id="n38018.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">praestrictā fauce,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:551" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Ib. 551</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praestricta manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Troad. 560" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Troad. 560</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pollices vincire, nodoque praestringere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dracones circumplexu facili (elephantos) ambiunt, nexuque nodi praestringunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 11, 11, § 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praestringere et strangulare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:234" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 17, 24, 37, § 234</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vehementer praestringere aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:192" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 72, 92, § 192</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">umor praestrictus gelu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:217" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 17, 24, 37, § 217</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ventus praestringit atque percellit radices arborum, i. e. comprimit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:334" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 18, 34, 77, § 334</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">panis datur ex vino ad discutienda, quae praestringi opus est, i. e. coërceri, sisti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 25, 68, § 138</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n38018.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n38018.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To bind</hi> or <hi rend="ital">wind about</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">alicujus tempora sertis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5:1:112" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 5, 1, 112</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38018.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To graze</hi>, <hi rend="ital">touch</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">portam vomere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:40:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 40, 102</bibl></cit> (al. perstringere): <cit><quote lang="la">Taifalorum terras praestringens,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 31, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praestrictis palatii januis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>passed without entering</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 14, 7, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38018.5" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">rerum novarum lugubri visu praestrictus,</quote> <trans><tr>touched</tr>, <tr>struck</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 29, 6, 9</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 16, 10, 13</bibl>.—Hence, esp., <hi rend="ital">to touch in speaking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to mention</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomen,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 26, 1, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 22, 15, 3</bibl>.—With <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 21, 7, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38018.6" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To weaken</hi>, <hi rend="ital">blunt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make dull.</hi> </sense><sense id="n38018.7" n="1" level="3"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">illi quorum lingua gladiorum aciem praestringit domi, i. e. by boasting,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:6:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 6, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acies ferri praestringitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 15, 13, § 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nitorem eboris,</quote> <trans><tr>to dim</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>: vites, <hi rend="ital">to deprive them of their eyes</hi> or <hi rend="ital">buds</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:227" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 17, 24, 37, § 227</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38018.8" n="2" level="3"> Esp.: praestringere aciem oculorum or oculos, <hi rend="ital">to blind</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">aciem oculorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:1:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 1, 1, 4</bibl></cit>; Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 34, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:58:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 58, 4</bibl>; cf. oculos, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 35, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:10:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Vatin. 10, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 110:17" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 110, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">obtutum oculorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 17, 7, 2</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">vos aciem animorum nostrorum virtutis splendore praestringitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:14:37" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 4, 14, 37</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">aciem animi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:12:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 12, 2, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:118:4" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 118, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aciem mentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:29:61" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 29, 61</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">oculos mentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:12:42" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 12, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aciem ingenii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:14:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 14, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mentes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 30, 1, 15</bibl></cit>: praestigias, Caecil. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:29:73" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 29, 73</bibl> (Com. Rel. p. 59 Rib.).</sense></entryFree>
praestructim: <entryFree id="n38019" type="main" key="praestructim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praestructim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>praestructus</etym>, <sense id="n38019.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">with preparation</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">ut ad hominem praestructim perveniretur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pall. 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praestructio: <entryFree id="n38020" type="main" key="praestructi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praestructĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>praestruo</etym>, <sense id="n38020.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a foundation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">preparation</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praestructura: <entryFree id="n38021" type="main" key="praestructu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praestructūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n38021.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a foundation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">preparation</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">evangelii,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praestructus: <entryFree id="n38022" type="main" key="praestructus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praestructus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from praestruo.</entryFree>
praestruo: <entryFree id="n38023" type="main" key="praestru^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-strŭo</orth>, <itype>xi, ctum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n38023.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to build before</hi>, as a preparation for other buildings, <hi rend="ital">to lay a foundation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">praestructa (opp. ea) quae superposita incumbent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:5:9" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 5, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38023.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to build up in front</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to block</hi> or <hi rend="ital">stop up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to make impassable</hi> or <hi rend="ital">inaccessible</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">ille aditum vasti praestruxerat obice montis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:563" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 563</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hospitis effugio praestruxerat omnia Minos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 2, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">porta Fonte praestructa,</quote> <trans><tr>stopped up</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:797" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 14, 797</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">densato scutorum compage se scientissime praestruebant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 2, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38023.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to make ready</hi> or <hi rend="ital">prepare beforehand</hi> for any thing: fraus fidem in parvis sibi praestruit, <hi rend="ital">prepares</hi> or <hi rend="ital">secures for itself credibility in trifles</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:42:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 42, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">praestruit ad illud quod dicturus est, multa esse crimina in Verre quae, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0803,001:ad Cic. Div. in Caecil. 8" default="NO"><author>Ascon.</author> ad Cic. Div. in Caecil. 8</bibl></cit>: tacitas vindictae iras. Claud. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Ruf.</author> 2, 280</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">prius agmina saevo praestrue Marti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> IV. Cons. Hon. 319</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38023.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To arrange</hi> or <hi rend="ital">contrive beforehand</hi>: cum praestructum utrumque consulto esset, <hi rend="ital">whereas</hi> <pb n="1432" /> <cb n="PRAE" /> <hi rend="ital">it had all been concerted beforehand</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:53" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 53</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">id scilicet praestruentes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 31, 7</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">praestructus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">prepared</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">praestructum bellis civilibus hostem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> B. Gild. 285</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praestultus: <entryFree id="n38024" type="gloss" key="praestultus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-stultus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n38024.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">extremely foolish</hi>: praestultus, <foreign lang="greek">pa/nu a)no/htos</foreign>, Gloss. Cyrill.</sense></entryFree>
praestupesco: <entryFree id="n38025" type="hapax" key="praestu^pesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-stŭpesco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n38025.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be greatly astonished</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad quam fortunam ceteris praestupescentibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1672,001:Rer. Gest. Alex. M. 1:66" default="NO"><author>Jul. Val.</author> Rer. Gest. Alex. M. 1, 66</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praestupidus: <entryFree id="n38026" type="main" key="praestu^pi^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-stŭpĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n38026.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very senseless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very stupid</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">praestupido corde,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Juvenc.</author> 4, 200</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praestus: <entryFree id="n38027" type="main" key="praestus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praestus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. 1. praesto <sense id="n38027.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
praesudo: <entryFree id="n38028" type="main" key="praesu_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-sūdo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n38028.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to sweat before</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>). </sense><sense id="n38028.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum matutinis praesudat solibus aër,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Rapt. Pros. 2, 120</bibl></cit>.— —</sense><sense id="n38028.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to exert one's self beforehand</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:4" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 6, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praesul: <entryFree id="n38029" type="main" key="praesul"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praesul</orth>, <itype>sŭlis</itype>, <gen>comm.</gen> <etym>praesilio</etym>, <sense id="n38029.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who leaps</hi> or <hi rend="ital">dances before others</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a dancer in public</hi>, <hi rend="ital">public dancer.</hi> </sense><sense id="n38029.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:26:55" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 26, 55</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 66, 136</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38029.2" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">the leader of the</hi> Salii, <hi rend="ital">who annually leaped and danced through the city</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bearing the</hi> ancilia: <cit><quote lang="la">fuit in eo sacerdotio (Saliorum) et praesul et vates et magister,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> M. Aurel. 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38029.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">a presider</hi>, <hi rend="ital">president</hi>, <hi rend="ital">director; a patron</hi>, <hi rend="ital">protector</hi>, etc. (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">agri praesul,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fori,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 4, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praesul creatus litteris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 4, 79</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Angerona, diva praesul silentii,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 2, § 160 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">et Junone calent hic arae praesule semper,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Avien.</author> Perieg. 519</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praesulatus: <entryFree id="n38030" type="main" key="praesu^la_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praesŭlātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>praesulor</etym>, <sense id="n38030.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the office of a superintendent</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Hist. 2, 3 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
praesulor: <entryFree id="n38031" type="main" key="praesu^lor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praesŭlor</orth>, <itype>āri, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>praesul</etym>, <sense id="n38031.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to be a superintendent</hi> (eccl. Lat.), Ps.-<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:ad Fratr. Erem. Serm. 15" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> ad Fratr. Erem. Serm. 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praesulsus: <entryFree id="n38032" type="main" key="praesulsus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-sulsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>salsus</etym>, <sense id="n38032.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">salted very much</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very salt</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">adeps,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:2:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 2, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praesultator: <entryFree id="n38033" type="main" key="praesulta_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praesultātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>praesulto</etym>, <sense id="n38033.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who leaps</hi> or <hi rend="ital">dances before others</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a public dancer</hi> (only in Livy), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:36:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 36, 2</bibl>; cf. praesulto.</sense></entryFree>
praesulto: <entryFree id="n38034" type="main" key="praesulto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-sulto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>salto</etym>, <sense id="n38034.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to leap</hi> or <hi rend="ital">dance before</hi> (only in Livy): <cit><quote lang="la">praesultare hostium signis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 10, 3</bibl></cit> (cf. praesultator).</sense></entryFree>
praesultor: <entryFree id="n38035" type="main" key="praesultor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praesultor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>praesilio</etym>, <sense id="n38035.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who leaps</hi> or <hi rend="ital">dances before others</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a public dancer</hi> (post-class. for praesul), <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 2, 7, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:1:7:4" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 1, 7, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praesum: <entryFree id="n38036" type="main" key="praesum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-sum</orth>, <itype>fūi, esse</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n38036.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to be before</hi> a thing; hence, <hi rend="ital">to be set over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to preside</hi> or <hi rend="ital">rule over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to have the charge</hi> or <hi rend="ital">command of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to superintend</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n38036.1" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnibus Druidibus praeest unus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui oppido praeerat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regionibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">provinciae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 42:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 42, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">censor factus, severe praefuit ei potestati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Cat. 2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Cat. 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">classi,</quote> <trans><tr>to have the command of the fleet</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitui,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui negotio,</quote> <trans><tr>to have charge of it</tr>, <tr>to carry it on</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ei studio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:55:235" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 55, 235</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">artificio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:27:76" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 4, 27, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vigiliis,</quote> <trans><tr>to superintend</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 30:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 30, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regiis opibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,009:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Con. 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rebus regiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,019:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phoc. 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">statuis faciendis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:59:section=144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 59, § 144</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aedibus, i. e. aedilem esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:2:2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: mercimoniis, Cod. 5, 5, 7.—</sense><sense id="n38036.2" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeesse in provinciā,</quote> <trans><tr>to be governor</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:77:section=180" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 77, § 180</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38036.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n38036.4" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To be the chief person</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to take the lead</hi> in any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">non enim paruit ille Ti. Gracchi temeritati, sed praefuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:11:37" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 11, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui non solum interfuit his rebus, sed etiam praefuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 8, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illi crudelitati non solum praeesse, verum etiam interesse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:6:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 9, 6, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38036.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To protect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">defend</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">stant quoque pro nobis, et praesunt moenibus Urbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:135" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 135</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">praesens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype> (<hi rend="ital">abl. sing.</hi> of persons usually praesente; of things, praesenti), <pos>adj.</pos> </sense><sense id="n38036.6" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">That is before one</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in sight</hi> or <hi rend="ital">at hand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">present</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in person</hi> (rarely of the immediate presence of the speaker or writer, for which the proper case of hic is used; cf.
