Krebs, Antibarb. p. 908, and <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>): <cit><quote lang="la">assum praesens praesenti tibi,</quote> <trans><tr>I am with you</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:5:1:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 5, 1, 27</bibl></cit>: non quia ades praesens, dico hoc, <hi rend="ital">because you happen<cb n="PRAE" />  to be present</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:3:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 3, 39</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo praesente,</quote> <trans><tr>in whose presence</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:24:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 24, 112</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod adest quodque praesens est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:4:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 4, 11</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">nihil nisi praesens et quod adest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:17:55" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 17, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vivi atque praesentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:44:156" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 44, 156</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praesens tecum egi,</quote> <trans><tr>myself</tr>, <tr>in person</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 2, 7, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perinde ac si ipse interfuerit, et praesens viderit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:54:104" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 54, 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praesens sermo,</quote> <trans><tr>communication by word of mouth</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 8, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praesens in praesentem multa dixerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:11:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 11, 12, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:5:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 5, 34</bibl>: praesente for praesentibus (ante-class.): praesente amicis, Pompon. ap. Don. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 3, 7</bibl>; so, testibus, id. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 154, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">his,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0400,001:ib. 154:19" default="NO"><author>Att.</author> ib. 154, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0866,001:ib. 154:20" default="NO"><author>Fenest.</author> ib. 154, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0594,001:ib. 154:23" default="NO"><author>Nov.</author> ib. 154, 23</bibl></cit>: legatis, Varr. ap. Don. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 3, 7</bibl>: nobis, Ter. ib.—</sense><sense id="n38036.7" n="2" level="3"> Esp., of time: <cit><quote lang="la">narratio praeteritarum rerum aut praesentium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:4:13" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Part. Or. 4, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non solum inopia praesentis, sed etiam futuri temporis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 52 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praesens tempus futuri metu perdere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 24:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 24, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempus enim tribus partibus constat, praeterito, praesente, futuro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ib. 124:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 124, 17</bibl></cit>.—Esp. in opp. to other times referred to: <cit><quote lang="la">quanta tempestas invidiae nobis si minus in praesens tempus ... at in posteritatem impendeat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:9:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 9, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et reliqui temporis recuperandi ratio, et praesentis tuendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 8, 9, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et consiliorum superiorum conscientiā et praesentis temporis moderatione me consoler,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:16:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 16, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 1, 3</bibl>.—Very rarely alone, of the times of the writer or speaker. as opp. to the times of which he speaks: <cit><quote lang="la">quod pietas principis nostri praesentium quoque temporum decus fecit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:7:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 7, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vive moribus praeteritis, loquere verbis praesentibus,</quote> <trans><tr>now in use</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:10:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 10, 4</bibl></cit>.—Also of a time spoken of, <hi rend="ital">present</hi> to the mind, <hi rend="ital">existing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">movit Scipionem cum fortuna pristina viri, praesenti fortunae conlata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:13:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 13, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">populo erat persuasum, et adversas superiores et praesentes secundas res accidisse, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Alcib. 6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alcib. 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praetor factus non solum praesenti bello,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Them. 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et praesens aetas et posteritas deinde mirata est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:10:28" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 10, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praesentem saevitiam melioris olim fortunae recordatione allevabant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 63</bibl></cit>: in praesens tempus, and more freq. <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>, in praesens, <hi rend="ital">for the present</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pleraque differat, et praesens in tempus omittat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 44</bibl></cit>; so (opp. in posteritatem) <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Cat 1, 9, 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si fortuna in praesens deseruit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 58</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">laetus in praesens animus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:16:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 16, 25</bibl></cit>: ad praesens tempus, or simply ad praesens, <hi rend="ital">for the present</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Harpagus ad praesens tempus dissimulato dolore,</quote> <trans><tr>for the moment</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:5:7" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 1, 5, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod factum aspere acceptum ad praesens, mox, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>at the time</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">40</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">munimentum ad praesens, in posterum ultionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 1, 44</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tit.:6" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tit. 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vocem adimere ad praesens,</quote> <trans><tr>for a short time</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 22, 34, § 80</bibl></cit>: praesenti tempore and in praesenti, <hi rend="ital">at present</hi>, <hi rend="ital">now</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">praesenti tempore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:478" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 478</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec ad te in praesenti scripsi, ut speres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:10:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 10, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in praesenti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:12:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 12, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:35:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 35, 11</bibl>.—Prov.: praesenti fortuna pejor est futuri metus, Ps.-<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Decl. 12:15" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> Decl. 12, 15</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">praesentĭa</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">present circumstances</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the present state of affairs</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum hortatur ferenda esse praesentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:87" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praesentia sequi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex praeteritis enim aestimari solent praesentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:28" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed penitus haerens amor fastidio praesentium accensus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:3:6" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 3, 6</bibl></cit>.—Esp., in phrase in praesentia (sc. tempora), <hi rend="ital">for the present</hi>, <hi rend="ital">at this time</hi>, <hi rend="ital">under present circumstances</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc video in praesentia opus esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:20:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 15, 20, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">providere quid oneris in praesentia tollant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:1:section=1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 1, § 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae in praesentia in mentem mihi venerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 4, 5, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:8:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 8, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:22:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 22, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:27:10" default="NO" valid="yes">33, 27, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:28:6" default="NO" valid="yes">33, 28, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 31</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:22" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 2, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 3, 7, § 14</bibl>.—Very rarely in praesentia, <hi rend="ital">at hand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on hand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the spot</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">id quod in praesentia vestimentorum fuit, arripuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Alcib. 10:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alcib. 10, 5</bibl></cit>; cf.: in re praesenti, infra: in rem praesentem venire, <hi rend="ital">to go to the place itself</hi>, <hi rend="ital">go to the very spot</hi>, for the sake of a closer examination, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:58:250" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 58, 250</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in rem praesentem venias oportet, quia homines amplius oculis quam auribus credunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 6:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 6, 5</bibl></cit>: in rem praesentem perducere audientes, <hi rend="ital">to transport one's hearers to the</hi> <cb n="PRAE" /> <hi rend="ital">very spot</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:123" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 123</bibl>: in re praesenti, <hi rend="ital">in the place itself</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the spot</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in re praesenti, ex copiā piscariā consulere, quid emam, aequom est,</quote> <trans><tr>when I am on the spot</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:8:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 8, 65</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">eodem anno inter populum Carthaginiensem et regem Masinissam in re praesenti disceptatores Romani de agro fuerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 40, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:2:31" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 2, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">praesenti bello,</quote> <trans><tr>while war is raging</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Them. 2, 1</bibl></cit>; so <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod praesentissimis quibusque periculis desit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:7:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 7, 1</bibl></cit>; and <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam praesentior res erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:36:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 36, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38036.8" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">That happens</hi> or <hi rend="ital">is done immediately</hi>, <hi rend="ital">immediate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">instant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prompt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ready</hi>, <hi rend="ital">direct</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">praesens poena sit,</quote> <trans><tr>the punishment might be instant</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:59:122" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 59, 122</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">preces,</quote> <trans><tr>immediate</tr>, <tr>not delayed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:23:64" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 23, 64</bibl></cit> (3, 28, 12): <cit><quote lang="la">mercari praesenti pecuniā,</quote> <trans><tr>with ready money</tr>, <tr>cash</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 2, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:12:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 12, 34</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">numerare praesentes denarios ducentos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 109</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nummi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 137</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">supplicium,</quote> <trans><tr>instant execution</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Maelium praesenti morte multavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:26" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praesens debitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:1:9" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 12, 1, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:20:1:13" default="NO">20, 1, 13</bibl>: praesenti die dari, <hi rend="ital">in ready money</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quoties in obligationibus dies non ponitur, praesenti die pecunia debetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:45:1:41" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 45, 1, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libertatem aut praesenti die, aut sub condicione dare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:28:7:22" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 28, 7, 22</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-sens</orth> (opp. in diem), <hi rend="ital">forthwith</hi>, <hi rend="ital">immediately</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si, cum in diem mihi deberetur, fraudator praesens solverit,</quote> <trans><tr>in ready money</tr>, <tr>in cash</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:42:9:10" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 42, 9, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod vel praesens vel ex die dari potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:7:1:4" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 7, 1, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38036.9" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">That operates immediately</hi> or <hi rend="ital">quickly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">instant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prompt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">efficacious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">powerful</hi> (i. q. valens): <cit><quote lang="la">praesens auxilium oblatum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:49:section=107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 49, § 107</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non ulla magis praesens fortuna laborum est,</quote> <trans><tr>no more effective cure for their troubles</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:452" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 452</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo non praesentius ullum, Pocula si quando saevae infecere novercae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 127</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quid praesentius audes,</quote> <trans><tr>more effective</tr>, <tr>bolder</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:152" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 12, 152</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praesentissimum remedium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:14" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 5, 14, § 53</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">objectclause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">o diva ... Praesens vel imo tollere de gradu Mortale corpus, vel, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>mighty</tr>, <tr>able</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:35:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 35, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38036.10" n="D" level="2"> Of disposition or character, <hi rend="ital">present</hi>, <hi rend="ital">collected</hi>, <hi rend="ital">resolute</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">animo virili praesentique ut sis, para,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:8:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 8, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si cui virtus animusque in pectore praesens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:363" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 363</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animus acer et praesens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:20:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 20, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non plures, sed etiam praesentioribus animis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praesentissimo animo pugnare, Auct. B. Alex. 40: Crassus, ut praesens ingenio semper respondit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 1, 1, § 4</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n38036.11" n="E" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Present</hi>, <hi rend="ital">aiding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">favoring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">propitious</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hercules tantus, et tam praesens habetur deus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:12:28" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 12, 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:2:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 2, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 5, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">deus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:2:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 2, 2, 31</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tu dea, tu praesens, nostro succurre labori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:404" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 404</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">modo diva triformis Adjuvet, et praesens ingentibus adnuat ausis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:178" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 178</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil illo (praesagio) praesentius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:7:9" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 7, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38036.12" n="F" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Appropriate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pertinent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">timely</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">praesens hic quidemst apologus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:4:1:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 4, 1, 38</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">en hercle praesens somnium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:4:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 2, 4, 41</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praesumenter: <entryFree id="n38037" type="main" key="praesu_menter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praesūmenter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>praesumo</etym>, = praesumpte, <sense id="n38037.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">confidently</hi>, <hi rend="ital">boldly</hi> (late Lat.): aliquem defendere, Hilar. Op. Hist. Fragm. 3, 27; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 5, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praesumo: <entryFree id="n38038" type="main" key="praesu_mo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praesūmo</orth>, <itype>mpsi and msi, mptum and mtum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n38038.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to take before</hi>, <hi rend="ital">take first</hi> or <hi rend="ital">beforehand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">take to one's self</hi> (syn.: praeoccupo). </sense><sense id="n38038.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">neve domi praesume dapes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:757" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 757</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">allium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 5, 21, § 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praesumere cibis frigidam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 4, 14, § 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">remedia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">heres meus rem illam illum permitte praesumere, et sibi habere, Gai. Epit. Inst. tit. 13: praesumpto tegmine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 1:1:43" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 1, 1, 43</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:2:13:160" default="NO">2, 13, 160</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">praesumptum diadema,</quote> <trans><tr>assumed before the legal age</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> IV. Cons. Hon. 166</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suam cenam praesumit,</quote> <trans><tr>takes his own supper first</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,007:11:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Cor. 11, 21</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38038.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n38038.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To take in advance</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">praesumere male audiendi patientiam,</quote> <trans><tr>to provide one's self with beforehand</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:9:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 9, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inviti judices audiunt praesumentem partes suas,</quote> <trans><tr>who takes to himself</tr>, <tr>who encroaches upon</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 1, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:1:19" default="NO">1, 1, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">differenda igitur quaedam, et praesumenda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:63" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 6, 63</bibl></cit>: illa in pueris natura minimum spei dederit, in quā ingenium judicio praesumitur, <hi rend="ital">in which wit is preceded by judgment</hi>,<pb n="1433" /> <cb n="PRAE" />  <hi rend="ital">where judgment takes the place of the inventive faculty</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:4:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 4, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38038.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To perform beforehand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to anticipate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">heredum officia praesumere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:10:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 10, 5</bibl></cit>: hanc ego vitam voto et cogitatione praesumo, i. e. <hi rend="ital">I imagine</hi> or <hi rend="ital">picture to myself beforehand</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 3:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 1, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">gaudium, quod ego olim pro te non temere praesumo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 2:10:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 10, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38038.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To spend</hi> or <hi rend="ital">employ beforehand</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sementibus tempora plerique praesumunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:224" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 25, 60, § 224</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Vitellius fortunam principatus inerti luxu ac prodigis epulis praesumebat,</quote> <trans><tr>enjoyed beforehand</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 62</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38038.6" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To imagine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">represent</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">picture to one's self beforehand</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">arma parate animis, et spe praesumite bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">futura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 107:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 107, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">semper praesumit saeva, perturbatā conscientiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,033:17:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Sap. 17, 10</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">hence, praesumptum habere,</quote> <trans><tr>to presuppose</tr>, <tr>take for granted</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utcunque se praesumit innocentem (sc. habendum esse),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 7, 27, p. 200, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38038.7" n="E" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To foresee</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to infer beforehand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">anticipate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortunam alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eo instantius debita poscentes, quo graviorem militiam praesumebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:6:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 6, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38038.8" n="F" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To presume</hi>, <hi rend="ital">take for granted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suppose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">believe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assume</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab hostibus reverso filio, quem pater obiisse falso praesumpserat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:6:3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 12, 6, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulgo praesumitur, alium in litem non debere jurare, nisi, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:3:7" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 12, 3, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38038.9" n="G" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To undertake</hi>, <hi rend="ital">venture</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dare</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">tantum animo praesumere, Auct. Pan. ad Const. 2: illicita,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sulp.</author> Sev. Hist. Sacr. 1, 47</bibl></cit>: ad Italiam transire, Sex. <bibl default="NO"><author>Ruf.</author> Brev. 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38038.10" n="H" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To trust</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be confident</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">quoniam non derelinquis praesumentes de te, et praesumentes de se ... humilias,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Judith, 6, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de tuā misericordiā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 17</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">praesumptus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">praesumtus</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">taken for granted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assumed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">presumed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">preconceived</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">praesumpta desperatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1</bibl></cit> prooem.: <cit><quote lang="la">opinio,</quote> <trans><tr>preconceived opinion</tr>, <tr>prejudice</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:582" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 582</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suspicio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 73</bibl></cit>.—In <hi rend="ital">neutr.</hi>: praesumptum est, <hi rend="ital">it is supposed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">imagined</hi>, <hi rend="ital">presumed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">praesumptum est, quosdam servos bonos esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:21:1:31" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 21, 1, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quicumque haec noscent, praesumptum habeant, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>let them take for granted</tr>, <tr>understand without special remark</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> 14, 64</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: praesumptior, Coripp. Johan. 4, 550.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">praesumptē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">confidently</hi>, <hi rend="ital">boldly</hi> (post-class.) veritatem dicere, <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Car. 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praesumptio: <entryFree id="n38039" type="main" key="praesumpti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praesumptĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>praesumo</etym>. <sense id="n38039.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A taking beforehand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a using</hi> or <hi rend="ital">enjoying in advance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">anticipation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rerum, quas assequi cupias, praesumptio ipsa jucunda est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:15:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 15, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bonae famae praesumptione perfrui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 9:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 3, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38039.1" n="II" level="1"> In rhet., <hi rend="ital">a taking up and answering in advance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an anticipation</hi> of possible or suspected objections: mire in causis valet praesumptio, quae <foreign lang="greek">pro/lhyis</foreign> dicitur, cum id, quod obici potest, occupamus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:16" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:18" default="NO">9, 2, 18</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38039.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A representing to one's self beforehand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a conception</hi>, <hi rend="ital">supposition</hi>, <hi rend="ital">presumption</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">multum dare solemus praesumptioni omnium hominum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 117:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 117, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum contra praesumptionem suam annis decem in obsidione tenerentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:4" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non levi praesumptione credere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:41:3:44" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 41, 3, 44</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38039.3" n="2" level="3"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n38039.4" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Boldness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">confidence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assurance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">audacity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">presumption</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">illicitā praesumptione rex ad vicem sacerdotis holocaustum obtulit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sulp.</author> Sev. Hist. Sacr. 1, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">timor fundamentum salutis, praesumptio impedimentum timoris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Cult. Fem. 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cassa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 323, 17</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38039.5" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Stubbornness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">obstinacy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mirā contra plagarum dolores praesumptione munitus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8, p. 214, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obfirmatus summā praesumptione,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10</bibl></cit>, p. 243, 25.—</sense><sense id="n38039.6" n="c" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Prejudice</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 49</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praesumptiose: <entryFree id="n38040" type="main" key="praesumpti^o_se_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praesumptĭōsē</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-tŭōsē</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>praesumptiosus</etym>, <sense id="n38040.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">boldly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">presumptuously</hi> (postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">praesumptiose arroganterque loqui,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 7, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praesumptiosus: <entryFree id="n38041" type="main" key="praesumpti^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praesumptĭōsus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-tŭōsus</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>praesumptio</etym>, <sense id="n38041.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of boldness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">presumptuous</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">juvenis (al. praesumptuosum),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 1, 11</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestigia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 1, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praesumptive: <entryFree id="n38042" type="main" key="praesumpti_ve_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praesumptīvē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>praesumo</etym>, <sense id="n38042.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">presumptuously</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> in Psa. 25, 2</bibl>; Aug. c. Faust. 24, 1.</sense></entryFree>
praesumptor: <entryFree id="n38043" type="main" key="praesumptor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praesumptor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n38043.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">One</hi> <cb n="PRAE" /> <hi rend="ital">who takes possession beforehand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a preoccupier</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 1, 18</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n38043.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A bold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">confident</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reckless</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">presumptuous person</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Poen. 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Petrus ex egregio praesumptore tam creber negator effectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 120" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 120</bibl></cit>, c. 14; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 89</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">praesumptor (Adam) senserit iram meritam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sedul.</author> 2, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. Cod. Th. 16, 2, 48: Leo, Ep. 10, 9.</sense></entryFree>
praesumptorius: <entryFree id="n38044" type="main" key="praesumpto_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praesumptōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>praesumptor</etym>, <sense id="n38044.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">presumptuous</hi> (eccl. Lat.), Aug. Collat. c. Maxim, 13.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">praesump-tōrĭē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">boldly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">confidently</hi>, <hi rend="ital">presumptuously</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">praesumptorie aliquid elocutus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 41</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praesumptrix: <entryFree id="n38045" type="main" key="praesumptrix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praesumptrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n38045.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a presumptuous person</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> Chrysol. Serm. 109</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praesumptuose: <entryFree id="n38046" type="main" key="praesumptu^o_se_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praesumptŭōsē</orth>, v. praesumptiose.</entryFree>
praesumptuosus: <entryFree id="n38047" type="main" key="praesumptu^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praesumptŭōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. praesumptiosus.</entryFree>
praesumptus: <entryFree id="n38048" type="main" key="praesumptus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praesumptus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">praesumtus</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from praesumo.</entryFree>
praesuo: <entryFree id="n38049" type="main" key="praesu^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-sŭo</orth>, <itype>ūi, ūtum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n38049.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to sew over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sew up;</hi> hence, <hi rend="ital">to cover over</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">hasta foliis praesuta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">surculos recentibus coriis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 19, 43, § 96</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praesurgo: <entryFree id="n38050" type="main" key="praesurgo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-surgo</orth>, <itype>rexi, 3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n38050.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to rise beforehand</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>), <bibl default="NO"><author>Avien.</author> Prognost. Arat. 172</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praesuspecto: <entryFree id="n38051" type="hapax" key="praesuspecto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-suspecto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n38051.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to suspect beforehand</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1672,001:Rer. Gest. Alex. M. 1:43" default="NO"><author>Jul. Val.</author> Rer. Gest. Alex. M. 1, 43</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praesutus: <entryFree id="n38052" type="main" key="praesu_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praesūtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from praesuo.</entryFree>
praetactus: <entryFree id="n38053" type="main" key="praetactus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praetactus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from praetango.</entryFree>
praetaedescit: <entryFree id="n38054" type="gloss" key="praetaedescit"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-taedescit</orth>, <itype>3</itype>, <sense id="n38054.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. impers.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">it disgusts beforehand</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">praetaedescit, praetaesus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Not. Tir.</author> p. 177</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praetaesus: <entryFree id="n38055" type="gloss" key="praetaesus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-taesus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n38055.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">feeling disgust beforehand</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">praetaedescit, praetaesus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Not. Tir.</author> p. 177</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praetango: <entryFree id="n38056" type="main" key="praetango"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-tango</orth>, no <sense id="n38056.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>tactum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to touch beforehand</hi> or <hi rend="ital">previously</hi> (postclass.). </sense><sense id="n38056.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 5:7:81" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 5, 7, 81</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">leviter oleo Hispano praetactus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:ib. 4:3:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 3, 22</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38056.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to attack;</hi> of violent diseases: <cit><quote lang="la">praetacta nervositas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 1:10:71" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 1, 10, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praetacta membra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:ib. 2:11:79" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 11, 79</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praetectio: <entryFree id="n38057" type="main" key="praetecti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praetectĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>praetego</etym>, <sense id="n38057.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a covering over</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 1:9" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 1, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 3:8:131" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tard. 3, 8, 131</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praetectus: <entryFree id="n38058" type="main" key="praetectus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praetectus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from praetego.</entryFree>
praetego: <entryFree id="n38059" type="main" key="praete^go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-tĕgo</orth>, <itype>texi, tectum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n38059.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to cover over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to shelter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">protect</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in postAug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">cavo praetegit aere caput (al. protegit),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:12" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 12</bibl></cit> (4, 13), 12: <cit><quote lang="la">quae somnium (tuum) saxa praetexerint,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the rocks that sheltered your repose</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:15" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praetecto capite,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 1:5:112" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 1, 5, 112</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitia sua capillis et pallio, et (quod maximum est velamentum) divitiis praetegebat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 5, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praetempto: <entryFree id="n38060" type="main" key="praetempto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praetempto</orth>, v. praetento.</entryFree>
praetendo: <entryFree id="n38061" type="main" key="praetendo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-tendo</orth>, <itype>di, tum</itype> (<sense id="n38061.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">part.</hi> praetensus, <bibl default="NO"><author>Anthol. Lat.</author> 3, 168, 5</bibl>), <itype>3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to stretch forth</hi> or <hi rend="ital">forward</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to extend</hi> (syn. obtendo). </sense><sense id="n38061.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">praetenta Tela,</quote> <trans><tr>stretched forth</tr>, <tr>presented</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:341" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 341</bibl></cit>: propagines e vitibus altius praetentos, <hi rend="ital">shooting forth</hi>, Fab. Pict. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:15:13" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 15, 13</bibl>: ubi visum in culice natura praetendit? <hi rend="ital">set out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stationed</hi> (i. e. extendit, et posuit in anteriore oris parte), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 1, 2, § 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38061.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n38061.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To spread before</hi> or <hi rend="ital">in front</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">membrana, quae praecordia appellant, quia cordi praetenditur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:197" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 77, § 197</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:15" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 6, 5, § 15</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38061.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To spread</hi>, <hi rend="ital">draw</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hold</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">place</hi> a thing <hi rend="ital">before</hi> another: <cit><quote lang="la">segeti praetendere saepem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:270" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 270</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestem tumidis praetendit ocellis,</quote> <trans><tr>holds before</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:6:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 6, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ramum praetendit olivae,</quote> <trans><tr>holds out</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 116</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fumosque manu praetende sequaces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:230" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 4, 230</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">decreto sermonem,</quote> <trans><tr>to prefix</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quicquid castrorum Armeniis praetenditur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut adnexa classis et pugnae parata conversā et minaci fronte praetenderetur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 14</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38061.5" n="b" level="4"> Of places: praetendi, <hi rend="ital">to stretch out before</hi> or <hi rend="ital">in front of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to lie over against</hi> or <hi rend="ital">opposite to</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and post - Aug.; <cit><quote lang="la">once in Liv.): praetentaque Syrtibus arva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tenue litus praetentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Armeniae praetentus Iber,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:167" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 5, 167</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gens nostris provinciis late praetenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Baeticae latere septentrionali praetenditur Lusitania,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 1, 2, § 6</bibl></cit>: a tergo praetendantur<cb n="PRAE" />  Aethiopes, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 9, 9, § 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:134" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 27, 31, § 134</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Dardanis laevo Triballi praetenduntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 1, 1, § 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">extremis legio praetenta Britannis, i. e. opposita custodiae causa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> B. Get. 416</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38061.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n38061.7" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To hold out</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bring forward as an excuse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to allege</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pretend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">simulate</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">causor, praetexo): hominis doctissimi nomen tuis immanibus et barbaris moribus (soles) praetendere,</quote> <trans><tr>to allege in excuse for</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Vatin. 6, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praetendens culpae splendida verba tuae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 240</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legem postulationi suae praetendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:45:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 45, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid honestum dictu saltem seditioni praetenditur muliebri?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 34, 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">meminisse, quem titulum praetenderitis adversus Philippum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:54:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 54, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">decem legatorum decretum calumniae inpudentissimae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:28:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 39, 28, 11</bibl></cit>: vultum, et tristitiam, et dissentientem a ceteris habitum pessimis moribus praetendebant, Quint. prooem. § 15; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:16:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 16, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignorantia praetendi non potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:1:35" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 1, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec a se factitari praetendebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praetendere fessam aetatem et actos labores,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 59</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:5:3" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 5, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">plebeiam facie tenus praetendens humanitatem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 10, 23, p. 250, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38061.8" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To put forward</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hold out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">allege</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assert</hi> a thing: <cit><quote lang="la">nec conjugis umquam Praetendi taedas,</quote> <trans><tr>I never pretended to be your husband</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:338" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 338</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">debitum,</quote> <trans><tr>to demand a debt</tr>, <tr>sue for payment of a debt</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:14:9" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 2, 14, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praetener: <entryFree id="n38062" type="main" key="praete^ner"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-tĕner</orth>, <itype>ĕra, ĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n38062.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very soft</hi> or <hi rend="ital">tender</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">capnos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:156" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 13, 99, § 156</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praetentatus: <entryFree id="n38063" type="main" key="praetenta_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praetentātus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">praetemptā-tus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype> (only in <sense id="n38063.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">abl. sing.</hi>), <gen>m.</gen> <etym>praetento</etym>, <hi rend="ital">a groping</hi> or <hi rend="ital">feeling out one's way</hi> (postAug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 52, § 140</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praetento: <entryFree id="n38064" type="main" key="praetento"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-tento</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">praetempto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n38064.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To feel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">search</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">grope out beforehand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to examine previously</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to estimate beforehand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">anticipate</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">praetentare baculo, luminis orbus, iter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:262" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Ib. 262</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praetentat manu silvas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:189" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 14, 189</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praetentat pollice chordas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:5:339" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 339</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pedibus praetentat iter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:1:77" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 1, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cochleae corniculis praetentant iter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 32, 51, § 101</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:35" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">culcitis et stragulis praetentatis et excussis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fato pericula vestra praetentate meo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:397" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 397</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38064.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to test</hi> or <hi rend="ital">try beforehand</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vires,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">judicis misericordiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:1:28" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 1, 28</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38064.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To hold before one's self</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">praetentat pallia laevā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> B. Gild. 438</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38064.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to make a pretext of</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">impia praetentans vulnera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:75" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 75</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praetentura: <entryFree id="n38065" type="main" key="praetentu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praetentūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>praetendo</etym>, <sense id="n38065.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a military guard on the boundaries of a province</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a frontier-guard</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">Mesopotamiae tractus praetenturis et stationibus servabantur agrariis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 3, 2</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n38065.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A barricade</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 2, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praetentus: <entryFree id="n38066" type="main" key="praetentus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praetentus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from praetendo.</entryFree>
praetenuis: <entryFree id="n38067" type="main" key="praete^nu^is"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-tĕnŭis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <sense id="n38067.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Very thin</hi> or <hi rend="ital">slender</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">folium pinūs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 10, 16, § 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fila,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 16, 31, 56, § 128</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:116" default="NO" valid="yes">19, 6, 34, § 116</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bracteae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 33, 6, 32, § 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pons,</quote> <trans><tr>very narrow</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:201" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 50, 76, § 201</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n38067.1" n="II" level="1"> Of sound, <hi rend="ital">very thin</hi> or <hi rend="ital">shrill</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:41" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 41</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praetepeo: <entryFree id="n38068" type="main" key="praete^pe^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-tĕpĕo</orth>, <itype>ŭi, 2</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n38068.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to glow before</hi>; trop., of love (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">si tuus in quāvis praetepuisset amor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 3, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praeter: <entryFree id="n38069" type="main" key="praeter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praeter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> and <pos>prep.</pos> <etym>prae, with the demonstrative suffix ter, as in inter, subter, propter</etym>, signifies motion <sense id="n38069.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">by</hi> or <hi rend="ital">past</hi>, and hence, also, <hi rend="ital">beyond</hi>, or rest <hi rend="ital">outside</hi> a thing. </sense><sense id="n38069.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">past</hi>, <hi rend="ital">by</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beyond</hi> (cf. praeterquam), in the trop. sense; i. e. </sense><sense id="n38069.2" n="A" level="2"> Comparatively, <hi rend="ital">before</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beyond</hi>, <hi rend="ital">above</hi>, <hi rend="ital">more than</hi> (only ante-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">quae praeter sapiet quam placet parentibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:3:1:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 3, 1, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod mihi videre Facere, et praeter quam res te adhortatur tua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 1, 1, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38069.3" n="B" level="2"> Exceptionally, <hi rend="ital">except</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excepting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">save</hi> (class. but rare): <cit><quote lang="la">etiam e Graecis ipsis diligenter cavendae sunt quaedam familiaritates, praeter hominum perpaucorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:5:section=16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 5, § 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne quis praeter armatus violaretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:59:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 59, 7</bibl></cit> Weissenb. ad loc.: <cit><quote lang="la">diem statuit, ante quam liceret sine fraude ab armis discedere, praeter rerum capitalium damnatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 36:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 36, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">religionum usquequaque contemptor, praeter unius deae Syriae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:56" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 56</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: exsules, praeter caedis damnati, restituebantur,<pb n="1434" /> <cb n="PRAE" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:13:5:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 13, 5, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeter hodie,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:21:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 21, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nil praeter salices cassaque canna fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:406" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 406</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uti pueri in curiam ne introeant, praeter ille unus Papirius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:23:13" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 23, 13</bibl></cit>.—In connection with the particles <hi rend="ital">si</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quod</hi>, <hi rend="ital">que</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeter si aliter nequeas,</quote> <trans><tr>unless</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:41" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 41 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeter quod epulis alienis voluptates meas anteferrem, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>besides that</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 122</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">montes in Arcadiā Cyllene, Lycaeus ... praeterque ignobiles octo,</quote> <trans><tr>and besides</tr>, <tr>and also</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 6, 10, § 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeterque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 1, 1, § 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:166" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 42, 67, § 166</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:138" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 39, 64, § 138</bibl>; 11, 4, 3, § 10. —For praeter quam and praeter propter, v. praeterquam and praeterpropter.—</sense><sense id="n38069.4" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Prep.</hi> with <case>acc.</case>, <hi rend="ital">past</hi>, <hi rend="ital">by</hi>, <hi rend="ital">before</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in front of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">along.</hi> </sense><sense id="n38069.5" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, of place (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">mustela murem mihi abstulit praeter pedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:3:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 3, 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magni montes solem succedere praeter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 139</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeter castra Caesaris suas copias transduxit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">servi ejus praeter oculos Lollii haec omnia ferebant,</quote> <trans><tr>before the eyes of</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:25:section=62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 25, § 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ligures praeter oram Etrusci maris Neapolim transmisit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeter radices montis lapsus amnis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 3, 4, § 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeter ora suorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tela volant ... Praeter utrumque latus praeterque et lumen et aures,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:158" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 158</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeter majorum cineres rapitur Lateranus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:146" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 146</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38069.6" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n38069.7" n="1" level="3"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beyond; against</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contrary to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">aside from</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil praeter rem locuti sumus,</quote> <trans><tr>beside the matter</tr>, <tr>irrelevant</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeter aetatem stultus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:1:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeter aequom delinquere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 3, 3, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa praeter spem evenisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:3:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 2, 3, 69</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quor sedebas in foro Tu solus praeter alios,</quote> <trans><tr>apart from</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:3:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 3, 2, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeter naturam praeterque fatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 1, 4, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeter consuetudinem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:28:60" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 28, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum lacus Albanus praeter modum crevisset,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 44, 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod mihi videre praeter aetatem tuam Facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 1, 1, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38069.8" n="2" level="3"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n38069.9" n="a" level="4"> Comparatively, of that which goes beyond something else, <hi rend="ital">beyond</hi>, <hi rend="ital">above</hi>, <hi rend="ital">more than;</hi> esp.: <cit><quote lang="la">praeter ceteros, alios, omnes, etc.: illud praeter alia mira miror,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 140</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeter ceteros laborabis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:15:section=43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 15, § 43</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 3, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae me igitur res praeter ceteros impulit, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">necesse est quod mihi consuli praecipuum fuit praeter alios, id jam privato cum ceteris esse commune,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut Argonautas praeter omnes candidum Medea mirata est ducem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:3:9" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 3, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 31</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">neg.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nonne ostendis te vereri, quod praeter ceteros tu metuere non debeas,</quote> <trans><tr>less than the rest</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:50:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 50, 145</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38069.10" n="b" level="4"> Of that besides which there is something else in addition, <hi rend="ital">besides</hi>, <hi rend="ital">together with</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in addition to</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut praeter se denos ad colloquium adducerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeter imperatas pecunias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut praeter auctoritatem vires quoque haberet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeter illud commodum, quod, etc., tum etiam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:18" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 18</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38069.11" n="c" level="4"> Exceptionally, <hi rend="ital">besides</hi>, <hi rend="ital">except</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec nobis praeter me alius est servos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:244" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 244</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc nemini praeter me videtur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnibus sententiis praeter unam condemnatus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:20:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 20, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque vestitus, praeter pelles habeant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frumentum omne, praeter quod secum portaturi erant, comburunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullas (litteras) acceperam praeter quae mihi binae redditae sunt, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex plurimis honoribus, praeter paucos non recepit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:26" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 26</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38069.12" n="d" level="4"> Praeter haec, for praeterea, <hi rend="ital">besides that</hi>, <hi rend="ital">besides</hi>, <hi rend="ital">moreover</hi> (ante- and postclass.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:3:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 3, 61</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 4</bibl>.!*? In composition, praeter has the signification of <hi rend="ital">past</hi>, <hi rend="ital">by</hi>, and <hi rend="ital">beyond</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">besides;</hi> e. g. praeterducere, praetermittere, praeterea.</sense></entryFree>
praeterago: <entryFree id="n38070" type="main" key="praetera^go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praeter-ăgo</orth>, no <sense id="n38070.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>actum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to drive by</hi> or <hi rend="ital">past</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">deversoria nota Praeteragendus (est) equus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 15, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1672,001:Rer. Gest. Alex. M. 1:3" default="NO"><author>Jul. Val.</author> Rer. Gest. Alex. M. 1, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praeterbito: <entryFree id="n38071" type="main" key="praeterbi_to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praeter-bīto</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n38071.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to go by</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to pass</hi> (Plautin.): <cit><quote lang="la">ne inter vias praeterbitamus, metuo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:3:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 3, 43</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cave praeterbitas ullas aedes, quin, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:3:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 3, 4, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praetercurro: <entryFree id="n38072" type="main" key="praetercurro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praeter-curro</orth>, no <sense id="n38072.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>cursum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <hi rend="ital">a.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to run past</hi> or <hi rend="ital">by</hi> (post-class.): <cb n="PRAE" /> equis praetercurrentibus, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 3, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">praetercursā Chalcedone,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 22, 9, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praeterduco: <entryFree id="n38073" type="main" key="praeterdu_co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praeter-dūco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n38073.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to lead past</hi> or <hi rend="ital">by</hi> (Plaut.): <cit><quote lang="la">pompam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:1:1:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 1, 1, 67</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praeterea: <entryFree id="n38074" type="main" key="praete^re^a_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praetĕr-ĕā</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>is</etym>. <sense id="n38074.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Beyond this</hi> or <hi rend="ital">that</hi>, <hi rend="ital">besides</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si eum reddis mihi, praeterea unum nummum ne duis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:2:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 2, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihilne vobis in mentem venit, quod praeterea Crasso requiratis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:35:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 35, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec duo praeterea oppida,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:355" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 355</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auxiliis, equitatuque comparato, multisque praeterea viris fortibus Tolosā et Narbone evocatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quicquid praeterea navium habebat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:12:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 12, 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si duo praeterea talis Idaea tulisset Terra viros,</quote> <trans><tr>two more</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:285" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 285</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeterea quam (rare for praeterquam): nihil praeterea cum consule pacti, quam quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:47:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 47, 8</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n38074.1" n="II" level="1"> Distributively in succession, <hi rend="ital">besides</hi>, <hi rend="ital">moreover</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">multae sunt causae ... primum ... praeterea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:2:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 1, 2, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">primum ... tum praeterea ...,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:2:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 3, 2, 47</bibl></cit>: quicumque bona patria laceraverat; quique alienum aes grande conflaverat; praeterea omnes undique parricidae; ad hoc quos, etc.; <cit><quote lang="la">postremo omnes, quos, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 14:2 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 14, 2 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nam et ... prudentiam mihi tuam exposuit: et praeterea suavitatem tuam adjunxit: praeterea summam erga se liberalitatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc ... praeterea ... tum porro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:617" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 617</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38074.2" n="III" level="1"> In continuation, <hi rend="ital">henceforth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hereafter; thenceforth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thereafter</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">et quisquam numen Junonis adorat Praeterea?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque illum ... praeterea vidit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:502" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 4, 502</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praetereo: <entryFree id="n38075" type="main" key="praete^re^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praetĕr-ĕo</orth>, <itype>īvi</itype>, and more freq. ĭi, ĭtum, īre (<sense id="n38075.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fut.</hi> praeteriet, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,033:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Sap. 1, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ecclus. 39, 37</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Juvenc.</author> 4, 159</bibl>), <pos>v. n.</pos> and <hi rend="ital">a.</hi> </sense><sense id="n38075.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi> </sense><sense id="n38075.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To go by</hi> or <hi rend="ital">past</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to pass by</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si nemo hac praeteriit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:4:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 4, 2, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut arbitri sint, qui praetereant per vias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:5:4:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 5, 4, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeteriens modo,</quote> <trans><tr>in passing by</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:5:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 5, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quasi praeteriens satisfaciam universis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:15:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Div. in Caecil. 15, 50</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:54:200" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 54, 200</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">te praetereunte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:275" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 275</bibl></cit>.—Of impers. and abstract subjects: nec, quae praeteriit, iterum revocabitur unda nec quae praeteriit hora; <cit><quote lang="la">redire potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A.
