A. 3, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nocte hac, quae praeteriit, proxima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 2, 1, 3</bibl></cit>.—So of time: <cit><quote lang="la">biennium praeteriit cum ille cubitum nullum processerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 12, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tertius jam praeteriit annus, cum interim, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. ad Marc. 1:7" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Cons. ad Marc. 1, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38075.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To be lost</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disregarded</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pass away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pass without attention</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fulfilment</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">aut unus apex non praeteribit de lege,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 5, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">figura hujus mundi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,007:7:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1 Cor. 7, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,030:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eccl. 1, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38075.4" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to go by</hi> or <hi rend="ital">past</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to pass by</hi>, <hi rend="ital">overtake</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pass</hi> a person or thing. </sense><sense id="n38075.5" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeterire pistrinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:2:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 4, 2, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam hunc non ausim praeterire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:4:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 3, 4, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hortos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:1:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam hos cursu, jam praeterit illos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:157" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 157</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Maura Pudicitiae cum praeterit aram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:308" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 308</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeterita est virgo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:680" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 680</bibl></cit>.—Of inanim. subjects: <cit><quote lang="la">ripas Flumina praetereunt,</quote> <trans><tr>flow past their banks</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 7, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38075.6" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n38075.7" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To pass by</hi> an evil, <hi rend="ital">to escape</hi> a danger: <cit><quote lang="la">nescis, quid mali Praeterieris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 3, 4, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38075.8" n="2" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">neutr. adj.</hi>, or a <hi rend="ital">clause</hi> as subject, <hi rend="ital">to escape one</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to escape one's knowledge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be unknown to one</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non me praeterit ... me longius prolapsum esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:35:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 35, 101</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed te non praeterit, quam sit difficile,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 8, 2</bibl></cit>: nec dubitamus multa esse, quae et nos praeterierint, Plin. H. N. praef. § 18.—</sense><sense id="n38075.9" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To pass by</hi> or <hi rend="ital">over</hi>, i. e. </sense><sense id="n38075.10" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To pass over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">leave out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">omit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not mention</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae nunc ego omnia praetereo ac relinquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:44:section=106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 44, § 106</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut hoc praeteream, quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 77</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">178: omitto jurisdictionem contra leges, caedes relinquo, libidines praetereo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Prov. Cons. 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et quod paene praeterii, Bruti tui causā feci omnia,</quote> <trans><tr>what I had nearly failed to mention</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 6, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid silentio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:22:88" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 22, 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeteream, referamne tuum ... Dedecus?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:319" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 319</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut nihil praeteream,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:220" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 98, 101, § 220</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne quid praetereatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 16, 10, 20, § 50</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38075.11" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To pass over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">omit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make no use of</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">locus, qui praeteritus neglegentiā est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:prol. 14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. prol. 14</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38075.12" n="c" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To pass over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to omit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">leave out</hi>, in reading or writing, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:3:8" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 13, 3, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">litteras non modo, sed syllabas praeterit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:88" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 88</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38075.13" n="d" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To neglect</hi> or <hi rend="ital">forget</hi> to do a thing, <cb n="PRAE" /> <hi rend="ital">to omit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">leave out</hi>, in action; with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">verum, quod praeterii dicere, neque illa matrem, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:3:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 2, 3, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod sciscitari paene praeterivi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 3, p. 139, 22</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullum genus crudelitatis praeterire,</quote> <trans><tr>to leave unpractised</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 3, 2, 4</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantā vi dixisse ut nulla pars orationis silentio praeteriretur,</quote> <trans><tr>left without applause</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:22:88" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 22, 88</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38075.14" n="e" level="4"> In elections. legacies, invitations, donations, etc., <hi rend="ital">to pass over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">take no notice of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to neglect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reject</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exclude</hi> any one: <cit><quote lang="la">populus solet nonnumquam dignos praeterire: nec, si a populo praeteritus est, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum sapiens et bonus vir suffragiis praeteritur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:19:54" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 19, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Philippus et Marcellus praetereuntur,</quote> <trans><tr>were passed by</tr>, <tr>received no appointment</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fratris filium praeteriit,</quote> <trans><tr>has passed by</tr>, <tr>bequeathed nothing to</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:16:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 16, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me quoque Romani praeteriere patres,</quote> <trans><tr>neglected me</tr>, <tr>forgot me</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:312" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 312</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid repente factum, Quod sum praeteritus vetus sodalis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:86:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 86, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si eum (filium) silentio praeterierit, inutiliter testabitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 2:123" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 2, 123</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38075.15" n="f" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To go beyond</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to surpass</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excel</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hos nobilitate Mago Carthaginiensis praeteriit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtus alios tua praeterit omnes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:7:51" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 7, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut Ajax praeteriit Telamonem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:214" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 214</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38075.16" n="g" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To transgress</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">justum praeterit ira modum,</quote> <trans><tr>due limits</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:304" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 304</bibl></cit>. —Hence, </sense><sense id="n38075.17" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">praetĕrĕunter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">in passing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cursorily</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">loqui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Tractat. 118" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Tractat. 118</bibl></cit>, in Joann.—</sense><sense id="n38075.18" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">praetĕrĭ-tus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">gone by</hi>, <hi rend="ital">past</hi>, <hi rend="ital">past and gone</hi>, <hi rend="ital">departed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec praeteritum tempus unquam revertitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:19:69" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 19, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aetas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">anni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:560" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 560</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nox, Prop 2, 11 (3, 6), 9: culpa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:20:187" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 20, 187</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">labor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:7:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 7, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">secula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:4:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:42:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 42, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viri,</quote> <trans><tr>dead and gone</tr>, <tr>departed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:10:52" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 10, 52</bibl></cit> (3, 5, 36): <cit><quote lang="la">negotiantes veniā in praeteritum donavit,</quote> <trans><tr>for the past</tr>, <tr>for their past conduct</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:9" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeteritā noc. te,</quote> <trans><tr>last night</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:235" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 235</bibl></cit>.—In gram.: tempus praeteritum, <hi rend="ital">the past</hi> or <hi rend="ital">preterit tense</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaedam verba etiam mutantur, ut fero in praeterito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:4:29" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 4, 29</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-tĕrĭta</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">things gone by</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the past</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sevocatus animus a contagione corporis meminit praeteritorum, praesentia cernit, futura praevidet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:30:63" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 30, 63</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:7:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fat. 7, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">monet ut in reliquum tempus omnes suspiciones vitet: praeterita se fratri condonare dicit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">invidiam praeteritorum contemptu praesentium demere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:21:5:10" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 21, 5, 10</bibl></cit>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">praeterita mutare non possumus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:25:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 25, 59 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit> —In partic., <orth extent="full" lang="la">Praetĕrĭta</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">things passed over</hi> (Gr. <foreign lang="greek">paraleipo/mena</foreign>), <hi rend="ital">a name of the books of Chronicles</hi>, <hi rend="ital">because they contain what had been omitted in the books of Kings</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 18</bibl>, n. 1.</sense></entryFree>
praeterequitans: <entryFree id="n38076" type="main" key="prae^tere^qui^tans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praĕter-ĕquĭtans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [equito], <sense id="n38076.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">riding by</hi> (only in Livy), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:61:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 61, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praetereunter: <entryFree id="n38077" type="main" key="praete^re^unter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praetĕrĕunter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. praetereo <sense id="n38077.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> A.</sense></entryFree>
praeterfero: <entryFree id="n38078" type="main" key="praeterfe^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praeter-fĕro</orth>, no <sense id="n38078.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>lātum, ferre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to carry by</hi> or <hi rend="ital">past.—Pass.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to come</hi>, <hi rend="ital">run</hi>, <hi rend="ital">drive</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">fly past</hi> (rare, not in Cic.): <cit><quote lang="la">latebras eorum praeterlata acies est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:55:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 55, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pars vocum praeterlata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:569" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 569</bibl></cit> (Lachm. separately, praeter lata).</sense></entryFree>
praeterfluo: <entryFree id="n38079" type="main" key="praeterflu^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praeter-flŭo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n38079.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to flow by</hi> or <hi rend="ital">past</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n38079.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">aqua quae praeterfluat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:16" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 16</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: flumen, quod Valentiam praeterfluit, Sall. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 680</bibl> P.: <cit><quote lang="la">amnis praeterfluens moenia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:11:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 11, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38079.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to go by</hi> or <hi rend="ital">past</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to pass away</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">eorum ego orationes sivi praeterfluere, Cato ap. Plin. H. N. praef. § 30 Jan. (Sillig, sibi praetereo): voluptatem praeteritam praeterfluere sinit,</quote> <trans><tr>to escape</tr>, <tr>vanish</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:33:96" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 33, 96</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praeterfugio: <entryFree id="n38080" type="main" key="praeterfu^gi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praeter-fŭgĭo</orth>, <itype>ĕre, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n38080.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to hasten by</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pass over hastily</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">propositum exemplum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Spirit. Sanc. 3, 11, 78</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praetergredior: <entryFree id="n38081" type="main" key="praetergre^di^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praeter-grĕdĭor</orth>, <itype>gressus, 3</itype>, <sense id="n38081.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [gradior], <hi rend="ital">to walk</hi> or <hi rend="ital">march by</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to go</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pass by</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n38081.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: qui praetergrediebantur. Sall. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 556, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut rapiat praetergredientes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Abrah. 1, 5, 32</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">castra,</quote> <trans><tr>to pass the camp</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 3, 7, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fines,</quote> <trans><tr>to march by</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">primos suos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 50:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 50, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:52:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 52, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38081.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to surpass</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excel</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in te maxume, qui tantum alios praetergressus es, uti, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:Or. ad Caes. 1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> Or. ad Caes. 1</bibl></cit>. <pb n="1435" /> <cb n="PRAE" /></sense></entryFree>
praeterhac: <entryFree id="n38082" type="main" key="praete^rha_c"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praetĕr-hāc</orth>, <itype>also separate</itype>, <orth extent="full" lang="la">praeter hac</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>hic</etym>, <sense id="n38082.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">beyond this</hi>, <hi rend="ital">besides</hi>, <hi rend="ital">furthermore</hi>, <hi rend="ital">moreover</hi> (Plaut.): <cit><quote lang="la">si praeterhac unum verbum faxis hodie, ego tibi comminuam caput,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:4:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 4, 73</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 1, 2, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non patiar praeterhac,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 1, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:1:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 1, 1, 72</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praeteriens: <entryFree id="n38083" type="main" key="praete^ri^ens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praetĕrĭens</orth>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from praetereo.</entryFree>
praeterinquiro: <entryFree id="n38084" type="main" key="praete^rinqui_ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praetĕr-inquīro</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n38084.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to inquire further</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">in negotium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 15, 5, 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praeteritio: <entryFree id="n38085" type="main" key="praete^ri^ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praetĕrĭtĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>praetereo</etym>. <sense id="n38085.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A passing over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">omission</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 6, 29, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38085.1" n="II" level="1"> Rhet. t. t., <hi rend="ital">a passing over</hi> = <foreign lang="greek">para/leiyis</foreign>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 5, § 523</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praeteritus: <entryFree id="n38086" type="main" key="praete^ri^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praetĕrĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from praetereo.</entryFree>
praeterlabor: <entryFree id="n38087" type="main" key="praeterla_bor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praeter-lābor</orth>, <itype>lapsus, 3</itype>, <sense id="n38087.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">a.</hi> </sense><sense id="n38087.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to glide</hi> or <hi rend="ital">flow by</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to fly</hi> or <hi rend="ital">run past</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeterlabentia flumina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:3:24" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 3, 24</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tumulum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:874" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 874</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hanc (tellurem) pelago praeterlabare necesse est,</quote> <trans><tr>to sail past</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 478</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38087.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to slip away</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(definitio) ante praeterlabitur, quam percepta est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:25:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 25, 109</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praeterlambo: <entryFree id="n38088" type="main" key="praeterlambo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praeter-lambo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n38088.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to lick</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bathe</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">touch in passing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to flow by</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">oppidum, quod Mosa fluvius praeterlambit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 17, 2, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praeterlatus: <entryFree id="n38089" type="main" key="praeterla_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praeterlātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from praeterfero.</entryFree>
praeterluens: <entryFree id="n38090" type="main" key="praeterlu^ens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praeter-lŭens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [luo], <sense id="n38090.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">washing as it flows past</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">fluvius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 6, p. 177, 40</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praetermeo: <entryFree id="n38091" type="main" key="praeterme^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praeter-mĕo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n38091.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to go by</hi> or <hi rend="ital">past</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and post-class. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">saepe salutantum tactu praeterque meantum (in tmesi),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:317" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 317</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amoenitas locorum invitet praetermeantem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> in Luc. 4, 2</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">stellas (of comets),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 7:6:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 7, 6, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos (tractus) praetermeat Ister,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 31, 8, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">14, 8, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ripas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Cons. Mall. Theod. 234</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praetermissio: <entryFree id="n38092" type="main" key="praetermissi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praetermissĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>praetermitto</etym>. <sense id="n38092.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A leaving out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">omission</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sine ullius formae praetermissione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:7:31" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Top. 7, 31</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38092.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A passing over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">neglecting</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">praetermissio aedilitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:17:58" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 17, 58</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praetermissus: <entryFree id="n38093" type="main" key="praetermissus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praetermissus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from praetermitto.</entryFree>
praetermitto: <entryFree id="n38094" type="main" key="praetermitto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praeter-mitto</orth>, <itype>mīsi, missum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n38094.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To allow</hi> or <hi rend="ital">permit to go by</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to let pass</hi> (class.; syn.: omitto, neglego). </sense><sense id="n38094.1" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">nullum diem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:14:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 14, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullam occasionem profectionis, Auct. B. Afr. 1: neminem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:21:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 11, 21, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38094.2" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n38094.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To omit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">neglect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">leave undone</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullum officium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 8, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">voluptates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:15:38" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 15, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scelus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:11:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 9, 11, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praetermittendae defensionis plures solent esse causae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:9:28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 9, 28</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">reliqua quaerere praetermittit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod facere nullum diem praetermittebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,005:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Cim. 4, 3</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n38094.4" n="2" level="3"> In reading or writing, <hi rend="ital">to pass over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">leave out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make no mention of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">omit</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod verba sint praetermissa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:26:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 26, 111</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quid aut praetermissum aut relictum sit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 29, 126</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:2:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 2, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:8:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 3, 8, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">officii praetermissi reprehensio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:11:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 11, 7, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil videmur debere praetermittere, quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Epam. 1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Epam. 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod dignum memoriā visum, praetermittendum non existimavimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 3, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 6, 3, 9</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n38094.5" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To pass by</hi>, <hi rend="ital">overlook</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wink at</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">do, praetermitto,</quote> <trans><tr>overlook</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:1:1:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 1, 1, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praetermittere et humanis concedere rebus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1191" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1191</bibl></cit> (by Lachm. written separately).—* </sense><sense id="n38094.6" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To let over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">carry over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">transmit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">transport</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">an facili te praetermiserit unda Lucani rabida ora maris?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:2:84" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 2, 84</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praetermonstrans: <entryFree id="n38095" type="main" key="praetermonstrans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praeter-monstrans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [monstro], <sense id="n38095.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pointing out besides</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pointing out</hi> or <hi rend="ital">showing another</hi> (post-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:20:10:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 20, 10, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praeternavigatio: <entryFree id="n38096" type="main" key="praeterna_vi^ga_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praeternāvĭgātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>praeternavigo</etym>, <sense id="n38096.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sailing by</hi> (post-Aug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 19, § 57</bibl> (al. praenavigatio).</sense></entryFree>
praeternavigo: <entryFree id="n38097" type="main" key="praeterna_vi^go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praeter-nāvĭgo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n38097.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to sail by</hi> or <hi rend="ital">past</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">vitans praeterpavigantium officia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:12" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:8:3" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 8, 3</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Baianum sinum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Seyllam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> de Deo Socr. 24, p. 55, 30</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praetero: <entryFree id="n38098" type="main" key="praete^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-tĕro</orth>, <itype>trīvi, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n38098.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to rub off</hi> or <cb n="PRAE" /> <hi rend="ital">wear down in front</hi> (ante-class. and in postAug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">anum lima praeterunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 1, 1, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:37:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 63</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38098.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To rub down beforehand</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oleum amygdali amari praetritum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 1:17:169" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 1, 17, 169</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praeterpropter: <entryFree id="n38099" type="main" key="praeterpropter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praeterpropter</orth>, <pos>prep.</pos> with <case>acc.</case> [praeter-propter], <sense id="n38099.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">thereabout</hi>, <hi rend="ital">more</hi> or <hi rend="ital">less</hi> (ante-class.), Enn., Cato, and Varr. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:10:10" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 10, 10</bibl> (see the whole passage respecting the phrase, and Hand, Turs. 4, 544 sq.).</sense></entryFree>
praeterquam: <entryFree id="n38100" type="main" key="praeterquam"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praeter-quam</orth> (separate, praeter enim quam, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:19:45" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 3, 19, 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:3:1:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 3, 1, 38</bibl> infra), <pos>adv.</pos>, <sense id="n38100.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">beyond</hi>, <hi rend="ital">besides</hi>, <hi rend="ital">except</hi>, <hi rend="ital">save</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">neque, praeterquam quas ipse amor molestias Habet, addas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:1:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 1, 1, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verbum si mihi unum, praeterquam quod to rogo, faxis, cave,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:4:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> And. 4, 4, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virgo quae praeter sapiet quam placet parentibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:3:1:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 3, 1, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullum praemium postulo, praeterquam hujus diei memoriam sempiternam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:11:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 3, 11, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">interrogari, num quo crimine esset accusatus, praeterquam veneni ejus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:38:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 38, 105</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a quā (moneta), praeterquam de sue plenā, quid umquam moniti sumus?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:32:69" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 32, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si nullam praeterquam vitae nostrae jacturam fieri viderem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sine ullis doloribus, praeterquam quos ex curatione capiebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:21:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 21, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec quod nos ex conubio vestro petamus, quicquam est, praeterquam ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 4, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multitudo coalescere nullā re praeterquam legibus poterat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 8, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:17:6" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 17, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:48:3" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 48, 3</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">26, 42, 8: telum hastili abiegno et cetera tereti praeterquam ad extremum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:8:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 8, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cuncta potest ... vetustas, Praeterquam curas attenuare meas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:6:17" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 6, 17</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">etiam</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quoque</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tum vero</hi>, <hi rend="ital">besides</hi>, = <hi rend="ital">not only ... but also</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">malum, praeterquam atrox, etiam novum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:53:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 53, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes">30, 6, 4</bibl> Weissenb. ad loc.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:24:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 24, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Syracusarum oppugnatio ad finem venit, praeterquam vi ac virtute ducis, intestinā etiam proditione adjuta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lusit ... praeterquam Decembri mense, aliis quoque festis ac profestis diebus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:71" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">declamaverat Antonius praeterquam semper alias, tum vero nimium quantum delectabiliter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:1:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: praeterquam si, <hi rend="ital">except when</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unless</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hippopotamus tergoris impenetrabilis, praeterquam si umore madeat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 25, 39, § 95</bibl></cit>: praeterquam quod, <hi rend="ital">except that</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes mihi labores fuere leves, praeterquam tui carendum quod erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:4:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 4, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeterquam quod sine te, ceterum satis commode, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 14, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeterquam quod ita Quintio placeret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amissio nullius animae, praeterquam navis,</quote> <trans><tr>but ... only</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:27:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Act. 27, 22</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">praeterea</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeter enim quam quod comitia illa essent armis gesta servilibus, praeterea, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:19:45" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 3, 19, 45</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38100.1" n="II" level="1"> For praeterquam quod, <hi rend="ital">except that</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 10, 42, § 108</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praeterrado: <entryFree id="n38101" type="spur" key="praeterra_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praeterrādo</orth>, <itype>ĕre, a false reading for praeterea radit</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:528" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 528</bibl>.</entryFree>
praetersum: <entryFree id="n38102" type="main" key="praetersum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praeter-sum</orth>, <itype>esse</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n38102.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to be out of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not present at</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">ipsis rebus praetersumus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 38</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praetervectio: <entryFree id="n38103" type="hapax" key="praetervecti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praetervectĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>praeterveho</etym>, <sense id="n38103.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a riding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sailing</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">passing by</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">praetervectio omnium, qui, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:66:section=170" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 66, § 170</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praetervectus: <entryFree id="n38104" type="main" key="praetervectus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praetervectus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from praetervehor.</entryFree>
praetervehor: <entryFree id="n38105" type="main" key="praeterve^hor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praeter-vĕhor</orth>, <itype>vectus sum</itype> (separate, praeter erant vecti, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:713" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 713</bibl>), 3, <sense id="n38105.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">a.;</hi> prop., <hi rend="ital">to be borne past</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to drive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ride</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">sail by</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n38105.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui praetervehebantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:18:49" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 18, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praetervehens equo,</quote> <trans><tr>riding by</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:49:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 49, 6</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Apolloniam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ostia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:688" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 688</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Dulichios portus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:711" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 711</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Judaeam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:93" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Puteolanum sinum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Velabrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:37" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Caes. 37</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38105.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to pass by</hi>, <hi rend="ital">march by</hi>, of foot-soldiers: <cit><quote lang="la">cito agmine forum praetervecti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 71</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38105.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to pass by</hi> or <hi rend="ital">over</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">periculosissimum locum silentio sum praetervectus,</quote> <trans><tr>passed over in silence</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:7:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 7, 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scopulos praetervecta videtur oratio mea,</quote> <trans><tr>passed by</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:21:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 21, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratio, quae non praetervecta sit aures vestras, sed, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Balb. 1, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:56" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 56</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praeterverto: <entryFree id="n38106" type="hapax" key="praeterverto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praeter-verto</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n38106.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to go</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pass by</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">solem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:181" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 71, 73, § 181</bibl></cit>. <cb n="PRAE" /></sense></entryFree>
praetervolo: <entryFree id="n38107" type="main" key="praetervo^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praeter-vŏlo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n38107.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to fly by</hi> or <hi rend="ital">past</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n38107.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">praetervolans aquila,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:7" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 7</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem praetervolat Ales,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,060:chapter=412" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Arat. 412</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38107.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to fly</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sail over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fly across</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hasta medias praetervolat auras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:10:114" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 10, 114</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puppe lacum praetervolat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> B. G. 321</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">in tmesi: Etrusca praeter et volate litora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:16:40" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 16, 40</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38107.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to slip by</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to escape</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sententiae saepe acutae non acutorum hominum sensus praetervolant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:59:223" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 59, 223</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum sententias animis attentis excipiunt, fugit eos et praetervolat numerus,</quote> <trans><tr>slips away</tr>, <tr>escapes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:58:197" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 58, 197</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec duo proposita non praetervolant, sed ita dilatant, ut, etc.,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>do not pass over cursorily</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 13, 42</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praetestor: <entryFree id="n38108" type="main" key="praetestor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-testor</orth>, <itype>ātus sum, 1</itype>, <sense id="n38108.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. a.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to bear witness to beforehand</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">praetestata viam vitae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Carm. adv. Marc. 3, 176</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praetetianus: <entryFree id="n38109" type="main" key="Praeteti^a_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Praetetĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n38109.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the</hi> Praetetii: <cit><quote lang="la">vina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 6, 8, § 61</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praetexo: <entryFree id="n38110" type="main" key="praetexo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-texo</orth>, <itype>xŭi, xtum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n38110.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to weave before</hi> or <hi rend="ital">in front</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to fringe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">edge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">border.</hi> </sense><sense id="n38110.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">purpura saepe tuos fulgens praetexit amictus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:3:8:7" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 3, 8, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">glaucas comis praetexere frondes,</quote> <trans><tr>weave around</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:436" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 436</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 1, 1, § 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">praetexit arundine ripas Mincius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:7:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 7, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litora curvae Praetexunt puppes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 6, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fontem violis, Claud. Cons. Prob. et Olybr. 249: limina ramis, Rapt. Pros. 2, 320: ripam ulvis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 10, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sicubi odoratas praetexit amaracus umbras,</quote> <trans><tr>spreads over</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:297" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 10, 297</bibl></cit>.—In mid. force: <cit><quote lang="la">utraeque nationes Rheno praetexuntur,</quote> <trans><tr>border on the Rhine</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 34</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38110.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n38110.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To place before</hi> or <hi rend="ital">in front</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">praetendo, praepono): in his voluminibus auctorum nomina praetexui, Plin. praef. § 21: auctores quos praetexuimus volumini huic,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 18, 25, 57, § 212</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tibi maximus honor excubare pro templis, postibusque praetexi,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>that your statues stand before the temples</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:52" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 52</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38110.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To border</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to furnish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">provide</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">adorn</hi> with any thing: ex primo versu cujusque sententiae primis litteris illius sententiae carmen omne praetexitur, <hi rend="ital">the whole poem is bordered</hi> (like an acrostic) <hi rend="ital">with the initial letters from the first verse of every sentence</hi> (oracle), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:54:112" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 54, 112</bibl>: omnia quae aguntur acerrime, lenioribus principiis natura praetexuit, <hi rend="ital">has provided with</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:78:317" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 78, 317</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">praetexta quercu domus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:953" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 953</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 567</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">summaque praetexat tenuis fastigia chartae, Indicet ut nomen, littera facta, meum,</quote> <trans><tr>let my name be inscribed upon it</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:1:11" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 1, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38110.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n38110.6" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To allege as an excuse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to pretend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to assign as a pretext</hi> (syn. causor): <cit><quote lang="la">cupiditatem triumphi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:24:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 24, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomina speciosa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 72</bibl></cit>.—With <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubicumque ipsi essent, praetexentes esse rempublicam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:62:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 62, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tigellinus T. Vinii potentia defensus, praetexentis, servatam ab eo filiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 72</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38110.7" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To cover</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cloak</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conceal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disguise</hi> with any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc praetexit nomine culpam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:172" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 172</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">funera sacris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 500</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fraudem blando risu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Ruf. 1, 99</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">praetextus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">clothed with</hi> or <hi rend="ital">wearing the</hi> toga praetexta: <cit><quote lang="la">praetextus senatus (for praetextā in dutus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 1, 11: <cit><quote lang="la">pubes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Prof. 18, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38110.8" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n38110.9" n="1" level="3"> Toga praetexta, and (post-Aug.) <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">praetexta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the outer garment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bordered with purple</hi>, <hi rend="ital">worn at Rome by the higher magistrates and by free-born children till they assumed the</hi> toga virilis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:14:section=36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 14, § 36</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 1, 44, § 113</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 12, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:42" default="NO" valid="yes">33, 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 39, 63, § 136</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:10" default="NO" valid="yes">33, 1, 4, § 10</bibl> et saep.: praetextā pullā nulli alii licebat uti, quam ei, qui funus faciebat, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=236" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 236</bibl> Müll.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n38110.10" n="b" level="4"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">praetexta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (sc. fabula), <hi rend="ital">a tragedy</hi>, because celebrated Romans (like Brutus, Decius, Marcellus) were represented in it: <cit><quote lang="la">nostri vestigia Graeca Ausi deserere, et celebrare domestica facta, Vel qui praetextas vel qui docuere togatas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:286" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 286</bibl></cit>; Pollio ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:32:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 32, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">praetextam legere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 32, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38110.11" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">praetextum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> </sense><sense id="n38110.12" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">An ornament</hi>, as something wrought or fastened in front (post - Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">pulcherrimum reipublicae praetextum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 71:9" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 71, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38110.13" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">A pretence</hi>, <pb n="1436" /> <cb n="PRAE" /> <hi rend="ital">pretext</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excuse</hi> (post-Aug.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">species, simulatio): et praetextum quidem illi civilium armorum hoc fuit: causas autem alias fuisse opinantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:30" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 30</bibl></cit>: ad praetextum mutatae voluntatis, <hi rend="ital">under pretext</hi> or <hi rend="ital">color of</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipse Ravennam devertit praetexto classem alloquendi,</quote> <trans><tr>under pretext</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praetexto reipublicae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 80</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 4:25:14" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 4, 25, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praetexta: <entryFree id="n38111" type="main" key="praetexta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praetexta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, v. praetexo <sense id="n38111.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> B. 1.</sense></entryFree>
praetextatus: <entryFree id="n38112" type="main" key="praetexta_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praetextātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>praetexta, under praetexo <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> B. 1.</etym>, <sense id="n38112.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">clothed with</hi> or <hi rend="ital">wearing the</hi> toga praetexta (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">Clodius, qui numquam antea praetextatus fuisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pupillus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:58:section=151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 58, § 151</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:18:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 18, 44</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 43, 110</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">adulter,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>juvenile</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:78" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imagines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:57" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aetas,</quote> <trans><tr>the age under seventeen years</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:23:18" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 23, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praetextata cultus amicitia,</quote> <trans><tr>from childhood</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:20:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 20, 4</bibl></cit>.— Esp., <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">praetextātus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">one who wears the</hi> toga praetexta: <cit><quote lang="la">delectu edicto, juniores ab annis septemdecim, et quosdam praetextatos scribunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 57</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:1" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Rhet. 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quis praetextatum adsectatus fuerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 3:220" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 3, 220</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:308" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 308</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n38112.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, verba praetextata, prop., <hi rend="ital">veiled</hi> or <hi rend="ital">disguised words;</hi> hence, transf., <hi rend="ital">equivocal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">obscene</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unchaste expressions</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">praetextatis verbis abstinere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:22" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">impudica et praetextata verba,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non praetextatis, sed puris honestisque verbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:9:10:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 9, 10, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">mores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:170" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 170</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praetextum: <entryFree id="n38113" type="main" key="praetextum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praetextum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. <itype>praetexo</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> B. 2.</entryFree>
praetextus: <entryFree id="n38114" type="main" key="praetextus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praetextus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from praetexo.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n38115" type="main" key="praetextus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praetextus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype> (but found only in <sense id="n38115.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">abl. sing.;</hi> cf. praetextum, s. v. praetexo <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>), <gen>m.</gen> <etym>praetexo</etym>. </sense><sense id="n38115.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Outward appearance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">show</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ornament</hi>, <hi rend="ital">display</hi>, <hi rend="ital">splendor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consequence</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">majore praetextu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praetextu senatūs,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plurimorum et maximorum operum praetextu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:4:4:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 4, 4, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 3, 129</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n38115.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A pretence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pretext</hi>, <hi rend="ital">color</hi> (not anteAug.): <cit><quote lang="la">decretum sub leni praetextu verborum factum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 6, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub praetextu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc praetextu,</quote> <trans><tr>under this pretence</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:29:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 29, 3</bibl></cit>: latrocinii, Mos. et Rom. Leg. Coll. 10, 8.</sense></entryFree>
praetimeo: <entryFree id="n38116" type="main" key="praeti^me^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-tĭmĕo</orth>, <itype>ŭi, 2</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n38116.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to fear beforehand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be in fear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be afraid</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">sibi praetimet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:prol. 29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. prol. 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nil est miserius, quam praetimere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 98:7" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 98, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praetimens ne sibi desit (pecunia),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 6, 17, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aeternitatem praetimendam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Res. Carn. 35</bibl></cit> (in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:4:14" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 4, 14</bibl>, the true reading is pertimuisse).</sense></entryFree>
praetimidus: <entryFree id="n38117" type="main" key="praeti^mi^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-tĭmĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n38117.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very fearful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very timid</hi> (late Lat.), Auct. Carm. de Jona et Ninive, 65.</sense></entryFree>
praetingo: <entryFree id="n38118" type="main" key="praetingo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-tingo</orth>, <itype>nxi, nctum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n38118.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to dip in</hi> or <hi rend="ital">moisten beforehand</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in postclass. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">semina practincta veneno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 123</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aqua, in quā fuerit candens ferrum praetinctum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 1:4" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 1, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praetondeo: <entryFree id="n38119" type="main" key="praetonde^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-tondĕo</orth>, <itype>tŏtondi, 2</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n38119.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to clip in front</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">cum ejus pinnas praetotonderit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 5, p. 172, 30</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praetor: <entryFree id="n38120" type="main" key="praetor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praetor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>for praeitor, from praeeo</etym>. <sense id="n38120.0" n="I" level="1"> Prop., <hi rend="ital">a leader</hi>, <hi rend="ital">head</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chief</hi>, <hi rend="ital">president</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">regio imperio duo sunto: iique praeeundo, judicando, consulendo, praetores, judices, consules appellantor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:3:8" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 3, 3, 8</bibl></cit>.—So, in gen., of <hi rend="ital">the chief magistrates</hi> in colonies, as in Capua: <cit><quote lang="la">cum in ceteris coloniis duoviri appellentur, hi se praetores appellari volebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:34:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 34, 93</bibl></cit>; cf. the context.—Of the Roman <hi rend="ital">consul</hi> as chief judge, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 55</bibl>.—Of the <hi rend="ital">dictator</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">praetor maximus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 3</bibl></cit>: aerarii, <hi rend="ital">president of the treasury</hi>, an office created by Augustus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 75</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 4, 9</bibl>.—Of the <hi rend="ital">suffetes</hi> in Carthage, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hann. 7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Hann. 7, 4</bibl>.—Of <hi rend="ital">generals</hi>, <hi rend="ital">commanders</hi> of foreign nations, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:54:123" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 54, 123</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:33:55" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 33, 55</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Milt. 4, 4</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n38120.1" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">a prœtor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a Roman magistrate charged with the administration of justice;</hi> the office was first made distinct from the consulship A. U. C. 387. After the first Punic war, A. U. C. 490, there were two, praetor urbanus <hi rend="ital">for Roman citizens</hi>, and praetor peregrinus <hi rend="ital">for strangers</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:25:96" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 25, 96</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:20:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 20, 41</bibl>: praetor primus centuriis cunctis renunciatus, i. e. <cb n="PRAE" /> <hi rend="ital">appointed first</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Imp. Pomp. 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 1, 2</bibl>; Gai. lnst. 1, 6; <cit><quote lang="la">1, 78. The praetor had a tribunal where he sat on the sella curulis, with the judges on subsellia beside him. But he used to decide less important controversies wherever the parties found him: e plano,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:33" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in aequo quidem et plano loco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:17:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 17, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Quid vis in jus me ire? tu's praetor mihi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:3:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 4, 3, 66</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38120.2" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n38120.3" n="(a)" level="5"> For propraetor, <hi rend="ital">a proprœtor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an officer who</hi>, <hi rend="ital">after the administration of the prœtorship</hi>, <hi rend="ital">was sent as governor to a province</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:12:section=27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 12, § 27</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 4, 25, § 56 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n38120.4" n="(b)" level="5"> For proconsul, q. v., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:17:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 17, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:54:section=125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 54, § 125</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praetorianus: <entryFree id="n38121" type="main" key="praeto_ri^a_nus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praetōrĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>praetorium</etym>, <sense id="n38121.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the body-guard</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prœtorian</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">praetorianus miles,</quote> <trans><tr>a soldier of the imperial body-guard</tr>, <tr>a prœtorian</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pars praetoriani equitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 1, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">milites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:181" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 29, 35, § 181</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cohortes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 6, 5, § 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:6" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praefectura, i. e. praefecti praetorio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Epit. 10" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Epit. 10</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi> as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">praetōrĭāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <hi rend="ital">the prœtorians</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the prœtorian guards</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 74</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 6, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n38122" type="main" key="praeto_ri^a_nus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praetōrĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>praetor</etym>, <sense id="n38122.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the prœtor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prœtorian</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">tutor, Ulp. Reg. tit. 12: pretia,</quote> <trans><tr>money earned by the prœtor's administration of justice</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Conf. 6:10" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Conf. 6, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praetoricius: <entryFree id="n38123" type="main" key="praeto_ri_ci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praetōrīcĭus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-tĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n38123.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">prœtorian</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">praetoricia corona,</quote> <trans><tr>received at the public games from the prœtor</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:33:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 33, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38123.1" n="II" level="1"> <pos>Subst.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">one who has been prœtor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an ex-prœtor</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 398, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praetoriolum: <entryFree id="n38124" type="main" key="praeto_ri^o^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praetōrĭŏlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>praetorium</etym>, <sense id="n38124.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small country-seat</hi> (post-class.), Inscr. Mus. di Mantova, p. 23; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,053:27:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Ezech. 27, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praetorium: <entryFree id="n38125" type="main" key="praeto_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praetōrĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>praetor</etym>. <sense id="n38125.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A general's tent</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dictatoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperatoris Aequorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 76</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38125.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n38125.2" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A council of war</hi> (because held in the general's tent): <cit><quote lang="la">praetorio dimisso,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:5" default="NO" valid="yes">37, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">missum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:54:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 54, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38125.3" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The official residence of the governor</hi> in a province, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:28:section=65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 28, § 65</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">curritur ad praetorium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 5, 35</bibl></cit>, § 92; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:27:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 27, 27</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38125.4" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A palace</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">sedet ad praetoria regis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:161" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 161</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Herodis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:23:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Act. 23, 35</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,011:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 1, 13</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38125.5" n="4" level="3"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a magnificent building</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a splendid country-seat</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">ampla et operosa praetoria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:72" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in exstructionibus praetoriorum atque villarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:37" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 37</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:39" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 39</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">alternas servant praetoria ripas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:3:25" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 3, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:75" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 75</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:31:1:35" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 31, 1, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:16:198" default="NO">50, 16, 198</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38125.6" n="5" level="3"> Of other dwelling - places, <hi rend="ital">the cell of the queen-bee</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">et circa regem atque ipsa ad praetoria, densae Miscentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 75</bibl></cit>. —Of <hi rend="ital">Diogenes's tub</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">utcumque sol se inclinaverat, Diogenis simul praetorium vertebatur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> adv. Jovin. 2, 14</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38125.7" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The imperial body - guard</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the guards</hi>, whose commander was called praefectus praetorio or praetorii: <cit><quote lang="la">in praetorium accepti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 26 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">meruit in praetorio Augusti centurio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 20, 19, § 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">militare in praetorio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 2, 6, § 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ascriptis veteranis e praetorio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:9" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praetorii praefectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 19</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
