praetorius: <entryFree id="n38126" type="main" key="praeto_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praetōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n38126.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the prœtor</hi> or <hi rend="ital">prœtors</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prœtorian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">jus,</quote> <trans><tr>proceeding from the prœtor</tr>, <tr>consisting of his decisions</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:10:33" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 10, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">comitia,</quote> <trans><tr>the election of prœtor</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">potestas,</quote> <trans><tr>the office of a prœtor</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:24:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 24, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turba,</quote> <trans><tr>to be found about the prœtor</tr>, <tr>accustomed to wait upon him</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:52:section=137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 52, § 137</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jus praetorium, quod praetores introduxerunt adjuvandi, vel supplendi, vel corrigendi juris civilis gratiā: quod et honorarium dicitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:1:7" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 1, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 4:34" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 4, 34</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pignus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:35:2:32" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 35, 2, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tutor,</quote> <trans><tr>a guardian appointed by the prœtor Urbanus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 1:184" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 1, 184</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38126.1" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">praetōrĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> </sense><sense id="n38126.2" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">One who has been prœtor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an exprœtor</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 16, 7, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38126.3" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">One of prœtorian rank</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:14:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 14, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38126.4" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the proprœtor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proprœtorian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">domus deferebantur,</quote> <trans><tr>his official residence in a province</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:56:section=145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 56, § 145</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:19:11" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 19, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38126.5" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a general</hi>: praetoria cohors, <hi rend="ital">the cohort</hi> or <hi rend="ital">body-guard attached to every general</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a prœtorian<cb n="PRAE" />  cohort</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 40</bibl>; cf.: praetoria cohors est dicta, quod a praetore non discedebat. Scipio enim Africanus primus fortissimum quemque delegit, qui ab eo in bello non discederent et cetero munere militiae vacarent et sesquiplex stipendium acciperent, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=223" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 223</bibl> Müll.—Hence, derisively: <cit><quote lang="la">scortatorum cohors praetoria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:11:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 2, 11, 24</bibl></cit>.—The emperors especially had cohorts as a body-guard: <cit><quote lang="la">castra,</quote> <trans><tr>the camp of the prœtorians</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 9, § 67</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:37" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cohortes navis,</quote> <trans><tr>the flag-ship</tr>, <tr>the admiral's ship</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puppis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:7:7" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 7, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperium,</quote> <trans><tr>the chief command</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:32:68" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 32, 68</bibl></cit>: porta, <hi rend="ital">the gate of the camp that opened from before the general's tent directly towards the enemy</hi> (opp. the porta decumana, which was on the side farthest from the enemy), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 94</bibl>: praetoria porta in castris appellatur, quā exercitus in proelium educitur, quia initio praetores erant, qui nunc consules, et hi bella administrabant, quorum tabernaculum quoque dicebatur praetorium, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=223" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 223</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
praetorqueo: <entryFree id="n38127" type="main" key="praetorque^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-torquĕo</orth>, no <sense id="n38127.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>tum, 2</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to twist forwards</hi>, <hi rend="ital">twist round</hi> (ante-class. and post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n38127.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">praetorto capite et recurvato,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:18" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 18</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38127.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">praetorquete injuriae collum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 3, 2, 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praetorreo: <entryFree id="n38128" type="main" key="praetorre^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-torrĕo</orth>, <itype>ēre, 2</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n38128.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to heat beforehand</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">igne praetorrenda harena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 3:8:112" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 3, 8, 112</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praetorridus: <entryFree id="n38129" type="main" key="praetorri^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-torrĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n38129.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very hot</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very dry</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">aestas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0830,001:2:80" default="NO"><author>Calp.</author> Ecl. 2, 80</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praetortus: <entryFree id="n38130" type="main" key="praetortus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praetortus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from praetorqueo.</entryFree>
praetractatus: <entryFree id="n38131" type="main" key="praetracta_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-tractātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (only in <sense id="n38131.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">abl. sing.</hi>), <hi rend="ital">a preliminary treatise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an introduction</hi>, <hi rend="ital">preface</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Fuga in Persecut. 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praetrepidans: <entryFree id="n38132" type="main" key="praetre^pi^dans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-trĕpĭdans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [trepido], <sense id="n38132.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">trembling greatly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very hasty</hi> or <hi rend="ital">impatient</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">mens praetrepidans avet vagari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:46:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 46, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praetrepidus: <entryFree id="n38133" type="main" key="praetre^pi^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-trĕpĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n38133.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">trembling very much</hi> (post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n38133.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cor,</quote> <trans><tr>palpitating</tr>, <tr>throbbing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:2:52" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 2, 52</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38133.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">trembling greatly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very anxious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disquieted</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">praetrepidus vixit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:63" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Romam praetrepidus rediit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:41" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 41</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praetrunco: <entryFree id="n38134" type="main" key="praetrunco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-trunco</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n38134.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to cut off before</hi> or <hi rend="ital">in front</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to cut off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clip</hi> (Plautin.): <cit><quote lang="la">collos (for colla) tergoribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 4, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">linguam alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:3:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 2, 3, 47</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praetumeo: <entryFree id="n38135" type="main" key="praetu^me^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-tŭmĕo</orth>, <itype>ēre, 2</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n38135.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to be puffed up beforehand</hi> (late Lat.).—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">eloquii supercilio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Hist. Tripart. 1, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> in Psa. 75, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praetumidus: <entryFree id="n38136" type="main" key="praetu^mi^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-tŭmĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n38136.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">much swollen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">puffed up</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">furor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> in Ruf. 1, 225</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praetumidi supplex Orientis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> II. Cons. Stil. 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mens,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Juvenc.</author> 584</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praetura: <entryFree id="n38137" type="main" key="praetu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praetūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>praetor</etym>, <sense id="n38137.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the dignity</hi> or <hi rend="ital">office of a prœtor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the prœtorship</hi> (class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:26:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 26, 53</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeturae jurisdictio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeturā se abdicare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 3, 6, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 30</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38137.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The term of office of a prœtor</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">intra ejusdem praeturam agere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 4:56" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 4, 56</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:122" default="NO">122</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praeturinus: <entryFree id="n38138" type="gloss" key="praetu_ri_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praetūrīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>praetura</etym>, <sense id="n38138.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the prœtorship</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prœtorian</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Not. Tir.</author> p. 61</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praetutii: <entryFree id="n38139" type="main" key="Praetu_ti^i"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Praetūtĭi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n38139.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of Picenum.</hi>—Hence, </sense><sense id="n38139.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Praetūtĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Prœtutian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 6, 8, § 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pubes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:15:571" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 15, 571</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38139.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Praetūtĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Prœtutian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:43" default="NO" valid="yes">27, 43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 13, 18, § 110</bibl>; Inscr. Delfico dell' Inter. Pretuz. p. 118.</sense></entryFree>
praeulceratus: <entryFree id="n38140" type="main" key="praeulce^ra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-ulcĕrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [ulcero], <sense id="n38140.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">caused to ulcerate</hi> or <hi rend="ital">made sore beforehand</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">loca praeulcerata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 5:1" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 5, 1</bibl></cit>, n. 18.</sense></entryFree>
praeumbrans: <entryFree id="n38141" type="main" key="praeumbrans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-umbrans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [umbro], <sense id="n38141.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">casting a shade before.</hi>—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">darkening</hi>, <hi rend="ital">obscuring</hi> (post-Aug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 47</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praeunctus: <entryFree id="n38142" type="main" key="praeunctus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-unctus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from praeungo.</entryFree>
praeungo: <entryFree id="n38143" type="main" key="praeungo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-ungo</orth>, no <sense id="n38143.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>unctum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to smear</hi> or <hi rend="ital">anoint before</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">praeungendum est vulnus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Theod. Prisc.</author> 1, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">digitus praeunctus adipe anserino,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 4:3:45" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 4, 3, 45</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praeuro: <entryFree id="n38144" type="main" key="praeu_ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-ūro</orth>, <itype>ussi, ustum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n38144.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to burn before</hi>, <hi rend="ital">burn at the end</hi> or <hi rend="ital">point</hi> (class. but <pb n="1437" /> <cb n="PRAE" /> not in Cic.); esp. freq. in <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hasta praeusta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stipites ab summo praeacuti et praeusti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:73:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 73, 6</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">multae praeustae sudes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sudibus praeustis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:524" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 524</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeusta et praeacuta materia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 22 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tela,</quote> <trans><tr>hardened in the fire</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 14</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38144.1" n="II" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to scorch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">parch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wither</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne (uvae) praeurantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:Arb. 11:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> Arb. 11, 2</bibl></cit> (dub.; al. perurantur).—</sense><sense id="n38144.2" n="B" level="2"> Also of cold: <cit><quote lang="la">praeustis in transitu Alpium nive membris,</quote> <trans><tr>frost-bitten</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 20, 24, § 134</bibl></cit>; cf. aduro.</sense></entryFree>
praeustus: <entryFree id="n38145" type="main" key="praeustus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praeustus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from praeuro.</entryFree>
praeut: <entryFree id="n38146" type="main" key="praeut"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praeut</orth>, v. prae.</entryFree>
praevado: <entryFree id="n38147" type="main" key="praeva_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-vādo</orth>, <itype>ĕre, 3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n38147.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to pass before.</hi> —<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to be discharged from</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rid of</hi> any thing, with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Quintius dictaturam properat praevadere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Brev. Vit. 17:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Brev. Vit. 17, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praevalens: <entryFree id="n38148" type="main" key="praeva^lens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-vălens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from praevaleo.</entryFree>
praevalentia: <entryFree id="n38149" type="main" key="praeva^lenti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praevălentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>praevaleo</etym>, <sense id="n38149.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">superior force</hi> (post-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:6:1:23" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 6, 1, 23</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praevaleo: <entryFree id="n38150" type="main" key="praeva^le^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-vălĕo</orth>, <itype>ŭi, 2</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <sense id="n38150.0" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to be very</hi> or <hi rend="ital">more able</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to have distinguished power</hi> or <hi rend="ital">influence; to have greater power</hi> or <hi rend="ital">worth; to be superior</hi> or <hi rend="ital">distinguished</hi>, <hi rend="ital">have the superiority</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prevail</hi> (not ante-Aug.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">praesto, excello, praecedo): virtute semper praevalet sapientia,</quote> <trans><tr>wisdom prevails over</tr>, <tr>has more power than bravery</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:1:13:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 1, 13, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui praevalet arcu,</quote> <trans><tr>is a distinguished archer</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Achill. 2, 122</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulturum praevalent nigri,</quote> <trans><tr>rank first</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 6, 7, § 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aranei cum praevaluere (supra apes),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 11, 19, 21, § 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Aegypto hic mos praevalet,</quote> <trans><tr>prevails</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:185" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 17, 22, 35, § 185</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita saepius digni, quam gratiosi, praevalebant,</quote> <trans><tr>had the advantage</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:20:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 20, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae sententia non praevaluit modo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 2:11:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 11, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">certamen acerrimum, amita potius an mater apud Neronem praevaleret,</quote> <trans><tr>had the most influence</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auctoritate et praesentiā,</quote> <trans><tr>to prevail</tr>, <tr>to get the upper hand</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:19" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gratiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auctoritas Cluvii praevaluit, ut, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>prevailed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tuum erit consultare, utrum praevaleat, quod ex Arminio concepit, an quod ex me genita est,</quote> <trans><tr>which should have more weight</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 1, 58</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:5:10" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 5, 10</bibl>.— With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">praevaluit ire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,015:21:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Par. 21, 30</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">contra</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:32:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 32, 28</bibl>.—With <case>dat.</case> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">quae (mala) etiam praevalent bonis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> Epit. 68, 21</bibl></cit>: portis inferi et mortis legibus praevalere, Leo M. p. 51, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n38150.1" n="II" level="1"> In partic., of medicines, <hi rend="ital">to be of great virtue</hi> or <hi rend="ital">efficacy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">trifolium praevalet contra serpentium ictus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:152" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 21, 88, § 152</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lac praevalet ad vitia in facie sananda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 7, 21, § 75</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38150.2" n="B" level="2"> In law, <hi rend="ital">to be settled</hi>, <hi rend="ital">established</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:Inst. 1:6:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> Inst. 1, 6, 3</bibl>.— Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">praevălens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">very strong</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very powerful</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">populus, Liv. praef.: praevalens corpore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:108:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 108, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 24, 20, § 84</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praevalesco: <entryFree id="n38151" type="main" key="praeva^lesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praevălesco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n38151.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [praevaleo], <hi rend="ital">to become</hi> or <hi rend="ital">grow very strong</hi> (postAug.): <cit><quote lang="la">ante, quam arbor praevalescat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:6:17" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 6, 17</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praevalide: <entryFree id="n38152" type="main" key="praeva^li^de_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praevălĭdē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. praevalidus <sense id="n38152.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
praevalidus: <entryFree id="n38153" type="main" key="praeva^li^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praevălĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>praevaleo</etym>, <sense id="n38153.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very strong</hi> (not in Cic. or Cæs.). </sense><sense id="n38153.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n38153.2" n="A" level="2"> Of persons: <cit><quote lang="la">juvenis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:69:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 69, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cohortes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 28</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38153.3" n="B" level="2"> Of things: <cit><quote lang="la">manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:9:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 9, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ramus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:5" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38153.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">very strong</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very powerful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prevailing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prevalent.</hi> </sense><sense id="n38153.5" n="A" level="2"> Of persons, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 35</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38153.6" n="B" level="2"> Of things: <cit><quote lang="la">urbes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neu (terra) se praevalidam primis ostendat aristis,</quote> <trans><tr>too strong</tr>, <tr>bearing too abundantly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:252" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 252</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomina equitum,</quote> <trans><tr>great</tr>, <tr>imposing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 60 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praevalida et adulta vitia,</quote> <trans><tr>prevalent</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 53</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">praevă-lĭdē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">very strongly</hi> (post-Aug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 14, 24, § 108</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praevallo: <entryFree id="n38154" type="main" key="praevallo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-vallo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n38154.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to fortify in front</hi> (post-class.): pontem, Auct. B. Alex. 19; Claud. ap. I. Cons. Stil. 2, 188.</sense></entryFree>
praevaporo: <entryFree id="n38155" type="main" key="praeva^po_ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-văpōro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n38155.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to fumigate</hi> or <hi rend="ital">perfume beforehand</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">loca,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 1:3" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praevaporata loca,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Theod. Prisc.</author> 1, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praevaricatio: <entryFree id="n38156" type="main" key="praeva_ri^ca_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praevārĭcātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>praevaricor</etym>, <sense id="n38156.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a stepping out of the line of duty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a violation of duty;</hi> esp. of an advocate who has a secret understanding with the opposite party, <hi rend="ital">the making of a sham accusation</hi> or <hi rend="ital">defence</hi>, <cb n="PRAE" /> <hi rend="ital">collusion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prevarication</hi> (class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Part. 36, 124</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">de praevaricatione absolutus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:16:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 16, 3</bibl></cit>: praevaricatio est, transire dicenda; <cit><quote lang="la">praevaricatio etiam, cursim et breviter attingere, quae sint inculcanda, infigenda, repetenda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:20:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 20, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praevaricationis crimine corruere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 3:9:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 9, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praevaricationis damnatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n38156.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Transgression</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deviation from</hi> duty or law (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">ubi enim non est lex, nec praevaricatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,006:4:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Rom. 4, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in redemptionem earum praevaricationum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,019:9:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heb. 9, 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praevaricator: <entryFree id="n38157" type="main" key="praeva_ri^ca_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praevārĭcātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>praevaricor</etym>, <sense id="n38157.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who violates his duty;</hi> esp. of an advocate who is guilty of collusion with the opposite party, <hi rend="ital">a sham accuser</hi> or <hi rend="ital">defender</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a prevaricator</hi> (class.): praevaricatores a praetergrediendo sunt vocitati, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=226" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 226</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">praevaricator significat eum, qui in contrariis causis quasi varie esse positus videatur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Part. 36, 126</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praevaricatorem esse eum ostendimus, qui colludit cum reo, et translaticie munere accusandi defungitur, eo quod proprias quidem probationes dissimularet, falsas vero rei excusationes admitteret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:16:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 16, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praevaricator autem est quasi varicator, qui diversam partem adjuvat, prodita causa sua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:2:4" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 3, 2, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:18:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Div. in Caecil. 18, 58</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">praevaricatorem sibi apponere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:11:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 11, 25</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">praevaricator Catilinae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:10:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 10, 23</bibl></cit>: causae publicae, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 11, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38157.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A sinner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">transgressor</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">legis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,006:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Rom. 2, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,009:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Gal. 2, 18</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n38157.2" n="B" level="2"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">an apostate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nos praevaricatores eos existimamus qui susceptam fidem et cognitionem Dei adeptam relinquunt, Hilar. in Psa. 118, 15, 11: Dei,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 2, 16</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> ad Marc. 4, 43</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praevaricatrix: <entryFree id="n38158" type="main" key="praeva_ri^ca_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-vārĭcātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>praevaricator</etym>, <sense id="n38158.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she who transgresses</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sins</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 89:20" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 89, 20</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Isa. 5, 12, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> in Matt. 22, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,049:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Jer. 3, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praevaricor: <entryFree id="n38159" type="main" key="praeva_ri^cor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-vārĭcor</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos>, <sense id="n38159.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to walk crookedly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not to walk straight.</hi> * </sense><sense id="n38159.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">arator praevaricatur,</quote> <trans><tr>makes a crooked furrow</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:179" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 19, 49, § 179</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38159.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n38159.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To walk crookedly in the discharge of one's duty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not to act uprightly;</hi> esp. of an advocate who is guilty of collusion with the opposite party, <hi rend="ital">to make a sham accusation</hi> or <hi rend="ital">defence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to collude</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prevaricate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui praevaricatur, ex utrāque parte consistit, quinimo ex alterā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47:15:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 47, 15, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. Plin. l. c. supra: a Catilina pecuniam accepit, ut turpissime praevaricaretur, Auct. Har. Resp. 20; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:9:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 9, 29</bibl>.—With <case>dat.</case>, <hi rend="ital">to favor collusively</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">interdum non defendere, sed praevaricari accusationi videbatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:21:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 21, 58</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38159.4" n="B" level="2"> Late Lat., <hi rend="ital">to transgress</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sin against</hi>, <hi rend="ital">violate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pactum meum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,006:7:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Jos. 7, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contra me,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,005:32:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Deut. 32, 51</bibl></cit>: legem, id. Osee, 8, 1.—Also in the form <orth extent="full" lang="la">praevā-rĭco</orth>, āre: <cit><quote lang="la">quod audivit, praevaricavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Tract. in Joann. 99" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Tract. in Joann. 99</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> 8, 6, 29</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praevarus: <entryFree id="n38160" type="main" key="praeva_rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-vārus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n38160.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very irregular</hi> or <hi rend="ital">unsteady</hi> (very rare). </sense><sense id="n38160.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">venarum pulsus praevaros (al. praeclaros, i. e. certos, distinctos),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. p. 362, 17</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n38160.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">very perverse</hi>: quid enim tam praevarum? Cic. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 10, 233</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praevectus: <entryFree id="n38161" type="main" key="praevectus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praevectus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from praevehor.</entryFree>
praevehor: <entryFree id="n38162" type="main" key="praeve^hor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-vĕhor</orth>, <itype>ctus, 3</itype>, <sense id="n38162.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">a.</hi> </sense><sense id="n38162.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To ride</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fly</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">flow before</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in front</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">past</hi> (not in Cic. or Cæs.): <cit><quote lang="la">equites Romani praevecti,</quote> <trans><tr>who had ridden before them</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praevectus equo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:166" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 166</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praevectus ad Germanicum exercitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:5:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 5, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum missilia hostium praevehuntur,</quote> <trans><tr>fly before them</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 71</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38162.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to rush</hi> or <hi rend="ital">flow past</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Rhenus servat nomen, quā Germaniam praevehitur,</quote> <trans><tr>flows by</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38162.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to flow forth</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia haec mire placent, cum impetu quodam et flumine praevehuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:16:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 16, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praevello: <entryFree id="n38163" type="main" key="praevello"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-vello</orth>, <itype>velli or vulsi, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n38163.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to tear away before</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to tear away</hi> (ante- and post-class.), Laber. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 369</bibl> P.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Gnost. 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praevelo: <entryFree id="n38164" type="main" key="praeve_lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-vēlo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n38164.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to veil</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cover over; to conceal by placing before</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">flammea praevelatura pudorem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Rapt. Pros. 2, 325</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praevelans fronde secures,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> VI. Cons. Honor. 647</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amnem Tiberis domibus amoenis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Laud. Stil. 2, 189</bibl></cit>. <cb n="PRAE" /></sense></entryFree>
praevelox: <entryFree id="n38165" type="main" key="praeve_lox"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-vēlox</orth>, <itype>ōcis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n38165.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very fleet</hi> or <hi rend="ital">swift</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">praevelocibus camelis fugientes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 31, 36, § 111</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">memoria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:44" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 2, 44</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praevenio: <entryFree id="n38166" type="main" key="praeve^ni^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-vĕnĭo</orth>, <itype>vēni, ventum, 4</itype> (in tmesi: <sense id="n38166.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">praeque diem veniens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:8:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 8, 17</bibl></cit>), <pos>v. n.</pos> and <hi rend="ital">a.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to come before</hi>, <hi rend="ital">precede</hi>, <hi rend="ital">get the start of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to outstrip</hi>, <hi rend="ital">anticipate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to prevent</hi> (postAug.; for, in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:7:33" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 7, 33</bibl>, the correct reading is peremisset; cf.: antevenio, antecedo, praeverto); constr. <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> or with <case>acc.</case> </sense><sense id="n38166.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostis breviore viā praeventurus erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praevenerat non fama solum, sed nuncius etiam ex regiis servis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lucifero praeveniente,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:548" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 548</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38166.2" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">talia agentem mors praevenit,</quote> <trans><tr>anticipated him</tr>, <tr>prevented the execution of his plans</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:44" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">desiderium plebis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">damnationis ignominiam voluntariā morte praevenit,</quote> <trans><tr>anticipated</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:1:3:3" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 1, 3, 3</bibl></cit>.—In <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be prevented</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hindered</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">quae ipse paravisset facere, perfidiā clientis sui praeventa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 71:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 71, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod non praeventum morte fuisse, dolet,</quote> <trans><tr>prevented by death</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:4:32" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 4, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">peregissetque ultionem, nisi morte praeventus fuisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:32:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 32, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeventus est ab Agrippinā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:44" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 44</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 1, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi praeveniretur Agrippina,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>if she had not been killed beforehand</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si maritus sit in magistratu, potest praeveniri a patre,</quote> <trans><tr>the father can bring the accusation first</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:5:15" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 5, 15</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38166.3" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To come</hi> or <hi rend="ital">go beforehand</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">ut praeveniant ad vos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,008:9:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Cor. 9, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praevenit ungere corpus meum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,002:14:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Marc. 14, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38166.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to surpass</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be superior</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">Nomentanae vites fecunditate (Amineas) praeveniunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:2:14" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 2, 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praeventio: <entryFree id="n38167" type="main" key="praeventi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praeventĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>praevenio</etym>, <sense id="n38167.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an anticipating</hi> (eccl. Lat.), Aug. c. Gaudent. 1, 14; Primas in Gal. 6.</sense></entryFree>
praeventor: <entryFree id="n38168" type="main" key="praeventor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praeventor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n38168.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of soldiers</hi>, perh. <hi rend="ital">those who began the attack</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 18, 9, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praeventus: <entryFree id="n38169" type="main" key="praeventus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praeventus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from praevenio.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n38170" type="main" key="praeventus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praeventus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype> (only in <sense id="n38170.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">abl. sing.</hi>), <gen>m.</gen> <etym>praevenio</etym>, <hi rend="ital">a preventing</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">mortis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 5, 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praeverbium: <entryFree id="n38171" type="main" key="praeverbi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praeverbĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>prae-verbum</etym>. —In gram., <sense id="n38171.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a preposition</hi> (ante- and postclass.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6</bibl>, §§ 38, 82 Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:7:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 7, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praevernat: <entryFree id="n38172" type="main" key="praevernat"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-vernat</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n38172.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. impers.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be spring too early</hi> or <hi rend="ital">before the time</hi> (postAug.): <cit><quote lang="la">quando praevernat,</quote> <trans><tr>when spring opens too soon</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:239" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 26, 65, § 239</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praeverro: <entryFree id="n38173" type="main" key="praeverro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-verro</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n38173.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to sweep</hi> or <hi rend="ital">brush before</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">veste vias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:13:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 13, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeverrit cauda silices (al. perverrit),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> M. 23</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praeverto: <entryFree id="n38174" type="main" key="praeverto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-verto</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-vorto</orth>, <itype>ti, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, and (only in present tense) <orth extent="full" lang="la">praevertor</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-vortor</orth> (<sense id="n38174.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inf. pass.</hi> paragog. praevortier, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:3:2:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 3, 2, 39</bibl>), <itype>3</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos> </sense><sense id="n38174.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To prefer</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne me uxorem praevertisse dicant prae republicā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:3:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 3, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si vacas animo, neque habes aliquid, quod huic sermoni praevertendum putes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:6:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 6, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:3:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 3, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38174.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To go before</hi>, <hi rend="ital">precede</hi>, <hi rend="ital">outstrip</hi>, <hi rend="ital">outrun.</hi> </sense><sense id="n38174.3" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">cursu pedum ventos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:807" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 807</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equo ventos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 345</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">volucremque fugā praevertitur Eurum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 317</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestigia cervae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:341" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 341</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:5:691" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 5, 691</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38174.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n38174.5" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To be beforehand with</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to anticipate;</hi> with <case>acc.</case>, <hi rend="ital">to prevent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make useless</hi>: nostra omnis lis est: pulcre praevortar viros, <hi rend="ital">will anticipate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be beforehand with them</hi> (cf. praevenio), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:8:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 8, 75</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aggerem et vineas egit, turresque admovit: quorum usum forte oblata opportunitas praevertit,</quote> <trans><tr>has rendered useless</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praevertunt, inquit, me fata,</quote> <trans><tr>prevent me</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:657" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 657</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">celeri praevertit tristia leto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:8:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 8, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae absolvi, quoniam mors praeverterat, nequiverunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:10:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 10, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38174.6" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To take possession of beforehand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to preoccupy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prepossess</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vivo tentat praevertere amore Jampridem resides animos,</quote> <trans><tr>to prepossess</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:722" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 722</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">neque praevorto poculum,</quote> <trans><tr>take before my turn</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 59</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38174.7" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To surpass</hi> in worth, <hi rend="ital">outweigh</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exceed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be preferable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of more importance</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">erilis praevertit metus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:5:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 5, 1, 16</bibl></cit>: quoniam pietatem amori tuo video praevortere, <hi rend="ital">outweigh</hi>,<pb n="1438" /> <cb n="PRAE" />  <hi rend="ital">exceed</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:3:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 3, 59</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec posse, cum hostes prope ad portas essent, bello praevertisse quicquam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 24</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38174.8" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To turn one's attention first</hi> or <hi rend="ital">principally to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to do first</hi> or <hi rend="ital">in preference</hi> to any thing else, <hi rend="ital">to despatch first;</hi> used esp. in the <hi rend="ital">dep.</hi> </sense><sense id="n38174.9" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rei mandatae omnes sapientes primum praevorti decet,</quote> <trans><tr>to apply themselves principally to it</tr>, <tr>to despatch it first</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:3:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 2, 3, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ei rei primum praevorti volo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:3:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 2, 3, 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stultitia est, cui bene esse licet, cum praevorti litibus,</quote> <trans><tr>to occupy one's self with contentions</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:5:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 5, 2, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cave, pigritiae praevorteris,</quote> <trans><tr>do not give yourself up to indolence</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:1:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 1, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">etsi ab hoste discedere detrimentosum esse existimabat, tamen huic rei praevertendum existimavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 33</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38174.10" n="(b)" level="5"> With <case>acc.</case>, <hi rend="ital">to do</hi> or <hi rend="ital">attend to in preference</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc praevortar principio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 2, 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quid dictum est per jocum, non aequom est, id te serio praevortier,</quote> <trans><tr>to take it in earnest</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:3:2:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 3, 2, 39</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliud in praesentia praevertendum sibi esse dixit,</quote> <trans><tr>that must be attended to first</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 35, 33</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">praevorti hoc certum est rebus aliis omnibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:5:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 5, 1, 8</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n38174.11" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to apply one's self particularly to</hi> any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">si quando ad interna praeverterent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 32</bibl></cit>; so, praevertor, <hi rend="ital">dep.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc praevertemur ad nostrum orbem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 9, 33, § 123</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc praevertemur ad differentias aeris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 34, 8, 20, § 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad ea praeverti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostes ad occursandum pugnandumque in eos praevertentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:7:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 7, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38174.12" n="(d)" level="5"> With an <hi rend="ital">adverb of place</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">illuc praevertamur,</quote> <trans><tr>let us first of all look at this</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 38</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) With a <hi rend="ital">rel.-clause;</hi> proximum erat narrare glandiferas quoque, ni praeverti cogeret admiratio, quaenam esset vita sine arbore ullā, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:H. N. 16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> H. N. 16</bibl>, praef. § 1.—（<foreign lang="greek">z</foreign>) <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">in rem quod sit, praevortaris, potius quam, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>do</tr>, <tr>perform</tr>, <tr>attend to</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 3, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praevetitus: <entryFree id="n38175" type="main" key="praeve^ti^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-vĕtĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [veto], <sense id="n38175.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">forbidden beforehand</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:13:155" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 13, 155</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praevexatus: <entryFree id="n38176" type="main" key="praevexa_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-vexātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [vexo], <sense id="n38176.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">ill-treated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abused</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">impaired previously</hi> or <hi rend="ital">very much</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">aeger viribus praevexatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 1:1:18" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 1, 1, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praevexatae vires,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:32:166" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Acut. 2, 32, 166</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praevians: <entryFree id="n38177" type="main" key="praevi^ans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-vĭans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [vio], <sense id="n38177.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">going before</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> in Luc. 3, 21</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praeviator: <entryFree id="n38178" type="main" key="praevi^a_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praevĭātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n38178.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a precursor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">herald</hi> (eccl. Lat.), Ven. Fort., v. Hilar. 2, 9.</sense></entryFree>
praevideo: <entryFree id="n38179" type="main" key="praevi^de^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-vĭdĕo</orth>, <itype>vīdi, vīsum, 2</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n38179.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to see first</hi> or <hi rend="ital">beforehand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to foresee.</hi> </sense><sense id="n38179.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">ictum venientem a vertice,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:444" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 444</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">an, quia praevisos in aquā timet hostia cultros?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:327" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 327</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cultri in liquidā praevisi undā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 135</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38179.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, mentally, </sense><sense id="n38179.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To foresee</hi>, <hi rend="ital">anticipate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">discern beforehand</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">de re publicā, quam praevideo in summis periculis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:9:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 9, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praevisā locorum utilitate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec praeviderant impetum hostium milites, nec, si praevidissent, satis virium ad arcendum erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 4, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:20:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 20, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 40</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non tantum praevisa, sed subita expedire,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praevisum periculum subterfugere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:10" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 10</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n38179.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To provide</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">quod ne fieret consilio solerti praevidit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 21, 8, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praevincio: <entryFree id="n38180" type="main" key="praevincio"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-vincio</orth>, <itype>nxi, nctum, 4</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> (postclass.). <sense id="n38180.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to bind before</hi> or <hi rend="ital">in front</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to fetter</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">laqueo praevinctus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:10:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 10, 2</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n38180.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferinis voluptatibus praevinctus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:2:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 2, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praeviridans: <entryFree id="n38181" type="main" key="praevi^ri^dans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-vĭrĭdans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> <etym>virido</etym>, <sense id="n38181.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">being very green</hi> or <hi rend="ital">verdant;</hi> transf., <hi rend="ital">very blooming</hi> or <hi rend="ital">vigorous</hi> (ante-class.), Laber. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praeviridis: <entryFree id="n38182" type="hapax" key="praevi^ri^dis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-vĭrĭdis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n38182.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very green</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">color,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Aquaed. 7" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Aquaed. 7</bibl></cit> dub. (al. perviridis).</sense></entryFree>
praevise: <entryFree id="n38183" type="main" key="praevi_se_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praevīsē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>praevideo</etym>, <sense id="n38183.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">according to expectation</hi> (opp. inopinate), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:in Psa. 63:7" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> in Psa. 63, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praevisus: <entryFree id="n38184" type="main" key="praevi_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praevīsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from praevideo.</entryFree>
praevitio: <entryFree id="n38185" type="main" key="praevi^ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-vĭtĭo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n38185.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to corrupt</hi> or <hi rend="ital">vitiate beforehand</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-class. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">(gurgitem),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex alio morbo praevitiati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 2:1:15" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 2, 1, 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praevius: <entryFree id="n38186" type="main" key="praevi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praevĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>prae-via</etym>, <sense id="n38186.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">going before</hi>, <hi rend="ital">leading the way</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): praevius Aurorae, Solis Noctisque satelles, Cic. Arat. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 65, 9</bibl>: nunc praevius anteit, Ov. <cb n="PRAN" /> M. 11, 65: <cit><quote lang="la">praevia luci Pallantias,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 190</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:485" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 4, 485</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui (luci) praevius est sol,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. Monosyllab. 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 4, 24, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 11, 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praevolo: <entryFree id="n38187" type="main" key="praevo^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-vŏlo</orth>, <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n38187.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to fly before</hi> or <hi rend="ital">in advance</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">grues in tergo praevolantium colla et capita reponunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:49:125" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 49, 125</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquila velut dux viae praevolavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 62</bibl></cit> (but the correct read., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:1:1:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 1, 1, 41</bibl>, is praeolat, v. praeolo).</sense></entryFree>
praevulsus: <entryFree id="n38188" type="main" key="praevulsus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praevulsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from praevello.</entryFree>
pragma: <entryFree id="n38189" type="greek" key="pragma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pragma</orth>, <itype>ătis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">pra=gma</foreign>, <sense id="n38189.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a matter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">affair</hi>, <hi rend="ital">business</hi> (post-class.), Jul. Vict. Art. Rhet. 3, 4.</sense></entryFree>
pragmaticarius: <entryFree id="n38190" type="main" key="pragma^ti^ca_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pragmătĭcārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>pragmaticus</etym>, <sense id="n38190.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who writes down and prepares imperial edicts</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rescripts</hi>, and the like (postclass.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 1, 23, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pragmaticus: <entryFree id="n38191" type="greek" key="pragma^ti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pragmătĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">pragmatiko/s</foreign>, prop., <sense id="n38191.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">skilled in business</hi>, esp. <hi rend="ital">experienced in matters of law</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pragmatici homines omnibus historiis cavere jubent et vetant credere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:20:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 20, 1</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n38191.1" n="I" level="1"> <pos>Subst.</pos> </sense><sense id="n38191.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">pragmătĭcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">pragmatiko/s</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">one skilled in the law</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who furnished orators and advocates with the principles on which they based their speeches</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">itaque illi disertissimi homines (Graeci) ministros habent in causis juris peritos, cum ipsi sint imperitissimi, et qui pragmatici vocantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:59:253" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 59, 253</bibl></cit> (dub.; <cit><quote lang="la">bracketed by B. and K.): oratori pragmaticum adjutorem dare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 59, 253</bibl></cit> (1, 45, 198, written as Greek); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:3:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 3, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:123" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 123</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:17:9" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 17, 9</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38191.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pragmătĭca</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the title of a work by Attius</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:20:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 20, 3</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">perh. the same which is called by Pliny Praxidica and Praxidicum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 1</bibl></cit>, ind. l<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:200" default="NO" valid="yes">18, 24, 55, § 200</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38191.4" n="II" level="1"> <pos>Adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">relating to civil affairs.</hi> So in late jurid. Lat.: <cit><quote lang="la">pragmatica sanctio, or jussio, or annotatio, or constitutio,</quote> <trans><tr>an imperial decree that referred to the affairs of a community</tr>, <tr>a pragmatic sanction</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 1, 2, 10</bibl></cit>; called pragmaticum rescriptum, Aug. Collat. cum Donatist. 3, c. 2; and <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">pragmătĭcum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, Cod. Th. 6, 23, 3; 16, 5, 52.</sense></entryFree>
pramnion: <entryFree id="n38192" type="greek" key="pramni^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pramnĭon</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n38192.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a precious stone</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the darkest kind of rock crystal</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:173" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 63, § 173</bibl> (al. promnium).</sense></entryFree>
pramnium: <entryFree id="n38193" type="main" key="Pramni^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pramnĭum vīnum</orth> = <foreign lang="greek">*pra/mnios oi)=nos</foreign>, <sense id="n38193.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of wine in the neighborhood of Smyrna</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 4, 6, § 54</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
prandeo: <entryFree id="n38194" type="main" key="prande^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prandĕo</orth>, <itype>di</itype> (prandidi, <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 364</bibl>), <itype>sum, 2</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n38194.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [prandium]. </sense><sense id="n38194.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to take breakfast</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to breakfast</hi> (v. prandium; <cit><quote lang="la">class.): hic rex cum aceto pransurus est et sale,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:2:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 2, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prandi in navi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:3:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 2, 3, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prandi perbene,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 9, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caninio consule scito neminem prandisse (because he was elected in the afternoon, and resigned his office on the following morning),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:30:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 30, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic prandete, commilitones, tamquam apud inferos coenaturi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:3:2:3" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 3, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad satietatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:21" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 5, 14, § 56</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">prandebat sibi quisque deus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:46" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 13, 46</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38194.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to breakfast on</hi> any thing, <hi rend="ital">to take as a breakfast</hi> or <hi rend="ital">luncheon;</hi> or, in gen., <hi rend="ital">to eat</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">calidum prandisti prandium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:5:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 3, 5, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">luscinias prandere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:245" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 245</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">olus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 17, 13</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">pransus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">that has breakfasted</hi> (like potus, that has drunk): <cit><quote lang="la">pransus non avide,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:6:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 6, 127</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 5, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pransa Lamia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:340" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 340</bibl></cit>. —Because soldiers were accustomed to eat before an engagement; hence, pransus paratus, or curatus et pransus, of soldiers, <hi rend="ital">fed</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">ready</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fit for fighting</hi>: exercitus pransus, paratus, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:13:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 13, 5</bibl>; Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 459, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut viri equique curati et pransi essent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 14</bibl></cit>: pransus, potus, <hi rend="ital">overfed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gluttonous</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">adde inscitiam pransi, poti, oscitantis ducis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:21:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 21, 56</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
prandiculum: <entryFree id="n38195" type="gloss" key="prandi^cu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prandĭcŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n38195.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">breakfast</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">prandicula antiqui dicebant, quae nunc jentacula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=250" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 250</bibl></cit> Müll.; cf.: prandicula, jentacula, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=251" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 251</bibl> ib.</sense></entryFree>
prandiolum: <entryFree id="n38196" type="main" key="prandi^o^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prandĭŏlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n38196.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small breakfast</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Not. Tir.</author> p. 166</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
